Post";s:4:"slug";s:14:"duplicate-post";s:7:"version";s:5:"3.2.4";s:6:"author";s:46:"<a href="https://lopo.it">Enrico Battocchi</a>";s:14:"author_profile";s:35:"https://profiles.wordpress.org/lopo";s:8:"requires";s:3:"3.6";s:6:"tested";s:3:"5.4";s:12:"requires_php";s:5:"5.2.4";s:13:"compatibility";a:0:{}s:6:"rating";d:98;s:7:"ratings";a:5:{i:5;i:414;i:4;i:9;i:3;i:5;i:2;i:1;i:1;i:7;}s:11:"num_ratings";i:436;s:15:"support_threads";i:10;s:24:"support_threads_resolved";i:1;s:10:"downloaded";i:13758919;s:12:"last_updated";s:21:"2020-03-19 1:26pm GMT";s:5:"added";s:10:"2007-12-05";s:8:"homepage";s:31:"https://duplicate-post.lopo.it/";s:8:"sections";a:5:{s:11:"description";s:3263:"<p>This plugin allows users to clone posts of any type, or copy them to new drafts for further editing.<br />
If you find this useful, <a href="https://duplicate-post.lopo.it/donate/" rel="nofollow ugc"><strong>please consider donating</strong></a> whatever sum you choose, <strong>even just 10 cents</strong>. Just a few cents from every user would help me develop the plugin and improve support.</p>
<p>How it works:</p>
<ol>
<li>
<p>In &#8216;Edit Posts&#8217;/&#8217;Edit Pages&#8217;, you can click on &#8216;Clone&#8217; link below the post/page title: this will immediately create a copy and return to the list.</p>
</li>
<li>
<p>In &#8216;Edit Posts&#8217;/&#8217;Edit Pages&#8217;, you can select one or more items, then choose &#8216;Clone&#8217; in the &#8216;Bulk Actions&#8217; dropdown to copy them all at once.</p>
</li>
<li>
<p>In &#8216;Edit Posts&#8217;/&#8217;Edit Pages&#8217;, you can click on &#8216;New Draft&#8217; link below the post/page title.</p>
</li>
<li>
<p>On the post edit screen, you can click on &#8216;Copy to a new draft&#8217; above &#8220;Cancel&#8221;/&#8221;Move to trash&#8221; or in the admin bar.</p>
</li>
<li>
<p>While viewing a post as a logged in user, you can click on &#8216;Copy to a new draft&#8217; in the admin bar.</p>
</li>
</ol>
<p>3, 4 and 5 will lead to the edit page for the new draft: change what you want, click on &#8216;Publish&#8217; and you&#8217;re done.</p>
<p>There is also a <strong>template tag</strong>, so you can put it in your templates and clone your posts/pages from the front-end. Clicking on the link will lead you to the edit page for the new draft, just like the admin bar link.</p>
<p>Duplicate Post has many useful settings to customize its behavior and restrict its use to certain roles or post types. Check out the extensive documentation on <a href="https://duplicate-post.lopo.it" rel="nofollow ugc">the plugin&#8217;s site</a>.</p>
<p><strong>If you&#8217;re a plugin developer</strong>, I suggest you to read the <a href="https://duplicate-post.lopo.it/docs/developers-guide/" rel="nofollow ugc">Developer&#8217;s Guide</a> to ensure compatibility between your plugin(s) and mine. Feel free to <a href="https://duplicate-post.lopo.it/contact" rel="nofollow ugc">contact me</a> so we can keep in touch and collaborate.</p>
<p>Duplicate Post does not collect any information outside your WordPress installation, therefore it&#8217;s 100% GDPR compliant.</p>
<p>Thanks for all the suggestions, bug reports, translations and donations, they&#8217;re frankly too many to be listed here!</p>
<h3>Contribute</h3>
<p>If you find this useful and if you want to contribute, there are three ways:</p>
<ol>
<li>You can <a href="https://duplicate-post.lopo.it/contact" rel="nofollow ugc">write me</a> and submit your bug reports, suggestions and requests for features;</li>
<li>If you want to translate it to your language (there are just a few lines of text), you can use the <a href="https://translate.wordpress.org/projects/wp-plugins/duplicate-post" rel="nofollow ugc">translation project</a>;</li>
<li>Using the plugin is free, but if you want you can support my efforts by donating with PayPal <a href="https://duplicate-post.lopo.it/donate" rel="nofollow ugc">here</a></li>
</ol>
";s:12:"installation";s:443:"<p>Use WordPress&#8217; Add New Plugin feature, searching &#8220;Duplicate Post&#8221;, or download the archive and:</p>
<ol>
<li>Unzip the archive on your computer  </li>
<li>Upload <code>duplicate-post</code> directory to the <code>/wp-content/plugins/</code> directory</li>
<li>Activate the plugin through the &#8216;Plugins&#8217; menu in WordPress</li>
<li>Go to Settings -&gt; Duplicate Post and customize behaviour as needed</li>
</ol>
";s:3:"faq";s:1659:"
<h4>The plugin doesn&#8217;t work, why?</h4>
<p>
<p>First, check your version of WordPress: the plugin is not supposed to work on old versions anymore. Make sure also to upgrade to the last version of the plugin!</p>
<p>Then try to deactivate and re-activate it, some user have reported that this fixes some problems.</p>
<p>Pay also attention to the &#8220;Permissions&#8221; tab in the Settings: make sure the plugin is enabled for the desired roles and post types.</p>
<p>If it still doesn&#8217;t work, maybe there is some kind of conflict with other plugins: feel free <a href="https://wordpress.org/support/plugin/duplicate-post">to write in the forum</a> and we&#8217;ll try to discover a solution (it will be <em>really</em> helpful if you try to deactivate all your other plugins one by one to see which one conflicts with mine&#8230; But do it only if you know what you&#8217;re doing, I will not be responsible of any problem you may experience).</p>
</p>
<h4>The plugin is not translated in my language!</h4>
<p>
<p>From version 3.0 the plugin&#8217;s translations are managed by the WordPress.org platform and the plugin is shipped without language files, so first of all update translations under Dashboard-&gt;Updates.</p>
<p>If Duplicate Post is still in English, or if there are some untraslated strings, you can help traslating to your language <a href="https://translate.wordpress.org/projects/wp-plugins/duplicate-post" rel="nofollow ugc">here</a>: you only need a WordPress.org account.<br />
<a href="https://duplicate-post.lopo.it/contact" rel="nofollow ugc">Contact me</a> if you wish to become an editor for your language.</p>
</p>

";s:9:"changelog";s:7264:"<h4>3.2.4 (2019-12-10)</h4>
<ul>
<li>Options to show original item in post list (in a column or alongside post states) or in a metabox in the edit screen</li>
<li>Accessibility improvements</li>
<li>Small other fixes</li>
</ul>
<h4>3.2.3 (2019-07-10)</h4>
<ul>
<li>Fixes incompatibility with previous versions of CF7</li>
<li>Now roles without edit_posts capability but having equivalent capability for custom post types can be allowed to copy</li>
<li>Small other fixes to bugs that could lead to incompatibilities with WPML and others</li>
</ul>
<h4>3.2.2 (2018-04-13)</h4>
<ul>
<li>The &#8220;Admin bar&#8221; option shows the link in the post edit screen too, so you can use the plugin with Gutenberg enabled</li>
<li>Option for &#8220;Slug&#8221; not set by default on new installations </li>
<li>Better display of icon in the Admin bar on small screens</li>
</ul>
<h4>3.2.1 (2017-11-25)</h4>
<ul>
<li>Fixing some issues of the 3.* trunk before major redesign</li>
<li>Fixes issue when upgrading on multisite</li>
<li>Improved compatibility with WPML + page builders, thanks to WPML team</li>
<li>Prevents creating a revision immediately after the cloning</li>
</ul>
<h4>3.2 (2017-04-04)</h4>
<ul>
<li>new website with extensive documentation</li>
<li>WPML compatibility, thanks to WPML team</li>
<li>improved Jetpack compatibility (Subscriptions, Markdown)</li>
<li>small changes to hooks</li>
<li>improved security with nonces</li>
<li>various small fixes</li>
</ul>
<h4>3.1.2 (2016-12-13)</h4>
<ul>
<li>Fix for custom fields not copied</li>
</ul>
<h4>3.1.1 (2016-12-13)</h4>
<ul>
<li>Fix for nasty update nag (plus a failsafe checkbox)</li>
</ul>
<h4>3.1 (2016-12-13)</h4>
<ul>
<li>Bulk clone action added (WP 4.7+)</li>
<li>Wildcards enabled for custom fields to skip</li>
<li>Options to copy post author, post format (moved from taxonomies), menu order, post template</li>
<li>Check publish_posts/publish_pages capability to prevent Contributors from publishing by cloning</li>
<li>Using wp_slash (WP 3.6+) or a better workaround (WP 4.4+) on the post and its meta, should also fix some compatibility issues</li>
<li>Check if admin bar is showing before enqueueing CSS</li>
<li>Probable fix for repeated clone bug</li>
<li>Other minor bugs fixed </li>
</ul>
<h4>3.0.3 (2016-10-29)</h4>
<ul>
<li>Notices in admin after copying</li>
<li>Fixes warning in custom post type archives</li>
<li>Uses site options for version and notice</li>
<li>Minor fixes </li>
</ul>
<h4>3.0.2 (2016-10-18)</h4>
<ul>
<li>Can now be enabled for every custom post type with visible UI (not just public ones)</li>
<li>Admin bar CSS only enqueued when needed</li>
<li>New &#8220;Donate&#8221; button</li>
<li>Fixes for minor bugs and typos</li>
</ul>
<h4>3.0.1 (2016-10-09)</h4>
<ul>
<li>Fixes the issues for people upgrading from an older version</li>
</ul>
<h4>3.0 (2016-10-09)</h4>
<ul>
<li>Settings page redesigned</li>
<li>More options to enable/disable copy of every part of a post</li>
<li>Enable/disable cloning for every custom post type</li>
<li>Jetpack Publicize compatibility</li>
<li>Fixed a possible XSS</li>
<li>Fixed other little bugs</li>
<li>Translations removed to use WP.org&#8217;s official translation project</li>
<li>Checked PHP 7 compatibility</li>
</ul>
<h4>2.6 (2014-04-27)</h4>
<ul>
<li>PHP 5.4 (Strict Standards) compatible</li>
<li>Fixed possible XSS and SQL injections</li>
<li>other bugs </li>
<li>Updated and added translations</li>
<li>Tested up to WP 3.8.1</li>
</ul>
<h4>2.4.1 (2014-02-22)</h4>
<ul>
<li>Fixed regression about draft permalinks</li>
<li>Fixed bug with guid</li>
<li>Don&#8217;t clone to_ping and pinged (maybe there will be an option about those later)</li>
</ul>
<h4>2.4 (2012-04-29)</h4>
<ul>
<li>New option to clone the children of the original page</li>
<li>Licence changed to GPLv2 or later</li>
<li>Fixed publishing dates for drafts </li>
<li>Fixed bug with prefix/suffix</li>
<li>Translation project moved to GlotPress</li>
</ul>
<h4>2.3 (2012-04-06)</h4>
<ul>
<li>Added options to choose where to show the &#8220;Clone&#8221; links</li>
<li>Clone attachments (i.e. references in the DB, not physical files) </li>
<li>Fix for untranslated user roles</li>
<li>Some other fixes (missing checks, PHP warnings and errors, etc.)</li>
</ul>
<h4>2.2 (2012-02-01)</h4>
<ul>
<li>Fix for problems when copying serialized meta fields</li>
<li>Fix for multiple _dp_original field</li>
<li>Removed deprecated parameter when adding options</li>
</ul>
<h4>2.1.1 (2012-01-04)</h4>
<ul>
<li>Can&#8217;t rely on activation hook for upgrade, this caused problems with new options</li>
</ul>
<h4>2.1 (2012-01-03)</h4>
<ul>
<li>Even more code cleaning (no more custom queries, using WP API)</li>
<li>Term order preserved when copying</li>
<li>Stopped using deprecated User levels, now it uses Roles and Capabilities</li>
<li>&#8216;Copy to a new draft&#8217; link in admin bar</li>
<li>duplicate_post_get_original template tag</li>
<li>Settings link in plugin list, &#8216;Donate&#8217; and &#8216;Translate&#8217; link in option page</li>
</ul>
<h4>2.0.2 (2011-12-12)</h4>
<ul>
<li>Fixed bug for permalinks</li>
<li>Two links on posts list: clone immediately or copy to a new draft to edit.</li>
<li>Tested on multisite mode.</li>
</ul>
<h4>2.0.1 (2011-12-08)</h4>
<ul>
<li>Fixed bug for action filters</li>
<li>New option so you can choose if cloning from the posts list must copy the post status (draft, published, pending) too.</li>
</ul>
<h4>2.0 (2011-12-08)</h4>
<ul>
<li>WP 3.3 compatibility (still not tested against multiblog feature, so beware)</li>
<li>Minimum WP version: 3.0</li>
<li>Code cleanup</li>
<li>Immediate cloning from post list</li>
<li>Added options for taxonomies and post excerpt</li>
<li>Added suffix option</li>
<li>Added template tag</li>
</ul>
<h4>1.1.2 (2011-04-08)</h4>

<li>WP 3.1.1 compatibility (still not tested against multiblog feature, so beware)</li>

</ul>
<h4>1.1.1 (2010-06-30)</h4>

<h4>1.1 (2010-06-24)</h4>

<h4>1.0 (2010-06-15)</h4>

<ul>
<li>Initial version on WP repository</li>

If you find this useful, <a href="https://duplicate-post.lopo.it/donate/" rel="nofollow ugc"><strong>please consider donating</strong></a> whatever sum you choose, <strong>even just 10 cents</strong>. Just a few cents from every user would help me develop the plugin and improve support.</p>
<p>How it works:</p>
<ol>
<li>
<p>In &#8216;Edit Posts&#8217;/&#8217;Edit Pages&#8217;, you can click on &#8216;Clone&#8217; link below the post/page title: this will immediately create a copy and return to the list.</p>
</li>
<li>
<p>In &#8216;Edit Posts&#8217;/&#8217;Edit Pages&#8217;, you can select one or more items, then choose &#8216;Clone&#8217; in the &#8216;Bulk Actions&#8217; dropdown to copy them all at once.</p>
</li>
<li>
<p>In &#8216;Edit Posts&#8217;/&#8217;Edit Pages&#8217;, you can click on &#8216;New Draft&#8217; link below the post/page title.</p>
</li>
<li>
<p>On the post edit screen, you can click on &#8216;Copy to a new draft&#8217; above &#8220;Cancel&#8221;/&#8221;Move to trash&#8221; or in the admin bar.</p>
</li>
<li>
<p>While viewing a post as a logged in user, you can click on &#8216;Copy to a new draft&#8217; in the admin bar.</p>
</li>
</ol>
<p>3, 4 and 5 will lead to the edit page for the new draft: change what you want, click on &#8216;Publish&#8217; and you&#8217;re done.</p>
<p>There is also a <strong>template tag</strong>, so you can put it in your templates and clone your posts/pages from the front-end. Clicking on the link will lead you to the edit page for the new draft, just like the admin bar link.</p>
<p>Duplicate Post has many useful settings to customize its behavior and restrict its use to certain roles or post types. Check out the extensive documentation on <a href="https://duplicate-post.lopo.it" rel="nofollow ugc">the plugin&#8217;s site</a>.</p>
<p><strong>If you&#8217;re a plugin developer</strong>, I suggest you to read the <a href="https://duplicate-post.lopo.it/docs/developers-guide/" rel="nofollow ugc">Developer&#8217;s Guide</a> to ensure compatibility between your plugin(s) and mine. Feel free to <a href="https://duplicate-post.lopo.it/contact" rel="nofollow ugc">contact me</a> so we can keep in touch and collaborate.</p>
<p>Duplicate Post does not collect any information outside your WordPress installation, therefore it&#8217;s 100% GDPR compliant.</p>
<p>Thanks for all the suggestions, bug reports, translations and donations, they&#8217;re frankly too many to be listed here!</p>
<h3>Contribute</h3>
<p>If you find this useful and if you want to contribute, there are three ways:</p>
<ol>
<li>You can <a href="https://duplicate-post.lopo.it/contact" rel="nofollow ugc">write me</a> and submit your bug reports, suggestions and requests for features;</li>
<li>If you want to translate it to your language (there are just a few lines of text), you can use the <a href="https://translate.wordpress.org/projects/wp-plugins/duplicate-post" rel="nofollow ugc">translation project</a>;</li>
<li>Using the plugin is free, but if you want you can support my efforts by donating with PayPal <a href="https://duplicate-post.lopo.it/donate" rel="nofollow ugc">here</a></li>
</ol>

href="http://www.wordfence.com/">Wordfence</a>";s:14:"author_profile";s:39:"https://profiles.wordpress.org/mmaunder";s:8:"requires";s:3:"3.9";s:6:"tested";s:3:"5.4";s:12:"requires_php";s:3:"5.3";s:13:"compatibility";a:0:{}s:6:"rating";d:96;s:7:"ratings";a:5:{i:5;i:3222;i:4;i:78;i:3;i:45;i:2;i:26;i:1;i:145;}s:11:"num_ratings";i:3516;s:15:"support_threads";i:347;s:24:"support_threads_resolved";i:222;s:10:"downloaded";i:154532164;s:12:"last_updated";s:21:"2020-03-27 5:29pm GMT";s:5:"added";s:10:"2012-04-21";s:8:"homepage";s:25:"http://www.wordfence.com/";s:8:"sections";a:5:{s:11:"description";s:3864:"<h3>THE MOST POPULAR WORDPRESS FIREWALL &amp; SECURITY SCANNER</h3>
<p>Wordfence includes an endpoint firewall and malware scanner that were built from the ground up to protect WordPress. Our Threat Defense Feed arms Wordfence with the newest firewall rules, malware signatures and malicious IP addresses it needs to keep your website safe. Rounded out by 2FA and a suite of additional features, Wordfence is the most comprehensive WordPress security solution available.</p>
<h4>WORDPRESS FIREWALL</h4>
<ul>
<li>Web Application Firewall identifies and blocks malicious traffic. Built and maintained by a large team focused 100% on WordPress security.</li>
<li>[Premium] Real-time firewall rule and malware signature updates via the Threat Defense Feed (free version is delayed by 30 days).</li>
<li>[Premium] Real-time IP Blacklist blocks all requests from the most malicious IPs, protecting your site while reducing load.</li>
<li>Protects your site at the endpoint, enabling deep integration with WordPress. Unlike cloud alternatives does not break encryption, cannot be bypassed and cannot leak data.</li>
<li>Integrated malware scanner blocks requests that include malicious code or content.</li>
<li>Protection from brute force attacks by limiting login attempts.</li>
</ul>
<h4>WORDPRESS SECURITY SCANNER</h4>
<ul>
<li>Malware scanner checks core files, themes and plugins for malware, bad URLs, backdoors, SEO spam, malicious redirects and code injections.</li>
<li>[Premium] Real-time malware signature updates via the Threat Defense Feed (free version is delayed by 30 days).</li>
<li>Compares your core files, themes and plugins with what is in the WordPress.org repository, checking their integrity and reporting any changes to you.</li>
<li>Repair files that have changed by overwriting them with a pristine, original version. Delete any files that don’t belong easily within the Wordfence interface.</li>
<li>Checks your site for known security vulnerabilities and alerts you to any issues. Also alerts you to potential security issues when a plugin has been closed or abandoned.</li>
<li>Checks your content safety by scanning file contents, posts and comments for dangerous URLs and suspicious content.</li>
<li>[Premium] Checks to see if your site or IP have been blacklisted for malicious activity, generating spam or other security issue.</li>
</ul>
<h4>LOGIN SECURITY</h4>
<ul>
<li>Two-factor authentication (2FA), one of the most secure forms of remote system authentication available via any TOTP-based authenticator app or service.</li>
<li>Login Page CAPTCHA stops bots from logging in.</li>
<li>Disable or add 2FA to XML-RPC.</li>
<li>Block logins for administrators using known compromised passwords.</li>
</ul>
<h4>WORDFENCE CENTRAL</h4>
<ul>
<li>Wordfence Central is a powerful and efficient way to manage the security for multiple sites in one place.</li>
<li>Efficiently assess the security status of all your websites in one view. View detailed security findings without leaving Wordfence Central.</li>
<li>Powerful templates make configuring Wordfence a breeze.</li>
<li>Highly configurable alerts can be delivered via email, SMS or Slack. Improve the signal to noise ratio by leveraging severity level options and a daily digest option.</li>
<li>Track and alert on important security events including administrator logins, breached password usage and surges in attack activity.</li>
<li>Free to use for unlimited sites.</li>
</ul>
<h4>SECURITY TOOLS</h4>
<ul>
<li>With Live Traffic, monitor visits and hack attempts not shown in other analytics packages in real time; including origin, their IP address, the time of day and time spent on your site.</li>
<li>Block attackers by IP or build advanced rules based on IP Range, Hostname, User Agent and Referrer. </li>
<li>Country blocking available with Wordfence Premium.</li>
</ul>
";s:12:"installation";s:2161:"<p>Secure your website using the following steps to install Wordfence:</p>
<ol>
<li>Install Wordfence automatically or by uploading the ZIP file. </li>
<li>Activate the Wordfence through the &#8216;Plugins&#8217; menu in WordPress. Wordfence is now activated.</li>
<li>Go to the scan menu and start your first scan. Scheduled scanning will also be enabled.</li>
<li>Once your first scan has completed, a list of threats will appear. Go through them one by one to secure your site.</li>
<li>Visit the Wordfence options page to enter your email address so that you can receive email security alerts.</li>
<li>Optionally, change your security level or adjust the advanced options to set individual scanning and protection options for your site.</li>
<li>Click the &#8220;Live Traffic&#8221; menu option to watch your site activity in real-time. Situational awareness is an important part of website security.</li>
</ol>
<p>To install Wordfence on WordPress Multi-Site installations:</p>
<ol>
<li>Install Wordfence via the plugin directory or by uploading the ZIP file.</li>
<li>Network Activate Wordfence. This step is important because until you network activate it, your sites will see the plugin option on their plugins menu. Once activated that option disappears. </li>
<li>Now that Wordfence is network activated it will appear on your Network Admin menu. Wordfence will not appear on any individual site&#8217;s menu. </li>
<li>Go to the &#8220;Scan&#8221; menu and start your first scan. </li>
<li>Wordfence will do a scan of all files in your WordPress installation including those in the blogs.dir directory of your individual sites. </li>
<li>Live Traffic will appear for ALL sites in your network. If you have a heavily trafficked system you may want to disable live traffic which will stop logging to the DB. </li>
<li>Firewall rules and login rules apply to the WHOLE system. So if you fail a login on site1.example.com and site2.example.com it counts as 2 failures. Crawler traffic is counted between blogs, so if you hit three sites in the network, all the hits are totalled and that counts as the rate you&#8217;re accessing the system.</li>
</ol>
";s:3:"faq";s:11208:"<p><a href="https://wordfence.com/help/" rel="nofollow ugc">Visit our website to access our official documentation which includes security feature descriptions, common solutions and comprehensive help.</a></p>

<h4>How does Wordfence Security protect sites from attackers?</h4>
<p>
<p>The WordPress security plugin provides the best protection available for your website. Powered by the constantly updated Threat Defense Feed, Wordfence Firewall stops you from getting hacked. Wordfence Scan leverages the same proprietary feed, alerting you quickly about security issues or if your site is compromised. The Live Traffic view gives you real-time visibility into traffic and hack attempts on your website. A deep set of additional tools round out the most comprehensive WordPress security solution available.</p>
</p>
<h4>What features does Wordfence Premium enable?</h4>
<p>
<p>We offer a Premium API key that gives you real-time updates to the Threat Defense Feed which includes a real-time IP blacklist, firewall rules, and malware signatures. Premium support, country blocking, more frequent scans, and spam and spamvertising checks are also included. <a href="http://www.wordfence.com/" rel="nofollow ugc">Click here to sign-up for Wordfence Premium now</a> or simply install Wordfence free and start protecting your website.</p>
</p>
<h4>How does the Wordfence WordPress Firewall protect websites?</h4>
<p>
<ul>
<li>Web Application Firewall stops you from getting hacked by identifying malicious traffic, blocking attackers before they can access your website.</li>
<li>Threat Defense Feed automatically updates firewall rules that protect you from the latest threats. Premium members receive the real-time version.</li>
<li>Block common WordPress security threats like fake Googlebots, malicious scans from hackers and botnets.</li>
</ul>
</p>
<h4>What checks does the Wordfence Security Scanner perform?</h4>
<p>
<ul>
<li>Scans core files, themes and plugins against WordPress.org repository versions to check their integrity. Verify security of your source.</li>
<li>See how files have changed. Optionally repair changed files that are security threats.</li>
<li>Scans for signatures of over 44,000 known malware variants that are known WordPress security threats.</li>
<li>Scans for many known backdoors that create security holes including C99, R57, RootShell, Crystal Shell, Matamu, Cybershell, W4cking, Sniper, Predator, Jackal, Phantasma, GFS, Dive, Dx and many more.</li>
<li>Continuously scans for malware and phishing URL’s including all URLs on the Google Safe Browsing List in all your comments, posts and files that are security threats.</li>
<li>Scans for heuristics of backdoors, trojans, suspicious code and other security issues.</li>
</ul>
</p>
<h4>What security monitoring features does Wordfence include?</h4>
<p>
<ul>
<li>See all your traffic in real-time, including robots, humans, 404 errors, logins and logouts and who is consuming most of your content. Enhances your situational awareness of which security threats your site is facing.</li>
<li>A real-time view of all traffic including automated bots that often constitute security threats that Javascript analytics packages never show you.</li>
<li>Real-time traffic includes reverse DNS and city-level geolocation. Know which geographic area security threats originate from.</li>
<li>Monitors disk space which is related to security because many DDoS attacks attempt to consume all disk space to create denial of service.</li>
</ul>
</p>
<h4>What login security features are included</h4>
<p>
<ul>
<li>See all your traffic in real-time, including robots, humans, 404 errors, logins and logouts and who is consuming most of your content. Enhances your situational awareness of which security threats your site is facing.</li>
<li>A real-time view of all traffic including automated bots that often constitute security threats that Javascript analytics packages never show you.</li>
<li>Real-time traffic includes reverse DNS and city-level geolocation. Know which geographic area security threats originate from.</li>
<li>Monitors disk space which is related to security because many DDoS attacks attempt to consume all disk space to create denial of service.</li>
</ul>
</p>
<h4>How will I be alerted if my site has a security problem?</h4>
<p>
<p>Wordfence sends security alerts via email. Once you install Wordfence, you will configure a list of email addresses where security alerts will be sent. When you receive a security alert, make sure you deal with it promptly to ensure your site stays secure.</p>
</p>
<h4>Do I need a security plugin like Wordfence if I’m using a cloud based firewall (WAF)?</h4>
<p>
<p>Wordfence provides true endpoint security for your WordPress website. Unlike cloud based firewalls, Wordfence executes within the WordPress environment, giving it knowledge like whether the user is signed in, their identity and what access level they have. Wordfence uses the user’s access level in more than 80% of the firewall rules it uses to protect WordPress websites. Learn more about the <a href="https://www.wordfence.com/blog/2016/10/endpoint-vs-cloud-security-cloud-waf-user-identity-problem/" rel="nofollow ugc">Cloud WAF identity problem here</a>. Additionally, cloud based firewalls can be bypassed, leaving your site exposed to attackers. Because Wordfence is an integral part of the endpoint (your WordPress website), it can’t be bypassed. Learn more about the <a href="https://www.wordfence.com/blog/2016/10/endpoint-vs-cloud-security-cloud-waf-bypass-problem/" rel="nofollow ugc">Cloud WAF bypass problem here</a>. To fully protect the investment you’ve made in your website you need to employ a defense in depth approach to security. Wordfence takes this approach.</p>
</p>
<h4>What blocking features does Wordfence include?</h4>
<p>
<ul>
<li>Real-time blocking of known attackers. If another site using Wordfence is attacked and blocks the attacker, your site is automatically protected.</li>
<li>Block entire malicious networks. Includes advanced IP and Domain WHOIS to report malicious IP’s or networks and block entire networks using the firewall. Report WordPress security threats to network owner.</li>
<li>Rate limit or block WordPress security threats like aggressive crawlers, scrapers and bots doing security scans for vulnerabilities in your site.</li>
<li>Choose whether you want to block or throttle users and robots who break your WordPress security rules.</li>
<li>Premium users can also block countries and schedule scans for specific times and a higher frequency.</li>
</ul>
</p>
<h4>What differentiates Wordfence from other WordPress Security plugins?</h4>
<p>
<ul>
<li>Wordfence Security provides a WordPress Firewall developed specifically for WordPress and blocks attackers looking for vulnerabilities on your site.  The Firewall is powered by our Threat Defense Feed which is continually updated as new threats emerge.  Premium customers receive updates in real-time.</li>
<li>Wordfence verifies your website source code integrity against the official WordPress repository and shows you the changes. </li>
<li>Wordfence scans check all your files, comments and posts for URLs in Google&#8217;s Safe Browsing list. We are the only plugin to offer this very important security enhancement.</li>
<li>Wordfence scans do not consume large amounts of your bandwidth because all security scans happen on your web server which makes them very fast.</li>
<li>Wordfence fully supports WordPress Multi-Site which means you can security scan every blog in your Multi-Site installation with one click.</li>
<li>Wordfence includes Two-Factor authentication, the most secure way to stop brute force attackers in their tracks.</li>
<li>Wordfence fully supports IPv6 including giving you the ability to look up the location of IPv6 addresses, block IPv6 ranges, detect IPv6 country and do a whois lookup on IPv6 addresses and more.</li>
</ul>
</p>
<h4>Will Wordfence slow down my website?</h4>
<p>
<p>No. Wordfence Security is extremely fast and uses techniques like caching its own configuration data to avoid database lookups and blocking malicious attacks that would slow down your site.</p>
</p>
<h4>What if my site has already been hacked?</h4>
<p>
<p>Wordfence Security is able to repair core files, themes and plugins on sites where security is already compromised. You can follow this guide on <a href="https://www.wordfence.com/docs/how-to-clean-a-hacked-wordpress-site-using-wordfence/" rel="nofollow ugc">how to clean a hacked website</a> using Wordfence. However, please note that site security cannot be assured unless you do a full reinstall if your site has been hacked. We recommend you only use Wordfence Security to get your site into a running state in order to recover the data you need to do a full reinstall. If you need help repairing a hacked site, we offer an affordable, high-quality <a href="https://www.wordfence.com/wordfence-site-cleanings/" rel="nofollow ugc">site cleaning service</a> that includes a Premium key for a year.</p>
</p>
<h4>Does Wordfence Security support IPv6?</h4>
<p>
<p>Yes. We fully support IPv6 with all security functions including country blocking, range blocking, city lookup, whois lookup and all other security functions. If you are not running IPv6, Wordfence will work great on your site too. We are fully compatible with both IPv4 and IPv6 whether you run both or only one addressing scheme.</p>
</p>
<h4>Does Wordfence Security support Multi-Site installations?</h4>
<p>
<p>Yes. WordPress Multi-Site is fully supported. Using Wordfence you can scan every blog in your network for malware with one click. If one of your customers posts a page or post with a known malware URL that threatens your whole domain with being blacklisted by Google, we will alert you in the next scan.</p>
</p>
<h4>What support options are available for Wordfence users?</h4>
<p>
<p>Providing excellent customer service is very important to us.  We offer help to all our customers whether you are using the Premium or free version of Wordfence.  For help with the free version, you can post in our <a href="https://wordpress.org/support/plugin/wordfence">forum</a> where we have dedicated staff responding to questions. If you need faster or more in-depth help, Premium customers can submit a <a href="https://support.wordfence.com/support/home" rel="nofollow ugc">support ticket</a> to our Premium support team.</p>
</p>
<h4>Where can I learn more about WordPress security?</h4>
<p>
<p>Designed for every skill level, <a href="https://www.wordfence.com/learn/" rel="nofollow ugc">The WordPress Security Learning Center</a> is dedicated to deepening users’ understanding of security best practices by providing free access to entry-level articles, in-depth articles, videos, industry survey results, graphics and more.</p>
</p>
<h4>Where can I find the Wordfence Terms of Use and Privacy Policy?</h4>
<p>
<p>These are available on our website: <a href="https://www.wordfence.com/terms-of-use/" rel="nofollow ugc">Terms of Use</a> and <a href="https://www.wordfence.com/privacy-policy/" rel="nofollow ugc">Privacy Policy</a></p>
</p>

";s:9:"changelog";s:72146:"<h4>7.4.6 &#8211; February 12, 2020</h4>
<ul>
<li>Improvement: Enhanced the detection ability of the WAF for SQLi attacks.</li>
<li>Improvement: Updated the bundled GeoIP database.</li>
<li>Improvement: Modified some country names in the block configuration to align with those shown in Live Traffic.</li>
<li>Change: Moved the skipped files scan check to the Server State category.</li>
<li>Fix: Fixed an issue where after scrolling on the Live Traffic page, updates would no longer automatically load.</li>
<li>Fix: Modified the number of login records kept to align better with Live Traffic so they&#8217;re trimmed around the same time.</li>
</ul>
<h4>7.4.5 &#8211; January 15, 2020</h4>
<ul>
<li>Improvement: Improved WAF coverage for an Infinite WP authentication bypass vulnerability.</li>
</ul>
<h4>7.4.4 &#8211; January 14, 2020</h4>
<ul>
<li>Fix: Fixed a UI issue where the scan summary status marker for malware didn&#8217;t always match the findings.</li>
</ul>
<h4>7.4.3 &#8211; January 13, 2020</h4>
<ul>
<li>Improvement: Added WAF coverage for an Infinite WP authentication bypass vulnerability.</li>
<li>Improvement: The malicious URL scan now includes protocol-relative URLs (e.g., //example.com)</li>
<li>Improvement: Malware signatures are now better applied to large files read in multiple passes.</li>
<li>Improvement: Added a scan issue that will appear when one or more paths are skipped due to scan settings excluding them.</li>
<li>Changed: AJAX endpoints now send the application/json Content-Type header.</li>
<li>Changed: Updated text on scan issues for plugins removed from wordpress.org to better indicate possible reasons.</li>
<li>Changed: Added compatibility messaging for reCAPTCHA when WooCommerce is active.</li>
<li>Fixed: Added missing $wp_query-&gt;set_404() call when outputting a 404 page on a custom action.</li>
<li>Fixed: Fixed the logout username display in Live Traffic broken by a change in WordPress 5.3.</li>
<li>Fixed: Improved the response callback used for the WAF status check during extended protection installation.</li>
<li>Fixed: The &#8220;Require 2FA for all administrators&#8221; notice is now automatically dismissed if an administrator sets up 2FA.</li>
</ul>
<h4>7.4.2 &#8211; December 3, 2019</h4>
<ul>
<li>Improvement: Increased performance of IP CIDR range comparisons.</li>
<li>Improvement: Added parameter signature to remote scanning for better validation during forking.</li>
<li>Change: Removed duplicate browser label in Live Traffic.</li>
<li>Fix: Added compensation for PHP 7.4 deprecation notice with get_magic_quotes_gpc.</li>
<li>Fix: Fixed potential notice in dashboard widget when no updates are found.</li>
<li>Fix: Updated JS hashing library to compensate for a variable name collision that could occur.</li>
<li>Fix: Fixed an issue where certain symlinks could cause a scan to erroneously skip files.</li>
<li>Fix: Fixed PHP memory test for newer PHP versions whose optimizations prevented it from allocating memory as desired.</li>
</ul>
<h4>7.4.1 &#8211; November 6, 2019</h4>
<ul>
<li>Improvement: Updated the bundled GeoIP database.</li>
<li>Improvement: Minor changes to ensure compatibility with PHP 7.4.</li>
<li>Improvement: Updated the WHOIS lookup for better reliability.</li>
<li>Improvement: Added better diagnostic data when the WAF MySQL storage engine is active.</li>
<li>Improvement: Improved the messaging when switching between premium and free licenses.</li>
<li>Change: Deprecated DNS changes scan.</li>
<li>Change: The plugin will no longer email alerts when Central is managing them.</li>
<li>Fix: Added error suppression to ignore_user_abort calls to silence it on hosts with it disabled.</li>
<li>Fix: Improved path generation to better avoid outputting extra slashes in URLs.</li>
<li>Fix: Applied a length limit to malware reporting to avoid failures due to large content size.</li>
</ul>
<h4>7.4.0 &#8211; August 22, 2019</h4>
<ul>
<li>Improvement: Added a MySQL-based configuration and data storage for the WAF to expand the number of hosting environments supported. For more detail, see: https://www.wordfence.com/help/firewall/mysqli-storage-engine/</li>
<li>Improvement: Updated bundled GeoIP database.</li>
<li>Fix: Fixed several console notices when running via the CLI.</li>
</ul>
<h4>7.3.6 &#8211; July 31, 2019</h4>
<ul>
<li>Improvement: Multiple &#8220;php.ini file in core directory&#8221; issues are now consolidated into a single issue for clearer scan results.</li>
<li>Improvement: The AJAX error detection for false positive WAF blocks now better detects and processes the response for presenting the whitelisting prompt.</li>
<li>Improvement: Added overdue cron detection and highlighting to diagnostics to help identify issues.</li>
<li>Improvement: Added the necessary directives to exclude backwards compatibility code from creating warnings with phpcs for future compatibility with WP Tide.</li>
<li>Improvement: Normalized all PHP require/include calls to use full paths for better code quality.</li>
<li>Change: Removed deprecated high sensitivity scan option since current signatures are more accurate.</li>
<li>Fix: Fixed the status circle tooltips not showing.</li>
<li>Fix: IP detection at the WAF level better mirrors the main plugin exactly when using the automatic setting.</li>
<li>Fix: Fixed a currently-unused code path in email address verification for the strict check.</li>
</ul>
<h4>7.3.5 &#8211; July 16, 2019</h4>
<ul>
<li>Improvement: Improved tagging of the login endpoint for brute force protection.</li>
<li>Improvement: Added additional information about reCAPTCHA to its setting control.</li>
<li>Improvement: Added a constant that may be overridden to customize the expiration time of login verification email links.</li>
<li>Improvement: reCAPTCHA keys are now tested on saving to prevent accidentally inputting a v2 key.</li>
<li>Improvement: Added a setting to control the reCAPTCHA human/bot threshold.</li>
<li>Improvement: Added a separate option to trigger removal of Login Security tables and data on deactivation.</li>
<li>Improvement: Reworked the reCAPTCHA implementation to trigger the token check on login/registration form submission to avoid the token expiring.</li>
<li>Fix: Widened the reCAPTCHA key fields to allow the full keys to be visible.</li>
<li>Fix: Fixed encoding of the ellipsis character when reporting malware finds.</li>
<li>Fix: Disabling the IP blacklist once again correctly clears the block cache.</li>
<li>Fix: Addressed an issue when outbound UDP connections are blocked where the NTP check could log an error.</li>
<li>Fix: Added handling for reCAPTCHA&#8217;s JavaScript failing to load, which previously blocked logging in.</li>
<li>Fix: Fixed the functionality of the button to send 2FA grace period notifications.</li>
<li>Fix: Fixed a missing icon for some help links when running in standalone mode.</li>
</ul>
<h4>7.3.4 &#8211; June 17, 2019</h4>
<ul>
<li>Improvement: Added security events and alerting features built into Wordfence Central.</li>
</ul>
<h4>7.3.3 &#8211; June 11, 2019</h4>
<ul>
<li>Improvement: Added support for managing the login security settings to Wordfence Central.</li>
<li>Improvement: Updated the bundled root CA certificate store.</li>
<li>Improvement: Added a check and update flow for mod_php hosts with only the PHP5 directive set for the WAF&#8217;s extended protection mode.</li>
<li>Improvement: Added additional values to Diagnostics for debugging time-related issues, the new fatal error handler settings, and updated the PHP version check to reflect the new 5.6.20 requirement of WordPress.</li>
<li>Change: Changed the autoloader for our copy of sodium_compat to always load after WordPress core does.</li>
<li>Fix: Fixed the &#8220;removed from wordpress.org&#8221; detection for plugin, which was broken due to an API change.</li>
<li>Fix: Fixed the bulk repair function in the scan results when it included core files.</li>
</ul>
<h4>7.3.2 &#8211; May 16, 2019</h4>
<ul>
<li>Improvement: Updated sodium_compat to address an incompatibility that may occur with the pending WordPress 5.2.1 update.</li>
<li>Improvement: Clarified text around the reCAPTCHA setting to indicate v3 keys must be used.</li>
<li>Improvement: Added detection for Jetpack and a notice when XML-RPC authentication is disabled.</li>
<li>Fix: Suppressed error messages on the NTP time check to compensate for hosts with UDP connections disabled.</li>
</ul>
<h4>7.3.1 &#8211; May 14, 2019</h4>
<ul>
<li>Improvement: Two-factor authentication is new and improved, now available on all Premium and Free installations.</li>
<li>Improvement: Added Google reCAPTCHA v3 support to the login and registration forms.</li>
<li>Improvement: XML-RPC authentication may now be disabled or forced to require 2FA.</li>
<li>Improvement: Reduced size of SVG assets.</li>
<li>Improvement: Clarified text on &#8220;Maximum execution time for each scan stage&#8221; option.</li>
<li>Improvement: Added detection for an additional config file that may be created and publicly visible on some hosts.</li>
<li>Improvement: Improved detection for malformed malware scanning signatures.</li>
<li>Change: Long-deprecated database tables will be removed.</li>
<li>Change: Removed old performance logging code that&#8217;s no longer used.</li>
<li>Fix: Addressed a log notice when using the See Recent Traffic feature in Live Traffic.</li>
<li>Fix: WAF attack data now correctly includes JSON payloads when appropriate.</li>
<li>Fix: Fixed the text for Live Traffic entries that include a redirection message.</li>
<li>Fix: Fixed an issue with synchronizing scan issues to Wordfence Central that prevented stale issues from being cleared.</li>
</ul>
<h4>7.2.5 &#8211; April 18, 2019</h4>
<ul>
<li>Improvement: Added additional data breach records to the breached password check.</li>
<li>Improvement: Added the Accept-Encoding compression header to WAF-related requests for better performance during rule updates.</li>
<li>Improvement: Updated to the current GeoIP database.</li>
<li>Improvement: Added additional controls to the Wordfence Central connection page to better reflect the current connection state.</li>
<li>Change: Updated the text on the option to alert for scan results of a certain severity.</li>
</ul>
<h4>7.2.4 &#8211; March 26, 2019</h4>
<ul>
<li>Improvement: Updated vulnerability database integration.</li>
<li>Improvement: Better messaging when a WAF rule update fails to better indicate the cause.</li>
<li>Fix: Removed a double slash that could occur in an image path.</li>
<li>Fix: Adjusted timeouts to improve reliability of WAF rule updates on slower servers.</li>
<li>Fix: Improved connection process with Wordfence Central for better reliability on servers with non-standard paths.</li>
<li>Fix: Switched to autoloader with fastMult enabled on sodum_compat to minimize connection issues.</li>
</ul>
<h4>7.2.3 &#8211; February 28, 2019</h4>
<ul>
<li>Improvement: Country names are now shown instead of two letter codes where appropriate.</li>
<li>Improvement: Updated the service whitelist to reflect additions to the Facebook IP ranges.</li>
<li>Improvement: Added alerting for when the WAF is disabled for any reason.</li>
<li>Improvement: Additional alerting and troubleshooting steps for WAF configuration issues.</li>
<li>Change: Live Traffic human/bot status will additionally be based on the browscap record in security-only mode.</li>
<li>Change: Added dismissible prompt to switch Live Traffic to security-only mode.</li>
<li>Fix: The scan issues alerting option is now set correctly for new installations.</li>
<li>Fix: Fixed a transparency issue with flags for Switzerland and Nepal.</li>
<li>Fix: Fixed the malware link image rendering in scan issue emails and switched to always use https.</li>
<li>Fix: WAF-related scheduled tasks are now more resilient to connection timeouts or memory issues.</li>
<li>Fix: Fixed Wordfence Central connection flow within the first time experience.</li>
</ul>
<h4>7.2.2 &#8211; February 14, 2019</h4>
<ul>
<li>Improvement: Updated GeoIP database.</li>
<li>Fix: Syncing requests from Wordfence Central no longer appear in Live Traffic.</li>
<li>Fix: Addressed some display issues with the Wordfence Central panel on the Wordfence Dashboard.</li>
</ul>

<li>Fix: Changed WAF file handling to skip some file actions if running via the CLI.</li>
<li>Fix: Fixed an issue that could prevent files beginning with a period from working with the file restore function.</li>
<li>Fix: Improved layout of options page controls on small screens.</li>
<li>Fix: Fixed a typo in the htaccess update panel.</li>
<li>Fix: Added compensation for Windows path separators in the WAF config handling.</li>

<li>Fix: Better messaging by the status circles when the WAF config is inaccessible or corrupt.</li>

</ul>

<li>Improvement: Hardening for sites on servers with insecure configuration, which should not be enabled on publicly accessible servers. Thanks Janek Vind.</li>
<li>Change: Switched the minimum PHP version to 5.3.</li>
<li>Fix: Prevent bypass of author enumeration prevention by using invalid parameters. Thanks Janek Vind.</li>
<li>Fix: Wordfence crons will now automatically reschedule if missing for any reason.</li>
<li>Fix: Fixed an issue where the block counts and total IPs blocked values on the dashboard might not agree.</li>

<li>Change: Reworked Live Traffic/Rate Limiting human and bot detection to function without cookies.</li>

<li>Change: Better debug messaging for scan forking.</li>
<li>Fix: PHP deprecation notices no longer suppress those of old OpenSSL or WordPress.</li>
<li>Fix: Fixes to the deprecated OpenSSL version detection and alerting to handle non-patch version numbers.</li>
<li>Fix: Added detection for and fixed a very large pcre.backtrack_limit setting that could cause scans to fail, when modified by other plugins.</li>
<li>Fix: Scan issue alert emails no longer incorrectly show high sensitivity was enabled.</li>
<li>Fix: Fixed wrapping of long strings on the Diagnostics page.</li>
</ul>
<h4>7.1.3 &#8211; April 18, 2018</h4>
<ul>
<li>Improvement: Improved the performance of our config table status check.</li>
<li>Improvement: The IP address of the user activating Wordfence is now used by the breached password check until an admin successfully logs in.</li>
<li>Improvement: Added several new error displays for scan failures to help diagnose and fix issues.</li>
<li>Improvement: Added the block duration to alerts generated when an IP is blocked.</li>
<li>Improvement: A text version of scan results is now included in the activity log email.</li>
<li>Improvement: The WAF install/uninstall process no longer asks to backup files that do not exist.</li>
<li>Change: Began a phased rollout of moving brute force queries to be https-only.</li>
<li>Change: Added the initial deprecation notice for PHP 5.2.</li>
<li>Change: Suppressed a script tag on the diagnostics page from being output in the email version.</li>
<li>Fix: Addressed an issue where plugins that return a null user during authentication would cause a PHP notice to be logged.</li>
<li>Fix: Fixed an issue where plugins that use non-standard version formatting could end up with a inaccurate vulnerability status.</li>
<li>Fix: Added a workaround for web email clients that erroneously encode some URL characters (e.g., #).</li>
</ul>

<li>Improvement: Added a dedicated error display that will show when a scan is detected as failed.</li>

<li>Improvement: When the license status changes, it now triggers a fresh pull of the WAF rules.</li>
<li>Improvement: Added dedicated messaging for leftover WordPress core files that were not fully removed during upgrade.</li>
<li>Improvement: Improved labeling in Live Traffic for hits blocked by the real-time IP blacklist.</li>

<li>Fix: Removed an old reference to the pre-Wordfence 7.1 lockouts table.</li>
<li>Fix: Scan results for malware detections in posts are no longer clickable.</li>
<li>Fix: We now verify that there&#8217;s a valid email address defined before attempting to send an alert and filter out any invalid ones.</li>
<li>Fix: Added a workaround for GoDaddy/Limit Login Attempts suppressing the 2FA prompting.</li>
</ul>
<h4>7.1.1 &#8211; March 20, 2018</h4>

<li>Improvement: Added short-term caching of breach check results.</li>
<li>Improvement: The check for passwords leaked in breaches now allows a login if the user has previously logged in from the same IP successfully and displays an admin notice suggesting changing the password.</li>
<li>Improvement: Switched the bundled select2 library to use to prefixed version to work around other plugins including older versions on our pages.</li>
<li>Improvement: The scan page now displays when beta signatures are enabled since they can produce false positives.</li>
<li>Improvement: Improved positioning of the &#8220;Wordfence is Working&#8221; message.</li>
<li>Improvement: Added a character limit to the reason on blocks and forced wrapping to avoid the layout stretching too much.</li>
<li>Fix: Fixed an issue with some table prefixing where multisite installations with rare configurations could result in unknown table warnings.</li>
<li>Fix: Removed an older behavior with live traffic buttons that could allow them to open in a new tab and show nothing.</li>
<li>Fix: Added a check for sites with inaccurate disk space function results to avoid showing an issue.</li>
<li>Fix: Added a secondary check to the email summary cron to avoid repeated sending if the cron list is corrupted.</li>
<li>Fix: Fixed a typo on the Advanced Comment Spam Filter page.</li>
</ul>

<li>Improvement: The country blocking selection drawer behavior has been changed to now allow saving directly from it.</li>

<li>Improvement: The URL blacklist check now includes additional variants in some checks to more accurately match.</li>

<li>Change: Permanent blocks now display &#8220;Permanent&#8221; rather than &#8220;Indefinite&#8221; for the expiration for consistency.</li>
<li>Fix: Fixed the initial status code recorded for lockouts and blocks.</li>

<li>Fix: Addressed a PHP warning that could occur if wordpress.org returned a certain format for the abandoned plugin check.</li>
<li>Fix: Fixed a possible PHP notice when syncing attack data records without metadata attached.</li>
<li>Fix: Modified the behavior of the disk space check to avoid a scan warning showing without an issue generated.</li>
<li>Fix: Fixed a CSS glitch where the top controls could have extra space at the top when sites have long navigation menus.</li>
<li>Fix: Updated some wording in the All Options search box.</li>

<li>Change: Statistics that do not depend on the WAF for their data now display when it is in learning mode.</li>
<li>Change: Scan issues that are indicative of a compromised site are moved to the top of the list.</li>
<li>Change: Changed styling on unselected checkboxes.</li>
<li>Fix: Quick scans no longer run daily if automatic scheduled scans are disabled.</li>
<li>Fix: The update check in a quick scan no longer runs if the update check has been turned off for regular scans.</li>
<li>Fix: Fixed the quick navigation letters in the country picker not scrolling.</li>
<li>Fix: Fixed editing the country block configuration when there are a large number of other blocks.</li>
<li>Fix: Addressed an issue where having the country block or a pattern block selected when clicking Make Permanent could break them.</li>
<li>Fix: Live traffic entries with long user agents no longer cause the table to stretch.</li>
<li>Fix: Fixed an issue where live traffic would stop loading new records if always display expanded records was on.</li>
<li>Fix: Suppressed warnings on IP conversion functions when processing potentially incomplete data.</li>
<li>Fix: Added a check in REST API hooks to avoid defining a constant twice.</li>

<h4>6.3.17 &#8211; August 24, 2017</h4>
<ul>
<li>Improvement: Prepared code for upcoming scan improvement which will greatly increase scan performance by optimizing malware signatures.</li>
<li>Improvement: Updated the bundled GeoIP database.</li>
<li>Improvement: Better scan messaging when a publicly-reachable searchreplacedb2.php utility is found.</li>
<li>Improvement: The no-cache constant for database caching is now set for W3TC for plugin updates and scans.</li>
<li>Improvement: Added an additional home/siteurl resolution check for WPML installations.</li>
</ul>
<h4>6.3.16 &#8211; August 8, 2017</h4>
<ul>
<li>Improvement: Introduced a new scan stage to check for malicious URLs and content within WordPress core, plugin, and theme options.</li>
<li>Improvement: New scan stage includes a new check for TrafficTrade malware.</li>
<li>Improvement: Reduced net memory usage during forked scan stages by up to 50%.</li>
<li>Improvement: Reduced the number of queries executed for some configuration options.</li>
<li>Improvement: Modified the default whitelisting to include the new core AJAX action in WordPress 4.8.1.</li>
<li>Fix: Synchronized the scan option names between the main options page and smaller scan options page.</li>
<li>Fix: Fixed CSS positioning issue for dashboard metabox with IPv6.</li>
<li>Fix: Fixed a compatibility issue with determining the site&#8217;s home_url when WPML is installed.</li>
</ul>
<h4>6.3.15 &#8211; July 24, 2017</h4>
<ul>
<li>Improvement: Reduced memory usage on scan forking and during the known files scan stage.</li>
<li>Improvement: Added additional scan options to allow for disabling the blacklist checks while still allowing malware scanning to be enabled.</li>
<li>Improvement: Added a Wordfence Application Firewall code block for the lsapi variant of LiteSpeed.</li>
<li>Improvement: Updated the bundled GeoIP database.</li>
<li>Fix: Added a validation check to IP range whitelisting to avoid log warnings if they&#8217;re malformed.</li>
</ul>
<h4>6.3.14 &#8211; July 17, 2017</h4>
<ul>
<li>Improvement: Introduced smart scan distribution. Scan times are now distributed intelligently across servers to provide consistent server performance. </li>
<li>Improvement: Introduced light-weight scan that runs frequently to perform checks that do not use any server resources. </li>
<li>Improvement: If unable to successfully look up the status of an IP claiming to be Googlebot, the hit is now allowed.</li>
<li>Improvement: Scan issue results for abandoned plugins and unpatched vulnerabilities include more info.</li>
<li>Fix: Suppressed PHP notice with time formatting when a microtimestamp is passed.</li>
<li>Fix: Improved binary data to HTML entity conversion to avoid wpdb stripping out-of-range UTF-8 sequences.</li>
<li>Fix: Added better detection to SSL status, particularly for IIS.</li>
<li>Fix: Fixed PHP notice in the diff renderer.</li>
<li>Fix: Fixed typo in lockout alert.</li>
</ul>
<h4>6.3.12 &#8211; June 28, 2017</h4>
<ul>
<li>Improvement: Adjusted the password audit to use a better cryptographic padding option.</li>
<li>Improvement: Improved the option value entry process for the modified files exclusion list.</li>
<li>Improvement: Added rel=&#8221;noopener noreferrer&#8221; to all external links from the plugin for better interoperability with other scanners.</li>
<li>Improvement: Added support to the WAF for validating URLs for future use in rules.</li>
<li>Fix: Time formatting will now correctly handle :30 and :45 time zone offsets.</li>
<li>Fix: Hosts using mod_lsapi will now be detected as Litespeed for WAF optimization.</li>
<li>Fix: Added an option to allow automatic updates to function on Litespeed servers that have the global noabort set rather than site-local.</li>
<li>Fix: Fixed a PHP notice that could occur when running a scan immediately after removing a plugin.</li>
</ul>
<h4>6.3.11 &#8211; June 15, 2017</h4>
<ul>
<li>Improvement: The scan will alert for plugins that have not been updated in 2+ years or have been removed from the wordpress.org directory. It will also indicate if there is a known vulnerability.</li>
<li>Improvement: Added a self-check to the scan to detect if it has stalled.</li>
<li>Improvement: If WordPress auto-updates while a scan is running, the scan will self-abort and reschedule itself to try again later.</li>
<li>Improvement: IP-based filtering in Live Traffic can now use wildcards.</li>
<li>Improvement: Updated the bundled GeoIP database.</li>
<li>Improvement: Added an anti-crawler feature to the lockout page to avoid crawlers erroneously following the unlock link.</li>
<li>Improvement: The live traffic &#8220;Group By&#8221; options now dynamically show the results in a more useful format depending on the option selected.</li>
<li>Improvement: Improved the unknown core files check to include all extra files in core locations regardless of whether or not the &#8220;Scan images, binary, and other files as if they were executable&#8221; option is on.</li>
<li>Improvement: Better wording for the whitelisting IP range error message.</li>
<li>Fix: Addressed a performance issue on databases with tens of thousands of tables when trying to load the diagnostics page.</li>
<li>Fix: All dashboard and activity report email times are now displayed in the time zone configured for the WordPress installation.</li>
</ul>
<h4>6.3.10 &#8211; June 1, 2017</h4>
<ul>
<li>Improvement: Reduction in overall memory usage and peak memory usage for the scanner.</li>
<li>Improvement: Support for exporting a list of all blocked and locked out IP addresses.</li>
<li>Improvement: Updated the WAF&#8217;s CA certificate bundle.</li>
<li>Improvement: Updated the browscap database.</li>
<li>Improvement: Suppressed the automatic HTTP referer added by WordPress for API calls to reduce overall bandwidth usage.</li>
<li>Improvement: When all issues for a scan stage have been previously ignored, the results now indicate this rather than saying problems were found.</li>
<li>Fix: Worked around an issue with WordPress caching to allow password audits to succeed on sites with tens of thousands of users.</li>
<li>Fix: Fixed an IPv6 detection issue with one form of IPv6 address.</li>
<li>Fix: An empty ignored IP list for WAF alerts no longer creates a PHP notice.</li>
<li>Fix: Better detection for when to use secure cookies.</li>
<li>Fix: Fixed a couple issue types that were not able to be permanently ignored.</li>
<li>Fix: Adjusted the changelog link in the scan results email to work for the new wordpress.org repository.</li>
<li>Fix: Fixed some broken links in the activity summary email.</li>
<li>Fix: Fixed a typo in the scan summary text.</li>
<li>Fix: The increased attack rate emails now correctly identify blacklist blocks.</li>
<li>Fix: Fixed an issue with the dashboard where it could show the last scan failed when one has never ran.</li>
<li>Fix: Brute force records are now coalesced when possible prior to sending.</li>
</ul>
<h4>6.3.9 &#8211; May 17, 2017</h4>
<ul>
<li>Improvement: Malware signature checking has been better optimized to improve overall speed.</li>
<li>Improvement: Updated the bundled GeoIP database.</li>
<li>Improvement: The memory tester now tests up to the configured scan limit rather than a fixed value.</li>
<li>Improvement: Added a test to the diagnostics page that verifies permissions to the WAF config location.</li>
<li>Improvement: The diagnostics page now contains a callback test for the server itself.</li>
<li>Improvement: Updated the styling of dashboard notifications for better separation.</li>
<li>Improvement: Added additional constants to the diagnostics page.</li>
<li>Change: Wordfence now enters a read-only mode with its configuration files when run via the &#8216;cli&#8217; PHP SAPI on a misconfigured web server to avoid file ownership changing.</li>
<li>Change: Changed how administrator accounts are detected to compensate for managed WordPress sites that do not have the standard permissions.</li>
<li>Change: The table list on the diagnostics page is now limited in length to avoid being exceedingly large on big multisite installations.</li>
<li>Fix: Improved updating of WAF config values to minimize writing to disk.</li>
<li>Fix: The blacklist&#8217;s blocked IP records are now correctly trimmed when expired.</li>
<li>Fix: Added error suppression to the WAF attack data functions to prevent corrupt records from breaking the no-cache headers.</li>
<li>Fix: Fixed some incorrect documentation links on the diagnostics page.</li>
<li>Fix: Fixed a typo in a constant on the diagnostics page.</li>
</ul>

<li>Improvement: Added a time limit to the live activity status so only current messages are shown.</li>

<li>Improvement: Updated the bundled GeoIP database.</li>
<li>Improvement: Optimized the country update process in the upgrade handler so it only updates changed records.</li>
<li>Improvement: Added our own prefixed version of jQuery.DataTables to avoid conflicts with other plugins.</li>
<li>Improvement: Changes to readme.txt and readme.md are now ignored by the scanner unless high sensitivity is on.</li>

<li>Fix: Added additional error handling to the blocked IP list to avoid outputting notices when another plugin resets the error handler.</li>

<li>Fix: Fixed a sequencing problem when adding detection for bot/human that led to it being called on every request.</li>

<li>Fix: Addressed a problem where the scan exclusions list was not checked correctly in some situations.</li>
</ul>

<li>Improvement: Hooked up restore/delete file scan tools to Filesystem API.</li>
<li>Fix: Reworked country blocking authentication check for access to XMLRPC.</li>
<li>Improvement: Added option to require cellphone sign-in on all admin accounts.</li>
<li>Improvement: Updated IPv6 GeoIP lite data.</li>
<li>Fix: Removed suPHP_ConfigPath from WAF installation process.</li>
<li>Fix: Prevent author names from being found through /wp-json/oembed.</li>
<li>Improvement: Added better solutions for fixing wordfence-waf.php, .user.ini, or .htaccess in scan.</li>
<li>Improvement: Added a method to view which files are currently used for WAF and to remove without reinstalling Wordfence.</li>
<li>Improvement: Changed rule compilation to use atomic writes.</li>
<li>Improvement: Removed security levels from Options page.</li>
<li>Improvement: Added option to disable ajaxwatcher (for whitelisting only for Admins) on the front end.</li>
</ul>
<h4>6.1.8 &#8211; May 26, 2016</h4>
<ul>
<li>Fix: Change wfConfig::set_ser to split large objects into multiple queries.</li>
<li>Fix: Fixed bug in multisite with &#8220;You do not have sufficient permissions to access this page&#8221; error after logging in.</li>
<li>Improvement: Update Geo IP database.</li>
<li>Fix: Fixed deadlock when NFS is used for WAF file storage, in wfWAFAttackDataStorageFileEngine::addRow().</li>
<li>Fix: Added third param to http_build_query for hosts with arg_separator.output set.</li>
<li>Improvement: Show admin notice if WAF blocks an admin (mainly needed for ajax requests).</li>
<li>Improvement: Clarify error message &#8220;Error reading config data, configuration file could be corrupted.&#8221;</li>
<li>Improvement: Added better crawler detection.</li>
<li>Improvement: Add currentUserIsNot(&#8216;administrator&#8217;) to any generic firewall rules that are not XSS based.</li>
<li>Improvement: Update URLs in Wordfence for documentation about LiteSpeed and lockouts.</li>
<li>Improvement: Show message on scan results when a result is caused by enabling &#8220;Scan images and binary files as if they were executable&#8221; or&#8230;</li>
<li>Fix: Suppressed warning: dns_get_record(): DNS Query failed.</li>
<li>Fix: Suppressed warning gzinflate() error in scan logs.</li>
<li>Fix: On WAF roadblock page: Warning: urlencode() expects parameter 1 to be string, array given &#8230;</li>
<li>Fix: Scheduled update for WAF rules doesn&#8217;t decrease from 7 days, to 12 hours, when upgrading to a premium account.</li>
<li>Improvement: Better message for dashboard widget when no failed logins.</li>
</ul>
<h4>6.1.7 &#8211; May 10, 2016</h4>
<ul>
<li>Security Fix: Fixed reflected XSS vulnerability: CVSS 6.1 (Medium). Thanks Kacper Szurek.</li>
</ul>
<h4>6.1.6 &#8211; May 9, 2016</h4>
<ul>
<li>Fix: Fixed bug with 2FA not properly handling email address login.</li>
<li>Fix: Show logins/logouts when Live Traffic is disabled.</li>
<li>Fix: Fixed bug with PCRE versions &lt; 7.0 (repeated subpattern is too long).</li>
<li>Fix: Now able to delete whitelisted URL/params containing ampersands and non-UTF8 characters.</li>
<li>Improvement: Reduced 2FA activation code to expire after 30 days.</li>
<li>Improvement: Live Traffic now only shows verified Googlebot under Google Crawler filter for new visits.</li>
<li>Improvement: Adjusted permissions on Firewall log/config files to be 0640.</li>
<li>Fix: Fixed false positive from Maldet in the wfConfig table during the scan.</li>
</ul>
<h4>6.1.5 &#8211; April 28, 2016</h4>
<ul>
<li>Fix: WordPress language files no longer flagged as changed.</li>
<li>Improvement: Accept wildcards in &#8220;Immediately block IP&#8217;s that access these URLs.&#8221;</li>
<li>Fix: Fixed bug when multiple authors have published posts, /?author=N scans show an author archive page.</li>
<li>Fix: Fixed issue with IPv6 mapped IPv4 addresses not being treated as IPv4.</li>
<li>Improvement: Added WordPress version and various constants to Diagnostics report.</li>
<li>Fix: Fixed bug with Windows users unable to save Firewall config.</li>
<li>Improvement: Include option for IIS on Windows in Firewall config process, and recommend manual php.ini change only.</li>
<li>Fix: Made the &#8216;administrator email address&#8217; admin notice dismissable.</li>
</ul>
<h4>6.1.4 &#8211; April 20, 2016</h4>
<ul>
<li>Fix: Fixed potential bug with &#8216;stored data not found after a fork. Got type: boolean&#8217;.</li>
<li>Improvement: Added bulk actions and filters to WAF whitelist table.</li>
<li>Improvement: Added a check while in learning mode to verify the response is not 404 before whitelising.</li>
<li>Fix: Added index to attackLogTime. wfHits trimmed on runInstall now.</li>
<li>Fix: Fixed attack data sync for hosts that cannot use wp-cron.</li>
<li>Improvement: Use wftest@wordfence.com as the Diagnostics page default email address.</li>
<li>Improvement: When WFWAF_ENABLED is set to false to disable the firewall, show this on the Firewall page.</li>
<li>Fix: Prevent warnings when $_SERVER is empty.</li>
<li>Fix: Bug fix for illegal string offset.</li>
<li>Fix: Hooked up multibyte string functions to binary safe equivalents.</li>
<li>Fix: Hooked up reverse IP lookup in Live Traffic.</li>
<li>Fix: Add the user the web server (or PHP) is currently running as to Diagnostics page.</li>
<li>Improvement: Pause Live Traffic after scrolling past the first entry.</li>
<li>Improvement: Move &#8220;Permanently block all temporarily blocked IP addresses&#8221; button to top of blocked IP list.</li>
<li>Fix: Added JSON fallback for PHP installations that don&#8217;t have JSON enabled.</li>
</ul>
<h4>6.1.3 &#8211; April 14, 2016</h4>
<ul>
<li>Improvement: Added dismiss button to the Wordfence WAF setup admin notice.</li>
<li>Fix: Removed .htaccess and .user.ini from publicly accessible config and backup file scan.</li>
<li>Fix: Removed the disallow file mods for admins created outside of WordPress.</li>
<li>Fix: Fixed bug with &#8216;Hide WordPress version&#8217; causing issues with reCAPTCHA.</li>
<li>Improvement: Added instructions for NGINX users to restrict access to .user.ini during Firewall configuration.</li>
<li>Fix: Fixed bug with multiple API calls to &#8216;get_known_files&#8217;.</li>
</ul>
<h4>6.1.2 &#8211; April 12, 2016</h4>
<ul>
<li>Fix: Fixed fatal error when using a whitelisted IPv6 range and connecting with an IPv6 address.</li>
</ul>
<h4>6.1.1 &#8211; April 12, 2016</h4>
<ul>
<li>Enhancement: Added Web Application Firewall</li>
<li>Enhancement: Added Diagnostics page</li>
<li>Enhancement: Added new scans:
<ul>
<li>Admins created outside of WordPress</li>
<li>Publicly accessible common (database or wp-config.php) backup files</li>
</ul>
</li>
<li>Improvement: Updated Live Traffic with filters and to include blocked requests in the feed.</li>
</ul>

<p>Wordfence includes an endpoint firewall and malware scanner that were built from the ground up to protect WordPress. Our Threat Defense Feed arms Wordfence with the newest firewall rules, malware signatures and malicious IP addresses it needs to keep your website safe. Rounded out by 2FA and a suite of additional features, Wordfence is the most comprehensive WordPress security solution available.</p>
<h4>WORDPRESS FIREWALL</h4>
<ul>
<li>Web Application Firewall identifies and blocks malicious traffic. Built and maintained by a large team focused 100% on WordPress security.</li>
<li>[Premium] Real-time firewall rule and malware signature updates via the Threat Defense Feed (free version is delayed by 30 days).</li>
<li>[Premium] Real-time IP Blacklist blocks all requests from the most malicious IPs, protecting your site while reducing load.</li>
<li>Protects your site at the endpoint, enabling deep integration with WordPress. Unlike cloud alternatives does not break encryption, cannot be bypassed and cannot leak data.</li>
<li>Integrated malware scanner blocks requests that include malicious code or content.</li>
<li>Protection from brute force attacks by limiting login attempts.</li>
</ul>
<h4>WORDPRESS SECURITY SCANNER</h4>
<ul>
<li>Malware scanner checks core files, themes and plugins for malware, bad URLs, backdoors, SEO spam, malicious redirects and code injections.</li>
<li>[Premium] Real-time malware signature updates via the Threat Defense Feed (free version is delayed by 30 days).</li>
<li>Compares your core files, themes and plugins with what is in the WordPress.org repository, checking their integrity and reporting any changes to you.</li>
<li>Repair files that have changed by overwriting them with a pristine, original version. Delete any files that don’t belong easily within the Wordfence interface.</li>
<li>Checks your site for known security vulnerabilities and alerts you to any issues. Also alerts you to potential security issues when a plugin has been closed or abandoned.</li>
<li>Checks your content safety by scanning file contents, posts and comments for dangerous URLs and suspicious content.</li>
<li>[Premium] Checks to see if your site or IP have been blacklisted for malicious activity, generating spam or other security issue.</li>
</ul>
<h4>LOGIN SECURITY</h4>
<ul>
<li>Two-factor authentication (2FA), one of the most secure forms of remote system authentication available via any TOTP-based authenticator app or service.</li>
<li>Login Page CAPTCHA stops bots from logging in.</li>
<li>Disable or add 2FA to XML-RPC.</li>
<li>Block logins for administrators using known compromised passwords.</li>
</ul>
<h4>WORDFENCE CENTRAL</h4>
<ul>
<li>Wordfence Central is a powerful and efficient way to manage the security for multiple sites in one place.</li>
<li>Efficiently assess the security status of all your websites in one view. View detailed security findings without leaving Wordfence Central.</li>
<li>Powerful templates make configuring Wordfence a breeze.</li>
<li>Highly configurable alerts can be delivered via email, SMS or Slack. Improve the signal to noise ratio by leveraging severity level options and a daily digest option.</li>
<li>Track and alert on important security events including administrator logins, breached password usage and surges in attack activity.</li>
<li>Free to use for unlimited sites.</li>
</ul>
<h4>SECURITY TOOLS</h4>
<ul>
<li>With Live Traffic, monitor visits and hack attempts not shown in other analytics packages in real time; including origin, their IP address, the time of day and time spent on your site.</li>
<li>Block attackers by IP or build advanced rules based on IP Range, Hostname, User Agent and Referrer. </li>
<li>Country blocking available with Wordfence Premium.</li>
</ul>
