<h4>What exactly does UpdraftPlus do?</h4>
<p>
<p>Our free version of UpdraftPlus is fully functional: it performs full, manual or scheduled backups of all your WordPress files, databases, plugins and themes, and restores them direct from your WordPress control panel.</p>
<p>It also:<br />
* Backs up to multiple cloud storage options: Dropbox, Google Drive, Amazon S3 (or compatible, e.g. DigitalOcean Spaces), UpdraftPlus Vault, Rackspace Cloud, FTP, DreamObjects, Openstack Swift, and email.<br />
* Can split your website into multiple archives<br />
* Downloads backup archives directly from your WordPress dashboard<br />
* Automatically resumes and retries failed uploads</p>
<p>UpdraftPlus is supported on all current versions of PHP, and is translated in over 16 languages.</p>
<p>Extra features, including full guaranteed support, are available for purchase via our website shop. The full package of add-ons is included in our advanced version of the plugin, UpdraftPremium.</p>
</p>
<h4>What are the benefits of upgrading to UpdraftPlus Premium?</h4>
<p>
<p>The free version of UpdraftPlus works just fine, but if you need more features and functionality, including migration and multisite compatibility, you can purchase our Premium version.</p>
<p>Here are some of the key features of UpdraftPlus Premium:</p>
<ul>
<li>Easily duplicates or migrates websites (using the built-in Migrator)</li>
<li>Backs up non WP files and databases to multiple remote destinations and to more cloud storage options (WebDAV, Microsoft OneDrive, Google Cloud, Microsoft Azure, Backblaze B2, SFTP/SCP, encrypted FTP)</li>
<li>Restores and migrates backup sets from other backup plugins: BackWPUp, BackupWordPress, Simple Backup, WordPress Backup to Dropbox</li>
<li>Encrypts sensitive databases; has lock access settings</li>
<li>Offers sophisticated reporting and scheduling</li>
<li>Backs up automatically before updates to themes and plugins and cores</li>
<li>Includes 1 GB centralised remote storage (with UpdraftVault)</li>
<li>Free dedicated expert support</li>
<li>Multisite/multi-network compatible</li>
</ul>
<p>To find out more, why not take a look at our comparison page. UpdraftPremium is available for purchase here.</p>
</p>
<h4>How do I install UpdraftPlus?</h4>
<p>
<p>Here are the installation guidelines from our <a href="https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=7ReY7Z19h2I" rel="nofollow ugc">YouTube channel</a> or from <a href="https://updraftplus.com/download/" rel="nofollow ugc">our website</a>.</p>
</p>
<h4>Where are your other FAQs, other than the few found here?</h4>
<p>
<p>Here: <a href="https://updraftplus.com/faqs/" rel="nofollow ugc">https://updraftplus.com/faqs/</a> (by keeping them in one place, we make sure they don&#8217;t fall out-of-date!).</p>
</p>
<h4>Is there any way to make managing multiple website backups easier?</h4>
<p>
<p>Yes! We’ve developed a brilliant new plugin that allows you to backup, update and manage all of your website remotely from one central location. It’s called UpdraftCentral, and it comes in 2 different forms:</p>
<ul>
<li>UpdraftCentral (free, self-hosted)</li>
<li>UpdraftCentral Premium (fully-hosted by us and &#8220;ready-to-go&#8221;; self-hosted version also available)</li>
</ul>
</p>
<h4>What if I have a problem / need support ?</h4>
<p>
<p>You can find us in <a href="https://wordpress.org/support/plugin/updraftplus">the WordPress support forum for this plugin</a>. However, before you get in touch with problems, please do ensure that you read through all the FAQs and that you’ve updated to the latest release of our plugin. If you’re a paying customer, you should <a href="https://updraftplus.com/support/" rel="nofollow ugc">go to our support page, here.</a></p>
<p>It helps greatly if you can include the backup log and as much other information as possible in your report, for example, the PHP version, your website, the error description, how you got to the page that caused it, any other relevant plugins you have installed, plus any other information that might be of use.</p>
<p>To find the backup log: there are links to download the logs on the UpdraftPlus settings page- or you may be emailed it. Failing that, FTP into the directory wp-content/updraft and look for it there.</p>
<p>If you know how, please send your PHP error logs- just the few lines that appear when you run a backup, often the file called error_log, possibly in your wp-admin directory which you can check via FTP. And if you’re a programmer that can debug and send a patch, that’s even better.</p>
</p>
<h4>UpdraftPlus runs out of time when it’s trying to backup, after I have left it for some time to give it a good chance. What can I do?</h4>
<p>
<p>This problem is probably caused by your account being starved of resources by your (cheap) web host provider. This is far from ideal; although UpdraftPlus supports resuming backup runs right from the beginning to avoid everything having to be done at once, it has its limits. The best thing is to choose a more reputable web host. Failing this, try going into the “Expert settings” and reducing the size at which zip files are split. UpdraftPlus is known to successfully backup websites that run into the multiple-gigabytes on web servers that are not resource-starved.</p>
</p>
<h4>If my site gets hacked and the backups don’t work, is there anything I can do?</h4>
<p>
<p>Unfortunately not; since this is free software, there’s no warranty and no guarantee. It’s up to you to verify that UpdraftPlus is creating your backups correctly.</p>
</p>

";s:9:"changelog";s:74778:"<p>The <a href="https://updraftplus.com/news/" rel="nofollow ugc">UpdraftPlus backup blog</a> is the best place to learn in more detail about any important changes.</p>
<p>N.B. Paid versions of UpdraftPlus Backup / Restore have a version number which is 1 higher in the first digit, and has an extra component on the end, but the changelog below still applies. i.e. changes listed for 1.16.23.x of the free version correspond to changes made in 2.16.23.x of the paid version.</p>
<h4>1.16.23 &#8211; 01/Apr/2020</h4>
<ul>
<li>FEATURE: Post module handler for UpdraftCentral</li>
<li>FEATURE: Added the ability to select which database tables you want to restore</li>
<li>FIX: An apparent change in Dropbox API behaviour at a recent date was causing uploads to Dropbox to be corrupted in some circumstances in versions 1.16.21-22.</li>
<li>TWEAK: The &#8220;Backup now&#8221; options were all unselected after trying to take a manual incremental backup with no possible entities for increments</li>
<li>TWEAK: When importing a single site into a multisite remove UpdraftPlus options and cron to prevent unwanted backups</li>
<li>TWEAK: Auto select clone package based on size of the selected backup</li>
<li>TWEAK: Prevent PHP notice when logging a Google Drive account full condition</li>
<li>TWEAK: Prevent a PHP notice when Azure is deleting files on PHP 7.4</li>
<li>TWEAK: Prevent potential PHP notice if returned OneDrive quota is zero</li>
<li>TWEAK: When restoring a single site that is part of a multisite only put that single site in maintenance mode not the entire network</li>
<li>TWEAK: Remove filesize warning from the log if we successfully added the file to the zip to prevent user concern</li>
<li>TWEAK: Add page_visit_history table to list of those with low-priority data and search/replace unnecessary</li>
<li>TWEAK: Add a warning message when restoring/migrating from an older PHP version to a newer version</li>
<li>TWEAK: Set &#8216;NO_AUTO_VALUE_ON_ZERO&#8217; sql mode on restorations, for better compatibility with MySQL 8</li>
<li>TWEAK: Add WordFence logging tables to list of optional tables</li>
<li>TWEAK: If the Google Cloud revoke call fails try again once</li>
<li>TWEAK: Catch file closed errors during uploads to Dropbox to prevent unwanted errors in the backup log and prevent user concern</li>
<li>TWEAK: Get list of supported UpdraftClone regions from updraftplus.com</li>
<li>TWEAK: Logging in backup modules will now correctly pass on arguments to main log function</li>
<li>TWEAK: Change OneDrive &#8216;account full, expected to fail&#8217; error message to a recoverable warning</li>
<li>TWEAK: Detect non-homepage 404s and provide FAQ link after a restore</li>
<li>TWEAK: Add paging to the existing backups table to prevent long loading times for sites with a large amount of backups</li>
<li>TWEAK: Remove unwanted padding on some buttons</li>
</ul>
<h4>1.16.22 &#8211; 17/Feb/2020</h4>
<ul>
<li>FIX: Fix a regression with some S3-compatible providers caused by a previous switch to virtual-hosted style bucket referencing</li>
<li>TWEAK: Integrate input credentials from UpdraftCentral&#8217;s zip install feature</li>
<li>TWEAK: Add information to the log file about what type of addresses (sub-domain/sub-folder) the multisite is configured to use</li>
<li>TWEAK: Fix potential race condition affecting settings page notifications on very fast or very slow sites</li>
<li>TWEAK: Some PHP notices that could be output during a restore</li>
<li>TWEAK: Automatically resume a timed-out restore operation during the uploads stage</li>
<li>TWEAK: If the database connection dies during a restore operation, try to reopen it</li>
<li>TWEAK: Adjust the UpdraftClone dashboard notice text</li>
<li>TWEAK: If the Google Drive revoke call fails try again once</li>
<li>TWEAK: The incremental backups label showed the incorrect time for different timezones</li>
<li>TWEAK: Update the WP-Optimize notice</li>
<li>TWEAK: Extend the auto resume restore to themes, others and more file backups</li>
</ul>

<li>TWEAK: Update bundled cacert.pem file</li>
<li>TWEAK: Include a DROP command for any triggers about to be created in the backup</li>
<li>TWEAK: The BackBlaze module (Premium feature) can now cope with BackBlaze losing uploaded chunks</li>
<li>TWEAK: Cast file IDs in Backblaze to strings to prevent possible API error</li>
<li>TWEAK: Do not attempt to perform search/replaces in tables of ARCHIVE type</li>
<li>TWEAK: Introduce the constant UPDRAFTPLUS_SQLEXEC_MAXIMUM_ERRORS to aid debugging</li>
<li>TWEAK: log message when checking which files need uploading on a incremental backup job</li>
<li>TWEAK: Don&#8217;t send external DB backups to UpdraftClone</li>
<li>TWEAK: Reset the UpdraftClone UI if the clone is not created before it expires</li>
<li>TWEAK: Automatically detect a stalled restore and offer a resumption on the restore page</li>
<li>TWEAK: Remove some unused restore code</li>
<li>TWEAK: Prevent a PHP deprecation log notice with WebDAV on PHP 7.3</li>
<li>TWEAK: Catch exceptions and errors during recursive search/replace and recover from them</li>
<li>TWEAK: CSS tweak to prevent other plugins from breaking the style of pop-up close buttons</li>
<li>TWEAK: Ensure the error is logged on the final remote send complete call if it fails</li>

<li>TWEAK: Update seasonal notices for next year</li>
</ul>
<h4>1.16.16 &#8211; 23/Jul/2019</h4>
<ul>
<li>TWEAK: Adding support for installing plugin and theme through zip files in UpdraftCentral</li>

<li>FEATURE: Add &#8211;collate= parameter to WP-CLI (Premium) to allow substitution of locally unknown collations when restoring</li>
<li>FIX: Switched to wp_insert_site() from insert_blog() and install_blog() method when importing single-site into a multisite network on WP 5.1+. Fixes &#8216;Already Installed&#8217; error when importing on newer WP versions</li>
<li>FIX: Issue where (rare) foreign key constraints aren&#8217;t updated upon restore when table prefix changes</li>
<li>FIX: Improve parsing of backed-up triggers when restoring preventing possible unnecessary errors</li>
<li>FIX: If an upload to Google Drive starts to fail due to an OAuth token refresh error, the backup will re-bootstrap the Drive client and try again</li>
<li>FIX: JSON-reparser to prevent unwanted RINFO data being output to screen</li>
<li>FIX: Triggers were still included in a backup for tables that were excluded because of lack of WP prefix</li>
<li>FIX: Resuming restores could resume at an unnecessarily early stage</li>
<li>FIX: Issue with Dropbox account information call that could make it fail</li>
<li>TWEAK: In cases where there were duplicate Google Drive folders (which is possible if there are multiple network communications failures when looking up the folder), these are now detected and merged automatically</li>
<li>TWEAK: Add option to start 250GB Vault subscription as in-app purchase</li>
<li>TWEAK: Regression: backup checksums were not being recorded in the backup log file</li>
<li>TWEAK: Remove UpdraftClone when the backup is cancelled by the user</li>
<li>TWEAK: Send the backup log during the creation of UpdraftClone for easier support when a clone fails to recieve the backup</li>
<li>TWEAK: Detect OneDrive Graph token expiries and initiate swift resumption</li>
<li>TWEAK: Reduce the permissions requested for the UpdraftPlus Google Drive app (this now means that backups manually uploaded to Google Drive can not be deleted through the UpdraftPlus UI)</li>
</ul>

<h4>1.16.6 &#8211; 14/Feb/2019</h4>
<ul>
<li>FEATURE: Added new S3 intelligent tiering class</li>
<li>FEATURE: Ability for user to buy Premium without leaving the plugin&#8217;s settings pages</li>
<li>FEATURE: UpdraftPlus can now catch backups that don&#8217;t complete because of errors that kill PHP and make sure a report is still sent about them</li>
<li>FIX: If a very large UpdraftVault upload took more than an hour, then the token could expire without being refreshed (fix in version 1.16.0 was incomplete)</li>
<li>PERFORMANCE: Modify a condition in the zip-batching algorithm so that greater acceleration in the zip-batching algorithm is allowed on setups allowing very long PHP run times on the initial (zero-eth) resumption</li>
<li>PERFORMANCE: UpdraftClone now sends larger chunks over the network, leading to faster sending of data</li>
<li>PERFORMANCE: Force UpdraftClone to use a 100MB split size for better performance (previously intended, but not always working)</li>
<li>TWEAK: Upon restoration, WP&#8217;s cache directory will be emptied (by default it is not included in backups, so in theory this is a no-op, but the occasional case has been seen where it got populated during the restore process)</li>
<li>TWEAK: Add support for the new Europe (Stockholm) (eu-north-1) AWS region in Amazon S3</li>
<li>TWEAK: Advise the user if they changed the plugin&#8217;s slug (and so won&#8217;t be able to get updates) (paid versions)</li>
<li>TWEAK: Make use of wp_get_themes rather than relying solely to get_themes which is already deprecated</li>
<li>TWEAK: Regression: When a user aborted a fatal error occurred before all clean-up actions were complete</li>
</ul>
<h4>1.16.5 &#8211; 28/Jan/2019</h4>
<ul>
<li>FEATURE: If a restoration is interrupted (e.g. PHP timeout), then the &#8220;Continue&#8221; feature can now resume not just at the most recent zip file, but within the zip file at the point it had reached (https://updraftplus.com/auto-resuming-interrupted-restores-part-2/)</li>
<li>FEATURE: Added command in WP-CLI which gives a list of incremental backups restore points.</li>
<li>FIX: Regression: When a Dropbox upload failed to complete, UpdraftPlus would log this but fail to retry</li>
<li>FIX: Again update phpseclib to the latest version which should now fix the &#8216;SSH2 Server Host Key Algorithm Mismatch&#8217; on all installs</li>
<li>TWEAK: Correct a wrong variable reference in an error message</li>
<li>TWEAK: Only add the JavaScript for the incremental schedule selection on the UD settings page</li>
<li>TWEAK: Replace incidental use of ipinfo.io now that it requires a paid API key</li>
<li>TWEAK: The print_delete_old_dirs_form method should have been public to allow painting if the user clicked through the previous message</li>
</ul>
<h4>1.16.4 &#8211; 17/Jan/2019</h4>
<ul>
<li>FIX: Regression: Properly mark backups picked up via &#8220;Rescan remote storage&#8221; as non-native (preventing unwelcome side-effects such as being pruned by another site)</li>
<li>FIX: Correctly update the OneDrive refresh token to prevent expiry</li>
<li>FIX: Again work around an issue with &#8216;SSH2 Server Host Key Algorithm Mismatch&#8217; occurring with the current phpseclib release by temporarily reverting to an earlier one as it still does not work on all installs</li>
<li>FIX: When restoring an incremental backup set via WP-CLI, the selected restore point was ignored</li>
<li>FIX: If the remote storage settings were for multiple instances of a single backend-type (e.g. two Dropbox accounts), and if the entire backup and send operation completed in a single PHP process, then the local copy of the files would not be deleted</li>
<li>TWEAK: Show the error message if mbstring.func_overload is turned on in php.ini while creating migration key</li>
<li>TWEAK: Added Azure China endpoint</li>
<li>TWEAK: Resolve &#8220;dashicons&#8221; CSS conflict </li>
<li>TWEAK: Add &#8216;blogmeta&#8217; to the list of core tables (in readiness for WP 5.1)</li>
<li>TWEAK: Remove unnecessary deprecated (in PHP 7.3) parameter to define() in WebDAV HTTP library</li>
<li>TWEAK: Prevent a potential PHP notice in UpdraftPlus Premium when installed without network access</li>
<li>TWEAK: Enhance the updraftplus_exclude_file and updraftplus_exclude_directory filters to also pass the stored names</li>
<li>TWEAK: Add a new constant UPDRAFTPLUS_ZIP_BATCH_CEILING that can tweak internals of the zip backup engine</li>
</ul>

<h4>1.16.2 &#8211; 07/Jan/2019</h4>

<li>TWEAK: Check-in with the clone during the backup process to make sure it is not prematurely purged</li>
</ul>
<h4>1.16.1 &#8211; 01/Jan/2019</h4>
<ul>
<li>FIX: If a very large UpdraftVault upload took more than an hour, then the token could expire without being refreshed</li>
<li>FIX: Version 2.16.0 could write invalid or incomplete JSON when creating the manifest file on an incremental backup under certain circumstances</li>
<li>FIX: When restoring an incremental backup set via WP-CLI, the restore order could be wrong</li>
<li>TWEAK: Accept and parse the invalid JSON when restoring an incremental archive created on 2.16.0</li>
<li>TWEAK: When running an incremental backup, the backup report would report the time taken to run the backup wrongly</li>
<li>TWEAK: Make the logging on the state of zip extraction more fine-grained (at least every 100MB, 1000 files or 15 seconds)</li>
<li>TWEAK: Re-factoring of zip extraction code to allow for future improvements</li>
<li>TWEAK: Re-factoring of the restore routines to share more code between different entry points, and allow future improvements</li>
<li>TWEAK: Differentiate between failures to JSON-decode an incremental backup manifest file and other types of failures</li>
</ul>
<h4>1.16.0 &#8211; 19/Dec/2018</h4>
<ul>
<li>FEATURE: Added the abilty to create and restore Incremental Backups (Premium version)</li>
<li>FIX: Work around an issue with &#8216;SSH2 Server Host Key Algorithm Mismatch&#8217; occurring with the current phpseclib release by temporarily reverting to an earlier one</li>
<li>TWEAK: Improve performance by aggregating separate SQL SELECT queries (previously one for each backup) when loading the settings page</li>
<li>TWEAK: internal backup extradata parameter to prevent unwanted PHP notices</li>
<li>TWEAK: Fork a method UpdraftPlus_Filesystem_Functions::unzip_file() to allow for future enhancements</li>
<li>TWEAK: Periodic purging of obsolete job data that didn&#8217;t get cleaned when expected was not happening on multisite</li>
<li>TWEAK: Improve logging when the initial call to jobdata_set_multi fails</li>
<li>TWEAK: Any stored backup/restore progress log files will now be deleted after 40 days. (Since they are attached to email reports, you can keep and retrieve them from those if needed). Over-ride this with the filter updraftplus_log_delete_age if desired.</li>
</ul>

<h4>1.15.6 &#8211; 06/Dec/2018</h4>
<ul>
<li>FEATURE: Added WordPress 5.0 support to UpdraftClone</li>
<li>FEATURE: Added the ability to choose the UpdraftClone server location</li>
<li>FEATURE: Cut a step from the activation procedure on paid versions, improving reliability on some installs that did not detect available updates</li>
<li>TWEAK: The UpdraftClone video is inserted after clicking a link (prevent unwanted call to the video server)</li>
<li>TWEAK: Replace a &#8216;continue&#8217; with a &#8216;break&#8217; to prevent a PHP notice on PHP 7.3</li>
<li>TWEAK: (Paid versions) Simplify the constants involved in defining a custom/over-ride licensing server; and show in the &#8216;Extensions&#8217; tab if an over-ride applies.</li>
<li>TWEAK: (Paid versions) Remove a library versioning assumption in the processing of results from a licensing claim</li>
<li>TWEAK: (Paid versions) A regression had caused the current UD install version to be sent in an updates check</li>
<li>TWEAK: Re-factoring of scheduling methods into their own class</li>
<li>TWEAK: Tweak the scheduling engine to separate the next resumption time from the maximum run time in the case of overlapping runs, in order to prevent unnecessary large gaps between resumptions in cases where the server allows very long run times</li>
</ul>
<h4>1.15.5 &#8211; 19/Nov/2018</h4>
<ul>
<li>TWEAK: Include the backup set ID in clone ready state file</li>
<li>TWEAK: For Premium users with grand-fathered lifetime updates (i.e. purchased before August 2013), a regression had caused support entitlement expiries to no longer be notified</li>
<li>TWEAK: For Premium users with who have downgraded from unlimited licences to another package, a licence expiry message could show when in fact the real situation was that they just needed to specifically allocate a licence to the site. The relevant message has been adjusted to improve this.</li>
<li>TWEAK: Track &#8220;more files&#8221; incremental backup locations</li>
<li>TWEAK: Don&#8217;t show individual add-ons that have not been bought in the account add-ons page if the user has Premium.</li>
<li>TWEAK: Include the raw updates check response information in the internal/advanced dump</li>
<li>
<p>TWEAK: Added the UpdraftClone video</p>
</li>
<li>
<p>TWEAK: Ability for user to buy Premium without leaving the plugin&#8217;s settings pages</p>
</li>
</ul>
<h4>1.15.3 &#8211; 29/Oct/2018</h4>
<ul>
<li>FEATURE: UpdraftPlus now has an option to auto-update</li>
<li>FEATURE: Azure for Government endpoint support (Premium)</li>
<li>FIX: SSL verification settings were not allowing verification to be turned off for generic S3 storage</li>
<li>FIX: In some situations in which a user had defined UTF8 as their character set but WordPress was using UTF8MB4, UpdraftPlus was not detecting this</li>
<li>FIX: Prevent particular a SQL text pattern wrongly triggering detection of database features when it is within content</li>
<li>TWEAK: Marked as supporting WordPress 5.0</li>
<li>TWEAK: Automatically re-scan for presence of database backup after restoring it, to prevent confusion over its status</li>
<li>TWEAK: Change logic that controls whether the minified or full JavaScript is used</li>
<li>TWEAK: Improve Settings tab UI on mobile</li>
<li>TWEAK: Improve UpdraftClone UI</li>
<li>TWEAK: Improve UpdraftClone temporary page UI</li>
<li>TWEAK: Change method used to record the MySQL version to deal with how MariaDB can report when using a non-MariaDB client library (see: https://github.com/joomla/joomla-cms/issues/9062)</li>
<li>TWEAK: Replace Base64 encoded logo by image file</li>
<li>TWEAK: Hide guided tour on UpdraftClone</li>
<li>TWEAK: Fixed broken automatic backup modal layout</li>
<li>TWEAK: Auto rescan after restoring the remote database</li>
<li>TWEAK: Explicitly set the backup history option to not autoload, as it can get non-trivial in size</li>
<li>TWEAK: Improve UI of excluding things from the backup</li>
<li>TWEAK: Prevent a possible PHP debug notice in methods/backup-module.php</li>
<li>TWEAK: Show progress in browser view port instead of modal dialog when we delete the backup(s).</li>
<li>TWEAK: Added a &#8211;db-dummy-restore option to WP-CLI which will run a dummy restore of the database (under an unused prefix) and then drop the tables after it finishes. This option can be useful for testing.</li>
<li>TWEAK: Update the UpdraftClone UI when site information becomes available</li>
<li>TWEAK: Curl errors when interacting with Backblaze B2 will now be passed up for easier debugging</li>
<li>TWEAK: Re-factor add-on remote storage credential testing to make passing debugging information easier</li>
<li>TWEAK: Implement non-default SSL options with Backblaze B2 (previously the defaults were always used)</li>
<li>TWEAK: UpdraftClone: redirect to admin page after using the auto login link</li>
<li>TWEAK: Improve internal more files backup location tracking</li>
<li>TWEAK: Send a single request to download a backup set not for each file entity</li>
<li>TWEAK: Fix a DOM element whereby multiple nonces had the same id</li>
<li>TWEAK: Automatically build the more files backup location tracking on local rescan</li>
<li>TWEAK: Refactor the remote storage logging code in Onedrive module</li>
</ul>

<li>TWEAK: Fixes Migrate / clone tab contents showing on the Advanced tools tab</li>
<li>TWEAK: Attempt to catch, work-around and log when the backup history cannot be saved due to too long a history relative to the MySQL server&#8217;s maximum packet size</li>
<li>TWEAK: Re-factor and introduce the UpdraftPlus_Storage_Methods_Interface class</li>
<li>TWEAK: Introduce the UPDRAFTPLUS_ENABLE_TOUR constant for power users; set it to false as part of your automated WP installation process (or manually) if you wish to disable all tour functionality.</li>

<h4>1.15.0 &#8211; 12/Sep/2018</h4>
<ul>
<li>FEATURE: Introducing UpdraftClone. Create a live copy of your site with a button press. Great for testing changes, testing updates (e.g. WordPress core, plugins, PHP versions) and anything else you can think of. More information: https://updraftplus.com/updraftclone/</li>
<li>FIX: Fix the logic for claiming and activating licences/add-ons.</li>
<li>FIX: Fixed OneDrive for Business Germany authentication tenant issue</li>
<li>TWEAK: WP-CLI &#8211; use dash (-) instead of underscore (_) to separate words, in order to match WP-CLI standards. </li>
<li>TWEAK: Adds close_browser_connection capability for servers using phpfpm</li>
<li>TWEAK: Change multiple backups selection and actions UI</li>
<li>TWEAK: Prevent PHP debug message on backup from UpdraftCentral when processing the service list</li>
<li>TWEAK: Improves manual backup feedback</li>
<li>TWEAK: Fix an out-of-date &#8216;lost password&#8217; link</li>
<li>TWEAK: Add filter updraftplus_disk_space_check to allow over-riding disk space check result</li>
<li>TWEAK: Re-factor some of the restore code to enable future enhancements</li>
<li>TWEAK: In the case of an &#8216;always keep&#8217; backup, it was possible for the wrong log message to be logged concerning the reason for it being kept</li>
<li>TWEAK: Add log warning and WP Admin notice regarding DreamObjects objects-us-west-1.dream.io endpoint shutting down</li>
<li>TWEAK: Refactor the remote storage logging code</li>
<li>TWEAK: Clean up some confusing UI when dealing with remote send backups</li>
</ul>

<li>TWEAK: Prevent PHP notices in add-ons with non-present settings</li>

<li>TWEAK: Prevent call to the the wp_get_sites() deprecated function on WP 4.6 and newer</li>

<li>TWEAK: Replace a missing class constant in the Dropbox SDK (only relevant to people upgrading from Dropbox API v1 tokens &#8211; indicates upgrading UpdraftPlus from a very old version that previously used Dropbox APIv1 but never v2)</li>

<li>TWEAK: An &#8220;Incremental backups&#8221; extension was displayed in the Premium / Extensions tab, causing confusion since it is not yet finished/launched</li>
<li>TWEAK: Displays a Byte Order Mark (BOM) warning by giving the file names along with the path in the &#8220;Existing Backups&#8221; tab, if a BOM is detected at the start of common files that people tend to edit</li>
<li>TWEAK: A WP CLI Existing backup command didn&#8217;t display a date time in the &#8220;job_identifier&#8221; column</li>

<li>TWEAK: Added the &#8220;Web-server disk space in use by UpdraftPlus&#8221; information to &#8220;Site information&#8221; section in the &#8220;Advanced Tools&#8221; tab; it won&#8217;t show in the &#8216;Existing Backups&#8217; tab if you are using less than 100MB.</li>
<li>TWEAK: When a Google Cloud token was invalid, a PHP Fatal could result instead of catching the error and informing/logging nicely</li>
<li>TWEAK: If php-xml (SimpleXMLElement) is not installed, then show an appropriate warning in the Azure configuration section</li>
<li>TWEAK: If the user tries to install another version of UpdraftPlus, then tweak the default error message that they are shown by WP, which is too obscure/cryptic for many users</li>
<li>TWEAK: If a fatal error occurred during uploading a backup, try to recover it and process the upload further</li>
</ul>

<h4>1.14.7 &#8211; 25/Apr/2018</h4>
<ul>
<li>FIX: Fix incompatibility with loading the dashboard on WP 4.6 and older. If you have this problem, then you cannot visit /wp-admin/ &#8211; you will need to update via another tool (e.g. if you have a multiple site management tool), or via FTP (download the https://downloads.wordpress.org/plugin/updraftplus.1.14.7.zip , unzip it on your PC, log in to your site via FTP into the folder wp-content/plugins, remove the existing folder &#8216;updraftplus&#8217; and then upload the unzipped &#8216;updraftplus&#8217; folder). Many apologies!</li>
</ul>

<h4>1.13.15 &#8211; 28/Nov/2017</h4>
<ul>
<li>FIX: Updated OneDrive SDK to allow for PHP 7.2 (due for release soon) compatibility</li>
<li>FIX: When multiple remote backup destinations existed, pruning of old backup sets was not removing from all destinations (recent regression)</li>
<li>FIX: When re-scanning a Rackspace Cloud Files remote location, only the first 100 files were processed</li>
<li>FIX: Backups being downloaded twice from Dropbox during a restore which could cause unexpected results upon a site migration</li>
<li>FIX: The &#8216;SCP&#8217; and &#8216;Server-side encryption&#8217; checkboxes in the settings was always ticked in the browser upon reload, regardless of the saved setting (regression in 1.13.14)</li>
<li>TWEAK: Improve export settings file name by appending site name to export download file</li>
<li>TWEAK: Perform escaping of table names in SQL calls without using esc_sql()</li>
<li>TWEAK: Site option is deleted before updating it in multisite</li>
<li>TWEAK: Improve WebDAV remote method upload speed</li>
<li>TWEAK: Improve WebDAV remote method download speed</li>
</ul>
<h4>1.13.14 &#8211; 21/Nov/2017</h4>
<ul>
<li>FIX: Search/replace checkbox was not appearing when migrating a multisite setup</li>
<li>FIX: WordPress 4.8.3 introduced a breaking internal change in the WordPress database API, which broke the search/replace of strings including percent signs. Updated Migrator code to handle this.</li>
<li>FIX: WebDAV remote storage settings not being loaded onto the settings page properly</li>
<li>FIX: Rewrite of legacy (PHP 5.2) S3 SDK Class to fix pruning old backup sets when multiple storage back-ends that are all based on S3 are in use.</li>
<li>TWEAK: Improve formatting of restoration warnings</li>
<li>TWEAK: Add css classes to backup templates</li>
<li>TWEAK: Standardise the way storage classes are internally stored/retrieved</li>
<li>TWEAK: Remote storage modules configuration templates transition using handlebars.js</li>
<li>TWEAK: Adjust message mentioning mcrypt which is not needed if php-openssl is installed</li>
<li>TWEAK: Add UPDRAFTPLUS_USE_WPDB constant</li>
</ul>
<h4>1.13.13 &#8211; 02/Nov/2017</h4>
<ul>
<li>FIX: Google Drive Custom App authorisation and de-authorisation was not working</li>
<li>FIX: Rackspace new user creation had stopped filling the new credential fields automatically after successful creation of a new user</li>
<li>TWEAK: When migrating, the detected search/replace terms now make sure that http and https variants are both included as search terms</li>
<li>TWEAK: Make the internal error code with OneDrive auth failures more accurate</li>
<li>TWEAK: Remote storage modules configuration templates transition using xamin/handlebars.php libraries</li>
<li>TWEAK: Changed the Dropbox authentication flow to not send a GET request on large URLs</li>
<li>TWEAK: Improve error message when invalid bucket name given by user for Backblaze remote storage method</li>
</ul>
<h4>1.13.12 &#8211; 25/Oct/2017</h4>
<ul>
<li>TWEAK: Showing search/replace checkbox option only when needed.</li>
<li>FEATURE: Warn the user if their .htaccess seems to contain a redirect (or any other reference) to the old site after migration.</li>
<li>FEATURE: When importing a database, warn the user if the current MySQL server does not support a used collation, and offer to replace it</li>
<li>FIX: Saving of S3 settings had taken a dislike to buckets beginning with a capital &#8216;B&#8217;</li>
<li>FIX: UpdraftCentral users&#8217; module was failing to handle loading a very large number of users</li>
<li>TWEAK: Allows the installation and/or activation of the WP-Optimize plugin from UpdraftCentral</li>
<li>TWEAK: Add multisite attribute to the error response object for the create user, delete user and edit user actions.</li>
<li>TWEAK: All remote storage methods are ported over to using configuration templates internally</li>
<li>TWEAK: Include a method to add a manifest file inside each backup archive</li>
<li>TWEAK: All code relating to the now-dead Dropbox APIv1 removed (N.B. If you&#8217;ve not updated UpdraftPlus since November 2016 and were using Dropbox, it won&#8217;t be working &#8211; https://blogs.dropbox.com/developers/2017/09/api-v1-shutdown-details/)</li>
<li>TWEAK: Prevent a PHP log notice upon database backup restore when using Google Drive without a client ID</li>
<li>TWEAK: Prevent the final &#8216;Restore&#8217; button being pressed a second time</li>
<li>TWEAK: Improvements to the UpdraftCentral wizard</li>
<li>TWEAK: Update to trunk version of plugin updater (paid versions), restoring the ability to work on older WP versions (3.8 and before)</li>
<li>TWEAK: Add lbakut_activity_log to the list of large log tables</li>
<li>TWEAK: Updater in paid versions now requests JSON as response format for responses when claiming entitlements</li>
<li>TWEAK: Resolve: Backup labels could end up with extraneous slashes in output</li>
<li>TWEAK: Updater in paid versions can now receive and process update information in respond to entitlement claim &#8211; one less HTTP round-trip</li>
<li>TWEAK: Improve Google Cloud authentication success message for bucket name is not defined</li>
<li>TWEAK: UpdraftVault commands now pass an instance identifier</li>
<li>FEATURE: Backups can now be uploaded to multiple instances of the same remote storage but not yet possible to add multiple instances </li>
</ul>
<h4>1.13.11 &#8211; 27/Sep/2017</h4>
<ul>
<li>FIX: Fix a failure (regression in 1.13.8+) to download some backup sets which pre-date the existence of instances</li>
<li>FIX: Fix a failure to backup in the short-lived 1.13.10 (many apologies)</li>
<li>TWEAK: When logging an Exception or Error, include a backtrace (WP 3.4+)</li>
<li>TWEAK: Prevent a PHP warning during a save of the backup history</li>
<li>TWEAK: Added a MetaSlider notice in the notices collection</li>
<li>TWEAK: Put a try/catch block that will catch PHP exceptions/fatals (PHP 7.0+) during encryption phase, so that any issues can be logged</li>
</ul>
<h4>1.13.9 &#8211; 25/Sep/2017</h4>
<ul>
<li>FEATURE: Backblaze B2 (https://www.backblaze.com/b2/) support in UpdraftPlus Premium</li>
<li>TWEAK: Port job data used by Azure, Google Cloud and OneDrive storage to being instance-local (now believed to all be ported)</li>
<li>TWEAK: The automatic correcting of wrongly-input S3 and FTP settings had regressed in a recent version</li>
<li>TWEAK: Various small fixes to the standards compliance of the HTML output in the remote storage settings area</li>
<li>TWEAK: When deleting backups with multiple remote storage instances of the same type, order the attempts</li>
</ul>
<h4>1.13.8 &#8211; 21/Sep/2017</h4>
<ul>
<li>FEATURE: When importing a database, warn the user if the current MySQL server does not support a used character set, and offer to replace it (with a link explaining the risks)</li>
<li>FEATURE: Generic S3 storage module can now use non-default ports (specify by appending :(port number) to the host name)</li>
<li>FIX: Re-scanning of remote storage would fail to detect a file manually uploaded to a secondary remote storage location if not also present locally. Various other (unlikely) corner-case rescanning scenarios also tested and fixed.</li>
<li>TWEAK: Some enhancements to the S3 internals, to make the &#8220;S3 Generic&#8221; module behave better (it already worked) with the forthcoming DigitalOcean Spaces (object storage) (see: https://updraftplus.com/use-updraftplus-digital-ocean-spaces/)</li>
<li>TWEAK: UpdraftCentral will no longer show updates which WordPress core lists which appear to be of the same version number</li>
<li>TWEAK: Handle trying to download a zero-sized file through the browser more elegantly</li>
<li>TWEAK: When pressing &#8216;Delete&#8217;, the &#8220;also delete remote backup&#8221; checkbox was showing even for backups without remote storage</li>
<li>TWEAK: Abstract history handling into a separate class, UpdraftPlus_Backup_History, for easier maintenance</li>
<li>TWEAK: Remove a use of count() on a string to prevent a new PHP notice on PHP 7.2+</li>
<li>TWEAK: Some changes to the UpdraftCentral connection tool to make it more user-friendly</li>
<li>TWEAK: Clarified and documented the re-scanning code, and made it compatible with the increased flexibility needed for incremental backups in future</li>
<li>TWEAK: Tweaked UpdraftCentral GA handler to support Tracking ID editing and disconnection.</li>
<li>TWEAK: In the free version, if the only difference between backup and site URLs is http/https, then show a different message to make the situation clearer</li>
<li>TWEAK: Make the UPDRAFTPLUS_IPV4_ONLY constant take effect more widely</li>
<li>TWEAK: Do not duplicate remote instance ID records in the backup history when re-scanning</li>
<li>TWEAK: Keep the remote instance ID list consistent with the remote service list when re-scanning</li>
<li>TWEAK: Prevent a PHP notice that could appear for locally stored backups in UpdraftPlus::get_storage_objects_and_ids()</li>
</ul>
<h4>1.13.7 &#8211; 06/Sep/2017</h4>
<ul>
<li>FIX: UpdraftCentral connectivity for various operations restored (regression in 1.13.6)</li>
<li>FIX: No error message was being shown when a backup to local storage was missing upon restore</li>
<li>COMPATIBILITY: Replace uses of the deprecated (PHP 7.2+) each() function</li>
<li>TRANSLATION: Portuguese (Portugal) and Romanian translations are now complete and supplied from wordpress.org, so can be removed from the free plugin zip</li>
<li>TWEAK: Fix some wrongly-called translation functions, and pull more known strings into the Premium version</li>
<li>TWEAK: Remove the legacy parameter for setting storage upload job status data (only useful for version downgrades of more than 1 release during in-progress backups)</li>
<li>TWEAK: Exclude some unnecessary build and unused files from the release zip (reduce disk space and download size)</li>
</ul>
<h4>1.13.6 &#8211; 05/Sep/2017</h4>
<ul>
<li>FEATURE: Google Drive authorisation now goes via an officially registered app for easier connections to Google Drive.</li>
<li>FEATURE: Include commands for UpdraftCentral&#8217;s (https://updraftcentral.com) Google Analytics management facility (check the changelog for the release)</li>
<li>FIX: Correct handling of OneDrive folder names featuring spaces (possibly a regression/change in the handling at OneDrive&#8217;s end)</li>
<li>TWEAK: Prevent messy layout when the last log message is very long</li>
<li>TWEAK: Log catchable fatal errors and exceptions during backup in PHP 7</li>
<li>TWEAK: Log catchable fatal errors and exceptions during restore in PHP 7</li>
<li>TWEAK: Log catchable fatal errors and exceptions during backup download in PHP 7</li>
<li>TWEAK: Reduce amount of database logging during existing zip analysis, database backup and pruning stages</li>
<li>TWEAK: In AJAX/JSON responses, automatically detect and handle corrupted output (e.g. setups where PHP debugging notices are configured to come to the browser)</li>
<li>TWEAK: Catches and more elegantly handles errors when a settings import file cannot be JSON-parsed</li>
<li>TWEAK: Request list of available add-ons (paid versions) from the mothership in current format</li>
<li>TWEAK: Added custom backup message parameter backupnow_message in function updraft_backupnow_inpage_go()</li>
<li>TWEAK: General code tidy-up, making older code conform to our current standards</li>
<li>TWEAK: Add the possibility of passing back associated data with test results, and log it in the browser console</li>
<li>TWEAK: When carrying out a remote storage test, pass the state of the &#8216;debug&#8217; setting</li>
<li>TWEAK: When testing SFTP settings, if debug is activated, activate debug logging and pass the results back in the event of test failure</li>
<li>TWEAK: Optimise away a database query in the case of no UpdraftCentral keys existing</li>
<li>TWEAK: Removed &#8220;Reduced Redundancy&#8221; storage class from Amazon S3 remote storage options, because Amazon are deprecating it (and it now costs more, for inferior redundancy &#8211; https://updraftplus.com/forums/topic/amazon-is-phasing-out-reduced-redundancy-storage/)</li>
<li>TWEAK: Backup files missing error message corrected</li>
<li>TWEAK: Add the handlebars-js and xamin/handlebars.php libraries</li>
<li>TWEAK: The FTP storage module has been ported to outputing its configuration via a template</li>
<li>TWEAK: Introduce internal API and port all job data saved in storage modules to be instance-local</li>
</ul>
<h4>1.13.5 &#8211; 08/Aug/2017</h4>
<ul>
<li>TWEAK: Manage phpseclib through composer</li>
<li>TWEAK: Do less logging to database when resuming and noticing already-processed tables (saves resources)</li>
<li>TWEAK: Returns comment status when updating comments from UpdraftCentral</li>
<li>TWEAK: Update plugin-updates-checker library to current (4.2), and manage via composer, replacing bundled copy in the build source</li>
<li>TWEAK: Replace uses of create_function(), which is deprecated on PHP 7.2</li>
<li>TWEAK: Replace deprecated constructors (PHP 7+) in webdav module</li>
<li>TWEAK: Documentation showing plugin developers how easy it is to add in-page backups to their plugin: https://updraftplus.com/add-take-backup-functionality-plugin/</li>
<li>TWEAK: Make the UpdraftCentral updates checking able to cope with a wider range of third-party schemes</li>
<li>TWEAK: General code tidy-up, making older code conform to our current standards</li>
<li>TWEAK: Minor version updates of some bundled libraries</li>
<li>TWEAK: Produce and use minified resources (CSS/JS) where available</li>
<li>TWEAK: Update class-udrpc to latest (1.4.14) which removes a conflict with other code that may interact with CORS OPTIONS requests</li>
<li>TWEAK: Escape log lines when sending for display (theoretically an XSS security issue, but to achieve a successful attack, someone would have to first get something malicious into the log file, which is difficult as there are not many places where foreign input can end up in the log file &#8211; e.g. hack into Dropbox and cause Dropbox to send you back malicious HTML in an error message &#8211; and then be able to persuade you to both take a backup triggering the problem and then view the log file in your WP dashboard)</li>
<li>TWEAK: Update Google Cloud bucket locations</li>
</ul>
<h4>1.13.4 &#8211; 08/Jun/2017</h4>
<ul>
<li>FIX: Import function had a regression and was not coping with all formats</li>
<li>TWEAK: When the import function failed, the error was not shown to the user</li>
</ul>
<h4>1.13.3 &#8211; 07/Jun/2017</h4>
<ul>
<li>FIX: Revert Dropbox authentication change in 1.13.2, which was not working on all sites</li>
</ul>
<h4>1.13.2 &#8211; 07/Jun/2017</h4>
<ul>
<li>TWEAK: Marked as tested and compatible on WordPress 4.8</li>
<li>TWEAK: Dropbox authentication flow can now use POST for the final step, side-stepping (arbitrary) parameter length restrictions on some Apache mod_security setups</li>
<li>TWEAK: Prevent a possible PHP notice when curl is not present</li>
<li>TWEAK: Point Clef users towards Keyy</li>
<li>TWEAK: Do not open an alert box when the user changes their site ID in &#8216;Advanced Tools&#8217;</li>
<li>TWEAK: Fix parameters to updraft_check_overduecrons() JS function</li>
</ul>
<h4>1.13.1 &#8211; 09/May/2017</h4>
<ul>
<li>REFACTOR: Completed re-factoring of the remote storage modules, so that now all remote storage code has completed this current stage of re-factoring (more to come in future &#8211; laying the foundation for a significant new feature)</li>
<li>FIX: Added a nonce to the Dropbox deauth link. This is a minor security issue &#8211; someone personally targetting you, who knew that you were logged in to your WordPress admin, and who could persuade you to visit a personally-crafted web page, could cause the connection between UpdraftPlus and your Dropbox to be broken. The only impact of this is that the sending of your next backup to Dropbox would fail, and you would be alerted about the need to re-connect.</li>
<li>FIX: Import settings now handle the new remote storage options format</li>
<li>FIX: The zip file browser was not working in free versions</li>
<li>TWEAK: Added a version check when saving settings to prevent errors or lost settings</li>
<li>TWEAK: &#8216;Existing Backups&#8217; table now shows an icon for each remote destination that the backup was sent to</li>
<li>TWEAK: Update SSL CA certificates file</li>
<li>TWEAK: If, when uploading to S3, a file is not found, handle it slightly more elegantly</li>
<li>TWEAK: Work with some WebDAV servers that previously sent empty responses to OPTIONS requests</li>
</ul>
<h4>1.12.40 &#8211; 01/Apr/2017</h4>
<ul>
<li>TWEAK: The in-page log file display had stopped continuously updating in 1.12.32</li>
<li>FIX: In some circumstances, settings for the storage modules refactored in 1.12.37 could fail to show</li>
<li>FIX: The free version of 1.12.37/38 in some circumstances could fail to complete Dropbox authentication</li>
</ul>
<h4>1.12.38 &#8211; 31/Mar/2017</h4>
<ul>
<li>TWEAK: Dropbox API v2 call to de-authorise a token was failing</li>
<li>FIX: Prevent a fatal error when attempting to use a backup method with no options set</li>
</ul>
<h4>1.12.37 &#8211; 31/Mar/2017</h4>
<ul>
<li>FEATURE: Browse the contents of a backup from within your WordPress dashboard, and (with Premium) download individual files from it</li>
<li>FIX: Fix an issue that could occasionally cause corruption of interrupted Dropbox backups. All Dropbox users are recommended to update asap.</li>
<li>TWEAK: Remove debugging statement inadvertently left in 1.12.36</li>
<li>TWEAK: Re-factored remote storage handlers via add-ons so that there was a cleaner and more consistent class hierarchy (preparation for future improvements). N.B. If you subsequently downgrade to an older version of UpdraftPlus, you will need to re-enter the settings for some remote storage options.</li>
<li>TWEAK: List of checksum algorithms run over backups and logged now includes SHA256, and is filterable (SHA1 now considered deprecated)</li>
<li>TWEAK: Allow chunked database encryption to try and resume in the event of an error</li>
<li>TWEAK: Improve the premium/extension tab content</li>
<li>TWEAK: Fix an issue whereby the UpdraftVault settings section could show a bogus problem with checking quota immediately after initial setup</li>
<li>TWEAK: When requesting a download, work around buggy browser/server that continued after Connection: close</li>
<li>TWEAK: Improve the UI experience when downloading a log file for display fails</li>
<li>TWEAK: Prevent PHP notice if another plugin cancels a cron event</li>
<li>TWEAK: Tweak semaphore handling and enhance logging</li>
</ul>
<p>Older changes are found <a href="https://plugins.svn.wordpress.org/updraftplus/trunk/changelog.txt" rel="nofollow ugc">in the changelog.txt file in the plugin directory.</a></p>

It is the world&#8217;s highest ranking and most popular scheduled backup plugin, with over two million currently-active installs. Backup your files and database backups into the cloud and restore with a single click!</p>
<p>Backup into the cloud directly to Dropbox, Google Drive, Amazon S3 (or compatible), UpdraftVault, Rackspace Cloud, FTP, DreamObjects, Openstack Swift, and email. The paid version also backs up to Microsoft OneDrive, Microsoft Azure, Google Cloud Storage, Backblaze B2, SFTP, SCP, and WebDAV.</p>
<div class="embed-vimeo" style="text-align: center;"><iframe src="https://player.vimeo.com/video/154870690" width="640" height="360" frameborder="0" webkitallowfullscreen mozallowfullscreen allowfullscreen></iframe></div>
<h4>Don&#8217;t risk your backups on anything less</h4>
<p>Your WordPress backups are worth the entire investment you&#8217;ve made in your website. The day may come when you get hacked, when something goes wrong with an update, your server crashes or your hosting company goes bust &#8211; without good backups, you lose everything. Would you entrust all your hard work to a backup plugin with only a few thousand downloads, mixed reviews or no professional support?</p>
<p>Believe us: writing a reliable backup plugin that works consistently across the huge range of WordPress deployments is hard.</p>
<p>UpdraftPlus works. We&#8217;ll keep your backups safe.</p>
<h4>Why you should backup your website.</h4>
<p>WordPress like any CMS can be vulnerable to things such as server crashes, hacking, security flaws, bad plugin or theme updates and insecure web hosts. If anything happened to your website, it would cost you dearly in time, money and reputation.</p>
<p>Whilst other security measures are essential, backups are the ultimate insurance: they mean that, if the worst were to happen, your website (plus all related files and databases) stay safe, and can be restored in no time.</p>
<p>You could always create your own manual backups- but using backup plugin is infinitely quicker, simpler and safer. Life&#8217;s busy enough! With UpdraftPlus, you can simply &#8220;set and forget&#8221;, scheduling in automatic backups to save you time, work and hassle.</p>
<h4>How UpdraftPlus compares with other backup plugins:</h4>
<p>UpdraftPlus is the most highly-rated and popular plugin out there &#8211; and for good reason. Not only is it comprehensive in terms of its features, but it&#8217;s aso easy and intuitive to use. And because it has such a vast user base, it&#8217;s tried and tested in a whole range of different situations and scenarios.</p>
<p>Unlike many other plugins, UpdraftPlus:</p>
<ul>
<li>Restores, as well as backing up</li>
<li>Backs up to more cloud options than any others</li>
<li>Allows you to set up automatic backup schedules, for the ultimate in convenience</li>
<li>Is faster, using up fewer server resources</li>
<li>Has been tested on over 1 million sites</li>
</ul>
<p>On our website, we&#8217;ve got a whole page dedicated to how our Premium version compares with the competition <a href="https://updraftplus.com/comparison-updraftplus-free-updraftplus-premium/" rel="nofollow ugc">here</a></p>
<h4>UpdraftPlus Premium</h4>
<p>The free version of UpdraftPlus works just fine, but if you need more features and options you can purchase our Premium version. Here are some of the many features of UpdraftPlus Premium:</p>
<ul>
<li>Incremental backups</li>
<li>Easily duplicates or migrates websites (with Migrator)</li>
<li>Multisite/multi-network compatible</li>
<li>Backs up non WP files and databases to multiple remote destinations</li>
<li>More storage destinations (e.g. OneDrive, BackBlaze, Azure, SFTP) and multiple destinations</li>
<li>Database encryption</li>
<li>Advanced reporting</li>
<li>Supports WP-CLI</li>
<li>Free dedicated expert support</li>
</ul>
<p>Find out more <a href="https://updraftplus.com/comparison-updraftplus-free-updraftplus-premium/" rel="nofollow ugc">on our comparison page</a>. UpdraftPlus Premium is available for purchase <a href="https://updraftplus.com/shop/" rel="nofollow ugc">here</a></p>
<h4>Managing multiple website backups</h4>
<p>We&#8217;ve also developed a brilliant new plugin that allows you to backup, update and manage all of your websites remotely from one central location. It&#8217;s called <a href="https://updraftcentral.com" rel="nofollow ugc">UpdraftCentral</a>, and it comes in 2 different forms:</p>
<ul>
<li>UpdraftCentral (free, self-hosted)</li>
<li>UpdraftCentral Premium (fully-hosted and &#8220;ready-to-go&#8221;, cloud version also available)</li>
</ul>
<h4>Instantly create a temporary clone of your site (UpdraftClone)</h4>
<p>A temporary clone is an instant copy of this website, running on our servers. You don&#8217;t need to test or develop on your live site; instead, you can UpdraftClone it, and throw away your clone when done. <a href="https://updraftplus.com/updraftclone/" rel="nofollow ugc">Learn more about UpdraftClone here.</a></p>
<ul>
<li>Easy: Press the buttons&#8230; UpdraftClone does the work.</li>
<li>Reliable: Runs on capacity from a leading cloud computing provider.</li>
<li>Secure: One VPS (Virtual Private Server) per clone, shared with nobody.</li>
<li>Fast: Takes just the time needed to create a backup and send it.</li>
<li>Flexible: If you want, test upgrading to a different PHP or WP version.</li>
</ul>
<p>To create a temporary clone you need: 1) credit in your account and 2) to connect to your account. You can buy UpdraftClone tokens <a href="https://updraftplus.com/shop/updraftclone-tokens/" rel="nofollow ugc">from our shop, here</a>.</p>
<h4>Are you multi-lingual? Can you translate?</h4>
<p>Are you able to translate UpdraftPlus into another language? Are you ready to help speakers of your language? UpdraftPlus Backup/Restore itself is ready and waiting &#8211; the only work needed is the translating. The translation process is easy, and web-based &#8211; go here for instructions: <a href="https://updraftplus.com/translate/" rel="nofollow ugc">https://updraftplus.com/translate/</a>. (Or if you&#8217;re an expert WordPress translator already, then just pick out the .pot file from the wp-content/plugins/updraftplus/languages/ directory &#8211; if you scan for translatable strings manually, then you need to get these functions: _x(), __(), _e(), _ex(), log_e()).</p>
<p>Many thanks to the existing translators &#8211; listed at: <a href="https://updraftplus.com/translate/" rel="nofollow ugc">https://updraftplus.com/translate/</a></p>
<h4>More premium plugins</h4>
<p>If you are in the market for other WordPress premium plugins (especially WooCommerce addons), then try <a href="https://www.simbahosting.co.uk/s3/shop/" rel="nofollow ugc">our sister shop, here</a>.</p>
<p>For other useful free plugins see <a href="https://profiles.wordpress.org/davidanderson/#content-plugins" rel="nofollow ugc">our lead developer&#8217;s profile, here</a>.</p>

Brachhold</a>";s:14:"author_profile";s:36:"https://profiles.wordpress.org/arnee";s:8:"requires";s:3:"3.3";s:6:"tested";s:5:"5.3.2";s:12:"requires_php";b:0;s:13:"compatibility";a:0:{}s:6:"rating";d:98;s:7:"ratings";a:5:{i:5;i:2010;i:4;i:32;i:3;i:11;i:2;i:4;i:1;i:50;}s:11:"num_ratings";i:2107;s:15:"support_threads";i:30;s:24:"support_threads_resolved";i:2;s:10:"downloaded";i:26203416;s:12:"last_updated";s:21:"2019-11-13 9:21pm GMT";s:5:"added";s:10:"2005-06-16";s:8:"homepage";s:47:"http://www.arnebrachhold.de/redir/sitemap-home/";s:8:"sections";a:5:{s:11:"description";s:2498:"<p>Use this plugin to greatly improve SEO to create special XML sitemaps which will help search engines like Google, Bing, Yahoo and Ask.com to better index your site.</p>
<p>With such a sitemap, it&#8217;s much easier for the crawlers to see the complete structure of your site and retrieve it more efficiently. The plugin supports all kinds of WordPress generated pages as well as custom URLs. Additionally it notifies all major search engines every time you create a post about the new content.</p>
<p>Supported since <em>over 9 years</em> and rated as the <a href="https://wordpress.org/plugins/browse/top-rated/">best WordPress plugin</a>, it will do exactly what it&#8217;s supposed to do &#8211; providing a complete XML sitemap for search engines. It will not break your site, slow it down or annoy you. Guaranteed!</p>
<blockquote>
<p>If you like the plugin, feel free to rate it (on the right side of this page)! 🙂</p>
</blockquote>
<p>Related Links:</p>
<ul>
<li><a href="http://www.arnebrachhold.de/projects/wordpress-plugins/google-xml-sitemaps-generator/" title="Google XML Sitemaps Plugin for WordPress" rel="nofollow ugc">Plugin Homepage</a></li>
<li><a href="http://www.arnebrachhold.de/projects/wordpress-plugins/google-xml-sitemaps-generator/changelog/" title="Changelog of the Google XML Sitemaps Plugin for WordPress" rel="nofollow ugc">Changelog</a></li>
<li><a href="http://www.arnebrachhold.de/projects/wordpress-plugins/google-xml-sitemaps-generator/help/" title="Google Sitemaps FAQ" rel="nofollow ugc">Plugin help and sitemaps FAQ</a></li>
<li><a href="https://wordpress.org/support/topic/read-before-opening-a-new-support-topic">Support Forum</a></li>
</ul>
<h3>License</h3>
<p>Good news, this plugin is free for everyone! Since it&#8217;s released under the GPL, you can use it free of charge on your personal or commercial site.</p>
<h3>Translations</h3>
<p>The plugin comes with various translations, please refer to the <a href="https://codex.wordpress.org/Installing_WordPress_in_Your_Language" title="Installing WordPress in Your Language" rel="nofollow ugc">WordPress Codex</a> for more information about activating the translation. If you want to help to translate the plugin to your language, please have a look at the sitemap.pot file which contains all definitions and may be used with a <a href="http://www.gnu.org/software/gettext/" rel="nofollow ugc">gettext</a> editor like <a href="http://www.poedit.net/" rel="nofollow ugc">Poedit</a> (Windows).</p>
";s:12:"installation";s:519:"<ol>
<li>Install the plugin like you always install plugins, either by uploading it via FTP or by using the &#8220;Add Plugin&#8221; function of WordPress.</li>
<li>Activate the plugin at the plugin administration page</li>
<li>If you want: Open the plugin configuration page, which is located under Settings -&gt; XML-Sitemap and customize settings like priorities and change frequencies.</li>
<li>The plugin will automatically update your sitemap of you publish a post, so there is nothing more to do 🙂</li>
</ol>
";s:3:"faq";s:3110:"
<h4>Where can I find the options page of the plugin?</h4>
<p>
<p>It is under Settings &gt; XML Sitemap. I know nowadays many plugins add top-level menu items, but in most of the cases it is just not necessary. I&#8217;ve seen WP installations which looked like an Internet Explorer ten years ago with 20 toolbars installed. 😉</p>
</p>
<h4>Do I have to create a sitemap.xml and sitemap.xml.gz by myself?</h4>
<p>
<p>Not anymore. Since version 4, these files are dynamically generated. <em>There must be no sitemap.xml or sitemap.xml.gz in your site directory anymore!</em> The plugin will try to rename them to sitemap.xml.bak if they still exists.</p>
</p>
<h4>Does this plugin use static files or &#8220;I can&#8217;t find the sitemap.xml file!&#8221;</h4>
<p>
<p>Not anymore. Since version 4, these files are dynamically generated just like any other WordPress content.</p>
</p>
<h4>There are no comments yet (or I&#8217;ve disabled them) and all my postings have a priority of zero!</h4>
<p>
<p>Please disable automatic priority calculation and define a static priority for posts.</p>
</p>
<h4>So many configuration options&#8230; Do I need to change them?</h4>
<p>
<p>No, only if you want to. Default values are ok for most sites.</p>
</p>
<h4>Does this plugin work with all WordPress versions?</h4>
<p>
<p>This version works with WordPress 3.3 and better. If you&#8217;re using an older version, please check the <a href="http://www.arnebrachhold.de/projects/wordpress-plugins/google-xml-sitemaps-generator/" title="Google (XML) Sitemap Generator Plugin Homepage" rel="nofollow ugc">Google Sitemaps Plugin Homepage</a> for the legacy releases. There is a working release for every WordPress version since 1.5, but you really should consider updating your WordPress installation!</p>
</p>
<h4>My question isn&#8217;t answered here</h4>
<p>
<p>Most of the plugin options are described at the <a href="http://www.arnebrachhold.de/projects/wordpress-plugins/google-xml-sitemaps-generator/" rel="nofollow ugc">plugin homepage</a> as well as the dedicated <a href="http://www.arnebrachhold.de/projects/wordpress-plugins/google-xml-sitemaps-generator/help/" title="List of common questions / problems regarding Google (XML) Sitemaps" rel="nofollow ugc">Google Sitemaps FAQ</a>.</p>
</p>
<h4>My question isn&#8217;t even answered there</h4>
<p>
<p>Please post your question at the <a href="https://wordpress.org/support/topic/read-before-opening-a-new-support-topic">WordPress support forum</a> and tag your post with &#8220;google-sitemap-generator&#8221;.</p>
</p>
<h4>What&#8217;s new in the latest version?</h4>
<p>
<p>The changelog is maintained <a href="http://www.arnebrachhold.de/projects/wordpress-plugins/google-xml-sitemaps-generator/changelog/" title="Google (XML) Sitemap Generator Plugin Changelog" rel="nofollow ugc">here</a></p>
</p>
<h4>Why is the changelog on a separate page and not here?</h4>
<p>
<p>The WordPress.org repository is just another place to download this plugin. I don&#8217;t want to maintain too many pages with the same content. Thank you for your understanding!</p>
</p>

";s:9:"changelog";s:20855:"<h4>4.1.0 (2018-12-18)</h4>
<ul>
<li>Fixed security issue related to escaping external URLs</li>
<li>Fixed security issue related to option tags in forms</li>
</ul>
<h4>4.0.9 (2017-07-24)</h4>
<ul>
<li>Fixed security issue related to donation functionality.</li>
</ul>
<h4>4.0.8 (2014-11-15)</h4>
<ul>
<li>Fixed bug regarding the exclude categories feature, thanks to Claus Schöffel!</li>
</ul>
<h4>4.0.7.1 (2014-09-02)</h4>
<ul>
<li>Sorry, no new features this time… This release only updates the Compatibility-Tag to WordPress 4.0. Unfortunately there is no way to do this anymore without a new version</li>
</ul>
<h4>4.0.7 (2014-06-23)</h4>
<ul>
<li>Better compatibility with GoDaddy managed WP hosting</li>
<li>Better compatibility with QuickCache</li>
<li>Removed WordPress version from the sitemap</li>
<li>Corrected link to WordPress privacy settings (if search engines are blocked)</li>
<li>Changed hook which is being used for sitemap pings to avoid pings on draft edit</li>
</ul>
<h4>4.0.6 (2014-06-03)</h4>
<ul>
<li>Added option to disable automatic gzipping</li>
<li>Fixed bug with duplicated external sitemap entries</li>
<li>Don’t gzip if behind Varnish since Varnish can do that</li>
</ul>
<h4>4.0.5 (2014-05-18)</h4>
<ul>
<li>Added function to manually start ping for main-sitemap or all sub-sitemaps</li>
<li>Added support for changing the base of the sitemap URL to another URL (for WP installations in sub-folders)</li>
<li>Fixed issue with empty post sitemaps (related to GMT/local time offset)</li>
<li>Fixed some timing issues in archives</li>
<li>Improved check for possible problems before gzipping</li>
<li>Fixed empty archives and author sitemaps in case there were no posts</li>
<li>Fixed bug which caused the Priority Provider to disappear in recent PHP versions</li>
<li>Plugin will also ping with the corresponding sub-sitemap in case a post was modified</li>
<li>Better checking for empty external urls</li>
<li>Changed text in XSL template to be more clear about sitemap-index and sub-sitemaps</li>
<li>Changed content type to text/xml to improve compatibility with caching plugins</li>
<li>Changed query parameters to is_feed=true to improve compatibility with caching plugins</li>
<li>Switched from using WP_Query to load posts to a custom SQL statement to avoid problems with other plugin filters</li>
<li>Added caching of some SQL statements</li>
<li>Added support feed for more help topics</li>
<li>Added link to new help page</li>
<li>Cleaned up code and renamed variables to be more readable</li>
<li>Updated Japanese Translation, thanks to Daisuke Takahashi</li>
</ul>
<h4>4.0.4 (2014-04-19)</h4>
<ul>
<li>Removed deprecated get_page call</li>
<li>Changed last modification time of sub-sitemaps to the last modification date of the posts instead of the publish date</li>
<li>Removed information window if the statistic option has not been activated</li>
<li>Added link regarding new sitemap format</li>
<li>Updated Portuguese translation, thanks to Pedro Martinho</li>
<li>Updated German translation</li>
</ul>
<h4>4.0.3 (2014-04-13)</h4>
<ul>
<li>Fixed compression if an gzlib handler was already active</li>
<li>Help regarding permalinks for Nginx users</li>
<li>Fix with gzip compression in case there was other output before already</li>
<li>Return 404 for HTML sitemaps if the option has been disabled</li>
<li>Updated translations</li>
</ul>
<h4>4.0.2 (2014-04-01)</h4>
<ul>
<li>Fixed warning if an gzip handler is already active</li>
</ul>
<h4>4.0.1 (2014-03-31)</h4>
<ul>
<li>Fixed bug with custom post types including a &#8220;-&#8220;</li>
<li>Fixed some 404 Not Found Errors</li>
</ul>
<h4>4.0 (2014-03-30)</h4>
<ul>
<li>No static files anymore, sitemap is created on the fly!</li>
<li>Sitemap is split-up into sub-sitemaps by month, allowing up to 50.000 posts per month! <a href="http://www.arnebrachhold.de/projects/wordpress-plugins/google-xml-sitemaps-generator/google-xml-sitemap-generator-new-sitemap-format/" rel="nofollow ugc">More information</a></li>
<li>Support for custom post types and custom taxonomis!</li>
<li>100% Multisite compatible, including by-blog and network activation.</li>
<li>Reduced server resource usage due to less content per request.</li>
<li>New API allows other plugins to add their own, separate sitemaps.</li>
<li>Note: PHP 5.1 and WordPress 3.3 is required! The plugin will not work with lower versions!</li>
<li>Note: This version will try to rename your old sitemap files to *-old.xml. If that doesn’t work, please delete them manually since no static files are needed anymore!</li>
</ul>
<h4>3.4.1 (2014-04-10)</h4>
<ul>
<li>Compatibility with mysqli</li>
</ul>
<h4>Version 3.4 (2013-11-24)</h4>

<li>Filter out hashs (#) in URLs</li>
</ul>
<h4>3.2.9 (2013-01-11)</h4>

<h4>3.1.3 (2009-06-07)</h4>
<ul>
<li>Changed MSN Live Search to Bing</li>
<li>Exclude categories also now exludes the category itself and not only the posts</li>
<li>Pings now use the new WordPress HTTP API instead of Snoopy</li>
<li>Fixed bug that in localized WP installations priorities could not be saved</li>
<li>The sitemap cron job is now cleared after a manual rebuild or after changing the config</li>
<li>Adjusted style of admin area for WP 2.8 and refreshed icons</li>
<li>Disabled the “Exclude categories” feature for WP 2.5.1, since it doesn’t have the required functions yet</li>
</ul>
<h4>3.1.2 (2008-12-26)</h4>

<li>Added compat. exceptions for WP 2.0 and WP 2.1</li>

<li>Updated namespace to support YAHOO and MSN</li>
</ul>
<h4>3.0b2 (2006-01-14)</h4>
<ul>
<li>Fixed several bugs reported by users</li>
</ul>
<h4>3.0b (2005-11-25)</h4>
<ul>
<li>WordPress 2.0 (Beta, RC1) compatible</li>
<li>Added different priority calculation modes and introduced an API to create custom ones (Some people didn’t like the way to calculate the post priority based on the count of user comments. This will give you the possibility to develop custom priority providers which fit your needs.)</li>
<li>Added support to use the <a href="http://www.alexking.org/blog/2005/07/27/popularity-contest-11/" rel="nofollow ugc">Popularity Contest</a> plugin by <a href="http://www.alexking.org/" rel="nofollow ugc">Alex King</a> to calculate post priority (If you are already using the Popularity Contest plugin, this will be the best way to determine the priority of the posts. Uses to new priority API noted above.)</li>
<li>Added option to exclude password protected posts (This was one of the most requested features.)</li>
<li>Posts and pages marked for publish with a date in the future won’t be included</li>
<li>Added function to start sitemap creation via GET and a secret key (If you are using external software which directly writes into the database without using the WordPress API, you can rebuild the sitemap with a simple HTTP Request. This can be made with a cron job for example.)</li>
<li>Improved compatibility with other plugins (There should no longer be problems with other plugins now which checked for existence of a specified function to determine if you are in the control panel or not.)</li>
<li>Recoded plugin architecture which is now fully OOP (The code is now cleaner and better to understand which makes it easier to modify. This should also avoid namespace problems.)</li>
<li>Improved speed and optimized settings handling (Settings and pages are only loaded if the sitemap generation process starts and not every time a page loads. This saves one MySQL Query on every request.)</li>
<li>Added Button to restore default configuration (Messed up the config? You’ll need just one click to restore all settings.)</li>
<li>Added log file to check everything is running (In the new log window you can see when your sitemap was rebuilt or if there was any error.)</li>
<li>Improved user-interface</li>
<li>Added several links to homepage and support (This includes the Notify List about new releases and the WordPress support forum.)</li>
</ul>
<h4>2.7 (2005-11-25)</h4>

<li>The plugin will automatically ping Google whenever the sitemap gets regenerated</li>

Thanks for this! Check <a href="https://codex.wordpress.org/WordPress_Localization" rel="nofollow ugc">the WordPress Codex</a> how to set the language in WordPress.</li>
<li>Added Japanese user interface by <a href="http://hiromasa.zone.ne.jp/" rel="nofollow ugc">Hiromasa</a></li>
<li>Added German user interface by me</li>

<p>With such a sitemap, it&#8217;s much easier for the crawlers to see the complete structure of your site and retrieve it more efficiently. The plugin supports all kinds of WordPress generated pages as well as custom URLs. Additionally it notifies all major search engines every time you create a post about the new content.</p>
<p>Supported since <em>over 9 years</em> and rated as the <a href="https://wordpress.org/plugins/browse/top-rated/">best WordPress plugin</a>, it will do exactly what it&#8217;s supposed to do &#8211; providing a complete XML sitemap for search engines. It will not break your site, slow it down or annoy you. Guaranteed!</p>
<blockquote>
<p>If you like the plugin, feel free to rate it (on the right side of this page)! 🙂</p>
</blockquote>
<p>Related Links:</p>
<ul>
<li><a href="http://www.arnebrachhold.de/projects/wordpress-plugins/google-xml-sitemaps-generator/" title="Google XML Sitemaps Plugin for WordPress" rel="nofollow ugc">Plugin Homepage</a></li>
<li><a href="http://www.arnebrachhold.de/projects/wordpress-plugins/google-xml-sitemaps-generator/changelog/" title="Changelog of the Google XML Sitemaps Plugin for WordPress" rel="nofollow ugc">Changelog</a></li>
<li><a href="http://www.arnebrachhold.de/projects/wordpress-plugins/google-xml-sitemaps-generator/help/" title="Google Sitemaps FAQ" rel="nofollow ugc">Plugin help and sitemaps FAQ</a></li>
<li><a href="https://wordpress.org/support/topic/read-before-opening-a-new-support-topic">Support Forum</a></li>
</ul>
<h3>License</h3>
<p>Good news, this plugin is free for everyone! Since it&#8217;s released under the GPL, you can use it free of charge on your personal or commercial site.</p>
<h3>Translations</h3>
<p>The plugin comes with various translations, please refer to the <a href="https://codex.wordpress.org/Installing_WordPress_in_Your_Language" title="Installing WordPress in Your Language" rel="nofollow ugc">WordPress Codex</a> for more information about activating the translation. If you want to help to translate the plugin to your language, please have a look at the sitemap.pot file which contains all definitions and may be used with a <a href="http://www.gnu.org/software/gettext/" rel="nofollow ugc">gettext</a> editor like <a href="http://www.poedit.net/" rel="nofollow ugc">Poedit</a> (Windows).</p>
