GMT";s:5:"added";s:10:"2013-06-19";s:8:"homepage";s:97:"https://www.mc4wp.com/#utm_source=wp-plugin&utm_medium=mailchimp-for-wp&utm_campaign=plugins-page";s:8:"sections";a:5:{s:11:"description";s:5436:"<h4>Mailchimp for WordPress</h4>
<p><em>Allowing your visitors to subscribe to your newsletter should be easy. With this plugin, it finally is.</em></p>
<p>This plugin helps you grow your Mailchimp lists and write better newsletters through various methods. You can create good looking opt-in forms or integrate with any existing form on your site, like your comment, contact or checkout form.</p>
<span class="embed-youtube" style="text-align:center; display: block;"><iframe class='youtube-player' type='text/html' width='640' height='360' src='https://www.youtube.com/embed/fZCYPnFybqU?version=3&#038;rel=1&#038;fs=1&#038;autohide=2&#038;showsearch=0&#038;showinfo=1&#038;iv_load_policy=1&#038;wmode=transparent' allowfullscreen='true' style='border:0;'></iframe></span>
<h4>Some (but not all) features</h4>
<ul>
<li>
<p>Connect with your Mailchimp account in seconds.</p>
</li>
<li>
<p>Sign-up forms which are good looking, user-friendly and mobile optimized. You have complete control over the form fields and can send anything you like to Mailchimp.</p>
</li>
<li>
<p>Seamless integration with the following plugins:</p>
<ul>
<li>Default WordPress Comment Form</li>
<li>Default WordPress Registration Form</li>
<li>Contact Form 7</li>
<li>WooCommerce</li>
<li>Gravity Forms</li>
<li>Ninja Forms 3</li>
<li>WPForms</li>
<li>BuddyPress</li>
<li>MemberPress</li>
<li>Events Manager</li>
<li>Easy Digital Downloads</li>
<li>Give</li>
<li>UltimateMember</li>
</ul>
</li>
<li>
<p>A multitude of available add-on plugins and integrations:</p>
<ul>
<li><a href="https://www.mc4wp.com/#utm_source=wp-plugin-repo&amp;utm_medium=mailchimp-for-wp&amp;utm_campaign=add-on-list" rel="nofollow ugc">Mailchimp for WordPress Premium</a></li>
<li><a href="https://wordpress.org/plugins/mailchimp-top-bar/">Mailchimp Top Bar</a></li>
<li><a href="https://wordpress.org/plugins/mc4wp-activity/">Mailchimp Activity</a></li>
<li><a href="https://wordpress.org/plugins/boxzilla/">Boxzilla Pop-ups</a></li>
<li><a href="https://www.google.com/recaptcha/" rel="nofollow ugc">Google reCAPTCHA</a></li>
<li><a href="https://wordpress.org/plugins/goodbye-captcha/">WPBruiser anti-spam</a></li>
</ul>
</li>
<li>
<p>Well documented. Our <a href="https://www.mc4wp.com/kb/" rel="nofollow ugc">knowledge base</a> is updated daily.</p>
</li>
<li>
<p>Developer friendly. For inspiration, check out our <a href="https://github.com/ibericode/mc4wp-snippets" rel="nofollow ugc">repository of example code snippets</a>.</p>
</li>
</ul>
<blockquote>
<h4>Become a Premium user</h4>
<p>Mailchimp for WordPress has a Premium add-on which comes with several additional benefits.</p>
<ul>
<li>Multiple forms</li>
<li>Advanced e-commerce integration for WooCommerce</li>
<li>Email notifications</li>
<li>An easy way to style your forms</li>
<li>Detailed reports &amp; statistics</li>
</ul>
<p><a href="https://www.mc4wp.com/features/#utm_source=wp-plugin-repo&amp;utm_medium=mailchimp-for-wp&amp;utm_campaign=after-features-link" rel="nofollow ugc">View more Premium features</a></p>
</blockquote>
<h4>What is Mailchimp?</h4>
<p>Mailchimp is a newsletter service that allows you to send out email campaigns to a list of email subscribers. It is free for lists up to 2000 subscribers, which is why it is the newsletter-service of choice for thousands of businesses.</p>
<p>This plugin allows you to tightly integrate your WordPress site with your Mailchimp account.</p>
<p>If you are not yet using Mailchimp, <a href="http://mailchimp.com/monkey-rewards/?utm_source=freemium_newsletter&amp;utm_medium=email&amp;utm_campaign=monkey_rewards&amp;aid=a2d08947dcd3683512ce174c5&amp;afl=1" rel="nofollow ugc">creating an account is 100% free and only takes you about 30 seconds</a>.</p>
<h4>Support</h4>
<p>Use the <a href="https://wordpress.org/support/plugin/mailchimp-for-wp">WordPress.org plugin forums</a> for community support where we try to help all of our users. If you found a bug, please create an issue on Github where we can act upon them more efficiently.</p>
<p>If you&#8217;re a premium user, please use the email address inside the plugin for support as that will guarantee a faster response time.</p>
<p>Please take a look at the <a href="https://www.mc4wp.com/kb/#utm_source=wp-plugin-repo&amp;utm_medium=mailchimp-for-wp&amp;utm_campaign=description" rel="nofollow ugc">Mailchimp for WordPress knowledge base</a> as well.</p>
<h4>Add-on plugins</h4>
<p>There are several <a href="https://www.mc4wp.com/add-ons/#utm_source=wp-plugin-repo&amp;utm_medium=mailchimp-for-wp&amp;utm_campaign=description" rel="nofollow ugc">add-on plugins</a> available, which help you get even more out of your site.</p>
<h4>Translations</h4>
<p>You can <a href="https://translate.wordpress.org/projects/wp-plugins/mailchimp-for-wp/stable/" rel="nofollow ugc">help translate Mailchimp for WordPress into your language</a> using your WordPress.org account.</p>
<h4>Development</h4>
<p>This plugin is being developed on GitHub. If you want to collaborate, please look at <a href="https://github.com/ibericode/mailchimp-for-wordpress" rel="nofollow ugc">ibericode/mailchimp-for-wordpress</a>.</p>
<h4>Customizing the plugin</h4>
<p>The plugin provides various filter &amp; action hooks that allow you to modify or extend default behavior. We&#8217;re also maintaining a <a href="https://github.com/ibericode/mc4wp-snippets" rel="nofollow ugc">collection of sample code snippets</a>.</p>
";s:12:"installation";s:1637:"<h4>Installing the plugin</h4>
<ol>
<li>In your WordPress admin panel, go to <em>Plugins &gt; New Plugin</em>, search for <strong>Mailchimp for WordPress</strong> and click &#8220;<em>Install now</em>&#8220;</li>
<li>Alternatively, download the plugin and upload the contents of <code>mailchimp-for-wp.zip</code> to your plugins directory, which usually is <code>/wp-content/plugins/</code>.</li>
<li>Activate the plugin</li>
<li>Set <a href="https://admin.mailchimp.com/account/api" rel="nofollow ugc">your API key</a> in the plugin settings.</li>
</ol>
<h4>Configuring Sign-Up Form(s)</h4>
<ol>
<li>Go to <em>Mailchimp for WP &gt; Forms</em></li>
<li>Select at least one list to subscribe people to.</li>
<li><em>(Optional)</em> Add more fields to your form.</li>
<li>Embed a sign-up form in pages or posts using the <code>[mc4wp_form]</code> shortcode.</li>
<li>Show a sign-up form in your widget areas using the &#8220;Mailchimp Sign-Up Form&#8221; widget.</li>
<li>
<p>Show a sign-up form from your theme files by using the following PHP function.</p>
<p>&lt;?php</p>
<p>if( function_exists( &#8216;mc4wp_show_form&#8217; ) ) {<br />
    mc4wp_show_form();<br />
}</p>
</li>
</ol>
<h4>Need help?</h4>
<p>Please take a look at the <a href="https://www.mc4wp.com/kb/#utm_source=wp-plugin-repo&amp;utm_medium=mailchimp-for-wp&amp;utm_campaign=installation-instructions-link" rel="nofollow ugc">Mailchimp for WordPress knowledge base</a> first.</p>
<p>If you can&#8217;t find an answer there, please look through the <a href="https://wordpress.org/support/plugin/mailchimp-for-wp">plugin support forums</a> or start your own topic.</p>
";s:3:"faq";s:3615:"
<h4>More documentation</h4>
<p>
<p>More detailed documentation can be found in the <a href="https://www.mc4wp.com/kb/#utm_source=wp-plugin-repo&amp;utm_medium=mailchimp-for-wp&amp;utm_campaign=faq" rel="nofollow ugc">Mailchimp for WordPress knowledge base</a>.</p>
</p>
<h4>How to display a form in posts or pages?</h4>
<p>
<p>Use the <code>[mc4wp_form]</code> shortcode.</p>
</p>
<h4>How to display a form in widget areas like the sidebar or footer?</h4>
<p>
<p>Go to <strong>Appearance &gt; Widgets</strong> and use the <strong>Mailchimp for WP Form</strong> widget that comes with the plugin.</p>
</p>
<h4>Where can I find my API key to connect to Mailchimp?</h4>
<p>
<p><a href="http://kb.mailchimp.com/accounts/management/about-api-keys#Find-or-Generate-Your-API-Key" rel="nofollow ugc">You can find your API key here</a></p>
</p>
<h4>How to add a sign-up checkbox to my Contact Form 7 form?</h4>
<p>
<p>Use the following shortcode in your CF7 form to display a newsletter sign-up checkbox.</p>
<pre><code>[mc4wp_checkbox "Subscribe to our newsletter?"]
</code></pre>
</p>
<h4>The form shows a success message but subscribers are not added to my list(s)?</h4>
<p>
<p>If the form shows a success message, there is no doubt that the sign-up request succeeded. Mailchimp could have a slight delay sending the confirmation email though, please just be patient and make sure to check your SPAM folder.</p>
<p>When you have double opt-in disabled, new subscribers will be seen as <em>imports</em> by Mailchimp. They will not show up in your daily digest emails or statistics. <a href="http://blog.mailchimp.com/double-opt-in-vs-single-opt-in-stats/" rel="nofollow ugc">We always recommend leaving double opt-in enabled</a>.</p>
</p>
<h4>How can I style the sign-up form?</h4>
<p>
<p>You can use custom CSS to style the sign-up form if you do not like the themes that come with the plugin. The following selectors can be used to target the various form elements.</p>
<pre><code>.mc4wp-form { ... } /* the form element */
.mc4wp-form p { ... } /* form paragraphs */
.mc4wp-form label { ... } /* labels */
.mc4wp-form input { ... } /* input fields */
.mc4wp-form input[type="checkbox"] { ... } /* checkboxes */
.mc4wp-form input[type="submit"] { ... } /* submit button */
.mc4wp-alert { ... } /* success &amp; error messages */
.mc4wp-success { ... } /* success message */
.mc4wp-error { ... } /* error messages */
</code></pre>
<p>You can add your custom CSS to your theme stylesheet or (easier) by using a plugin like <a href="https://wordpress.org/plugins/simple-custom-css/#utm_source=wp-plugin-repo&amp;utm_medium=mailchimp-for-wp&amp;utm_campaign=after-css-link">Simple Custom CSS</a></p>
</p>
<h4>I&#8217;m getting an &#8220;HTTP Error&#8221; when trying to connect to Mailchimp</h4>
<p>
<p>If you&#8217;re getting an <code>HTTP Error</code> after entering your API key, please contact your webhost and ask them if they have PHP CURL installed and updated to the latest version (7.58.x). Make sure requests to <code>https://api.mailchimp.com/</code> are allowed as well.</p>
</p>
<h4>How do I show a sign-up form in a pop-up?</h4>
<p>
<p>We recommend the <a href="https://wordpress.org/plugins/boxzilla/">Boxzilla pop-up plugin</a> for this. You can use the form shortcode in your pop-up box to show a sign-up form.</p>
</p>
<h4>My question is not listed</h4>
<p>
<p>Please head over to the <a href="https://www.mc4wp.com/kb/#utm_source=wp-plugin-repo&amp;utm_medium=mailchimp-for-wp&amp;utm_campaign=faq" rel="nofollow ugc">Mailchimp for WordPress knowledge base</a> for more detailed documentation.</p>
</p>

";s:9:"changelog";s:58918:"<h4>4.7.5 &#8211; Feb 10, 2020</h4>
<ul>
<li>Add AMP compatibility to sign-up forms, thanks to Claudiu Lodromanean. This uses the <a href="https://amp-wp.org" rel="nofollow ugc">official AMP plugin for WordPress</a>.</li>
<li>Add settings key to WPML config so settings can easily by copied over to translated versions of a form.</li>
<li>Optimize size &amp; performance of JavaScript code, resulting in a file that is 40% smaller.</li>
<li>Update CodeMirror to its latest version.</li>
<li>Escape all string translations.</li>
</ul>
<h4>4.7.4 &#8211; Dec 7, 2019</h4>
<p><strong>Fixes</strong></p>
<ul>
<li>htaccess config for servers running Apache 2.4 or later.</li>
</ul>
<h4>4.7.3 &#8211; Dec 4, 2019</h4>
<p><strong>Fixes</strong></p>
<ul>
<li>Top Bar &amp; User Sync add-on using API v2 since version 4.7.1.</li>
<li>Revert change in formatter for date fields, breaking all forms with date fields in them.</li>
</ul>
<p><strong>Improvements</strong></p>
<ul>
<li>Add getter method for raw (unmodified) data on form class.</li>
</ul>
<h4>4.7.2 &#8211; Nov 27, 2019</h4>
<p><strong>Fixes</strong></p>
<ul>
<li>Invalid .htaccess file in case there already is one in the uploads directory.</li>
</ul>
<h4>4.7.1 &#8211; Nov 26, 2019</h4>
<p><strong>Improvements</strong></p>
<ul>
<li>Update MemberPress hook names. Thanks <a href="https://github.com/pixelated-au" rel="nofollow ugc">Ian Heggaton</a>!</li>
<li>Use WordPress.org translations instead of bundling translation files in plugin itself.</li>
<li>Write .htaccess to directory of debug log file, to prevent file access.</li>
<li>Add some convenient hooks for Checkout for WooCommerce.</li>
<li>Stop parsing shortcodes in text widgets as WordPress core does this since version 4.9.</li>
</ul>
<h4>4.7 &#8211; Nov 7, 2019</h4>
<p><strong>Improvements</strong></p>
<ul>
<li>Add role=alert to form notices.</li>
<li>Add setting to pre-check sign-up checkbox for Gravity Forms integrations.</li>
<li>Add new position for WooCommerce integration: directly after the billing_email field.</li>
<li>Fix PHP notices for submitting a form and saving a form as an administrator.</li>
<li>Add link to <a href="https://wordpress.org/plugins/koko-analytics/">Koko Analytics plugin</a>.</li>
</ul>
<h4>4.6.2 &#8211; Oct 24, 2019</h4>
<p><strong>Fixes</strong></p>
<ul>
<li>Address fields in forms would always be required (even if really optional).</li>
</ul>
<p><strong>Improvements</strong></p>
<ul>
<li>Add proper SVG admin menu icon.</li>
<li>Minor overall performance and memory usage improvements.</li>
</ul>
<h4>4.6.1 &#8211; Oct 7, 2019</h4>
<p><strong>Fixes</strong></p>
<ul>
<li>Fixed list cache usage for WPForms, Gravity Forms and Ninja Forms integrations.</li>
</ul>
<h4>4.6.0 &#8211; Oct 7, 2019</h4>
<p><strong>Improvements</strong></p>
<ul>
<li>Improved fetch and cache mechanism for retrieving Mailchimp account details, fetching data only when it is required.</li>
<li>Updated <a href="https://mithril.js.org/" rel="nofollow ugc">Mithril</a> and <a href="https://codemirror.net/" rel="nofollow ugc">CodeMirror</a> dependencies.</li>
<li>Decreased size of <code>forms.js</code> from 22KB to 9KB.</li>
<li>No longer requiring jQuery anywhere.</li>
<li>Increase API HTTP request timeout to 15 seconds.</li>
</ul>
<p>Please note that installing this update requires you to also update any add-ons like <a href="https://wordpress.org/plugins/mailchimp-top-bar/">Mailchimp Top Bar</a> and <a href="https://www.mc4wp.com/premium-features/" rel="nofollow ugc">Mailchimp for WordPress Premium</a> (if installed).</p>
<h4>4.5.5 &#8211; Sep 12, 2019</h4>
<p><strong>Fixes</strong></p>
<ul>
<li>Google reCAPTCHA script was still loading even if no forms have it enabled.</li>
</ul>
<h4>4.5.4 &#8211; Sep 11, 2019</h4>
<p><strong>Improvements</strong></p>
<ul>
<li>Removed custom color from menu item for improved accessibility.</li>
<li>Take birthday field format into account when sending data to Mailchimp.</li>
<li>Print Google reCAPTCHA script in footer.</li>
</ul>
<p><strong>Changes</strong></p>
<ul>
<li>Changed plugin name to MC4WP instead of Mailchimp for WordPress.</li>
</ul>
<h4>4.5.3 &#8211; July 23, 2019</h4>
<p><strong>Fixes</strong></p>
<ul>
<li>Temporarily switch status of pending subscribers to &#8220;unsubscribe&#8221; versus deleting susbcriber before re-subscribing.</li>
<li>Deprecation notice for Gravity Forms version 2.4 and higher.</li>
</ul>
<p><strong>Improvements</strong></p>
<ul>
<li>Filter out empty tags when applying tags to new subscribers.</li>
<li>Show all not installed integrations.</li>
<li>Show notice when form doesn&#8217;t have a Mailchimp list selected to subscribe people to.</li>
<li>Check function existence for compatibility with WordPress 4.7</li>
<li>Don&#8217;t submit form when Google reCAPTCHA is enabled but errors.</li>
<li>Update third-party JavaScript dependencies.</li>
</ul>
<h4>4.5.2 &#8211; May 8, 2019</h4>
<p><strong>Improvements</strong></p>
<ul>
<li>Accept more truthy values in custom integration for improved compatibility with third-party forms.</li>
<li>Update JavaScript dependencies.</li>
<li>Load Google reCaptcha script in footer (if needed).</li>
</ul>
<h4>4.5.1 &#8211; April 8, 2019</h4>
<p><strong>Additions</strong></p>
<ul>
<li>Add sign-up integration for <a href="https://wordpress.org/plugins/give/">Give</a></li>
<li>Add sign-up integration for <a href="https://wordpress.org/plugins/ultimate-member/">UltimateMember</a></li>
</ul>
<p><strong>Improvements</strong></p>
<ul>
<li>Write to debug log if Google reCAPTCHA secret key is incorrect.</li>
<li>Validate reCAPTCHA keys when savings form settings.</li>
<li>Allow setting an empty &#8220;successfully subscribed&#8221; message.</li>
</ul>
<h4>4.5.0 &#8211; March 27, 2019</h4>
<p><strong>Additions</strong></p>
<ul>
<li>Built-in integration with Google reCAPTCHA to prevent bots from subscribing to your Mailchimp lists.</li>
</ul>
<p><strong>Improvements</strong></p>
<ul>
<li>Minor improvements to the JavaScript that is loaded on admin pages.</li>
</ul>
<h4>4.4.0 &#8211; March 1, 2019</h4>
<p><strong>Fixes</strong></p>
<ul>
<li>AffiliateWP integration subscribing the wrong user if affiliate ID differs from user ID.</li>
</ul>
<p><strong>Improvements</strong></p>
<ul>
<li>Renamed &#8220;MailChimp&#8221; to &#8220;Mailchimp&#8221; to match Mailchimp&#8217;s new branding.</li>
<li>More accurate handling of timeouts for accounts with many MailChimp lists.</li>
<li>UX improvements for integrations overview page.</li>
<li>Validate MailChimp API key format when it&#8217;s entered.</li>
<li>Improved compatibility with Klarna Checkout in the WooCommerce checkout integration.</li>
<li>Bumped required PHP version to 5.3 (soft requirement for now).</li>
</ul>
<p><strong>Additions</strong></p>
<ul>
<li>Added Gutenberg block for easily adding a form to a post or page.</li>
<li>Added subscriber tags setting to forms.</li>
</ul>
<h4>4.3.3 &#8211; December 31, 2018</h4>
<p><strong>Fixes</strong></p>
<ul>
<li>Update WPForms integration to properly detect if the WPForms plugin is activated.</li>
</ul>
<p><strong>Improvements</strong></p>
<ul>
<li>Write API request parameters to the debug log in case of connection timeouts.</li>
<li>Update JavaScript dependencies.</li>
</ul>
<h4>4.3.2 &#8211; December 11, 2018</h4>
<p><strong>Fixes</strong></p>
<ul>
<li>Use of <code>readonly</code> function, which is only available in WordPress 4.9 or later.</li>
</ul>
<h4>4.3.1 &#8211; November 28, 2018</h4>
<p><strong>Fixes</strong></p>
<ul>
<li>Fatal error on PHP versions older than 5.5</li>
</ul>
<h4>4.3 &#8211; November 28, 2018</h4>
<p><strong>Additions</strong></p>
<ul>
<li>Added <code>MC4WP_API_KEY</code> PHP constant which can be used to set your Mailchimp API key.</li>
<li>Add <code>mc4wp_mailchimp_list_limit</code> filter hook to modify the maximum number of Mailchimp lists to fetch. Defaults to 200.</li>
</ul>
<p><strong>Improvements</strong></p>
<ul>
<li>Apply <code>mc4wp_integration_gravity-forms_options</code> filter hook on Gravity Forms integration options so the checkbox can be prechecked and the checkbox label text modified.</li>
<li>The <code>updated_subscriber</code> JS event is now fired forms not using AJAX as well (when applicable).</li>
</ul>
<h4>4.2.5 &#8211; Sep 11, 2018</h4>
<p><strong>Improvements</strong></p>
<ul>
<li>Only re-add subscriber to list if we want to re-trigger a double opt-in confirmation email.</li>
<li>Change Gravity Forms field name to &#8220;Mailchimp for WordPress&#8221;</li>
<li>Get rid of cached result of Mailchimp API connection.</li>
</ul>
<h4>4.2.4 &#8211; July 9, 2018</h4>
<p><strong>Improvements</strong></p>
<ul>
<li>Ensure type-safety on some global variables.</li>
<li>Stop showing trashed forms immediately.</li>
<li>Pre-check Mailchimp list when creating a new form if there is only 1 list.</li>
<li>Send <code>null</code> for unknown values in usage tracking data (only when opted-in).</li>
</ul>
<p><strong>Additions</strong></p>
<ul>
<li>Add methods for accessing Mailchimp&#8217;s e-commerce promo code endpoints to API class.</li>
</ul>
<h4>4.2.3 &#8211; June 11, 2018</h4>
<p><strong>Fixes</strong></p>
<ul>
<li>Don&#8217;t wrap &#8220;agree to terms&#8221; input in hyperlink element.</li>
<li>Allow [ENTER] key again after field helper overlay is closed.</li>
</ul>
<p><strong>Improvements</strong></p>
<ul>
<li>Fallback to meta-refresh if redirect fails because of &#8220;headers already sent&#8221; error.</li>
</ul>
<h4>4.2.2 &#8211; May 22, 2018</h4>

<li>Removed use of PHP 5.4 function.</li>

</ul>
<h4>4.2.1 &#8211; April 11, 2018</h4>
<p><strong>Fixes</strong></p>
<ul>
<li>Namespace usage warning when running PHP 5.2</li>
</ul>
<p><strong>Improvements</strong></p>
<ul>
<li>Remove obsolete <code>type</code> attribute from all <code>&lt;script&gt;</code> tags printed by the plugin.</li>
<li>Improved tooltips on settings pages.</li>
<li>Do not pre-check integration checkboxes by default.</li>
<li>Add textual warnings to settings that may affect <a href="https://www.mc4wp.com/kb/gdpr-compliance/" rel="nofollow ugc">GDPR compliance</a>.</li>
<li>Update translation files.</li>
</ul>
<h4>4.2 &#8211; March 5, 2018</h4>
<p><strong>Additions</strong></p>
<ul>
<li>Live form preview while editing form.</li>
</ul>
<p><strong>Improvements</strong></p>
<ul>
<li>Improved <a href="https://www.mc4wp.com/kb/conditional-fields-elements/" rel="nofollow ugc">conditional fields logic</a>.</li>
<li>Debug log now includes request &amp; response data.</li>
<li><a href="https://www.mc4wp.com/kb/javascript-form-events/" rel="nofollow ugc">Form JavaScript events</a> are fired in an isolated thread now, to prevent errors in event callbacks from breaking form functionality.</li>
<li>Don&#8217;t send empty field values to Mailchimp when updating subscribers.</li>
<li>Show interest grouping ID in list overview on settings page.</li>
</ul>
<p><strong>Fixes</strong></p>
<ul>
<li>Ninja Forms export checkbox would always state &#8220;checked&#8221; when form contained a Mailchimp sign-up checkbox.</li>
</ul>
<h4>4.1.15 &#8211; February 7, 2018</h4>
<p><strong>Fixes</strong></p>
<ul>
<li>Dropdown fields with special characters were not properly passed to Mailchimp.</li>
<li>Interest groups with an all-numeric ID were not properly passed to Mailchimp.</li>
</ul>
<p><strong>Improvements</strong></p>
<ul>
<li>Various minor code optimizations</li>
<li>Do not redirect when showing &#8220;already subscribed&#8221; warning.</li>
<li>Improved scroll to form handling after a form is submitted without AJAX.</li>
</ul>

<li>Make it clear that redirecting after successful form submissions will not show the &#8220;subscribed&#8221; message.</li>

</ul>
<h4>4.1.9 &#8211; September 19, 2017</h4>

<li>Custom integration now works with Enfold theme&#8217;s contact form element.</li>
</ul>
<h4>4.1.7 &amp; 4.1.8 &#8211; September 8, 2017</h4>
<p><strong>Fixes</strong></p>
<ul>
<li>Properly escape the return value of <code>add_query_arg</code> when it is used in HTML attributes to prevent cross-site scripting. Thanks to <a href="https://www.ripstech.com/" rel="nofollow ugc">Karim Ouerghemmi of RIPS</a> for responsibly disclosing.</li>
<li>Now loading integrations after WPML so that String Translations work properly.</li>
</ul>
<p><strong>Additions</strong></p>
<ul>
<li>Add sign-up integration for WPForms forms.</li>
</ul>
<p><strong>Improvements</strong></p>
<ul>
<li>Updated internal JS dependencies.</li>
<li>Form tag <code>{data key="foo.bar"}</code> now allows you to access nested array values.</li>
</ul>
<h4>4.1.6 &#8211; July 31, 2017</h4>
<p><strong>Fixes</strong></p>
<ul>
<li>Method on API class for retrieving campaign data.</li>
</ul>
<p><strong>Improvements</strong></p>
<ul>
<li>Show Akamai reference number when an API request is blocked by Mailchimp&#8217;s firewall.</li>
<li>Minor output buffering improvements in form previewer.</li>
</ul>
<h4>4.1.5 &#8211; June 27, 2017</h4>
<p><strong>Fixes</strong></p>
<ul>
<li>Failsafe against outputting sign-up checkbox twice in registration forms.</li>
<li>Properly close HTML anchor element in French translation files.</li>
<li>Fix BuddyPress sign-ups when using WordPress Multisite.</li>
</ul>
<p><strong>Improvements</strong></p>
<ul>
<li>Fire action hook <code>mc4wp_form_updated_subscriber</code> whenever a form was used to update a subscriber in Mailchimp.</li>
<li>Increase browser timeout for AJAX request when fetching Mailchimp lists.</li>
</ul>
<p><strong>Additions</strong></p>
<ul>
<li>Added campaign &amp; template methods to API client class.</li>
</ul>
<h4>4.1.4 &#8211; June 15, 2017</h4>

<li>Notice that asks for a plugin review would re-appear after dismissing it.</li>
</ul>
<h4>4.1.3 &#8211; May 24, 2017</h4>

</ul>

<li>Updated JavaScript dependencies.</li>
</ul>
<h4>4.1.0 &#8211; March 14, 2017</h4>
<p><strong>Improvements</strong></p>
<ul>
<li>Updated all JavaScript dependencies in the plugin.</li>
<li>Failsafed filter hooks to prevent invalid variable types.</li>
<li>Explain that greyed out integrations means that specific plugin is not activated.</li>
<li>Conditional form elements now uses event delegation, so it works with forms in <a href="https://boxzillaplugin.com/" rel="nofollow ugc">Boxzilla pop-ups</a>.</li>
<li>Updated language files.</li>
</ul>
<p><strong>Additions</strong></p>
<ul>
<li>Added support for Ninja Forms 3.</li>
<li>Added <code>mc4wp_integration_show_checkbox</code> filter.</li>
</ul>
<h4>4.0.13 &#8211; February 8, 2017</h4>
<p><strong>Improvements</strong></p>
<ul>
<li>Ensure fields are HTML decoded before sending to Mailchimp.</li>
<li>Better OptimizePress compatibility.</li>
<li>Show all address-type fields as required when form contains 1 or more fields of the same address group.</li>
</ul>
<h4>4.0.12 &#8211; January 16, 2017</h4>
<p><strong>Fixes</strong></p>
<ul>
<li>Don&#8217;t call <code>stripslashes</code> on POST data twice.</li>
</ul>
<p><strong>Improvements</strong></p>
<ul>
<li>Plugin review notice is now dismissible over AJAX.</li>
<li>Improved formatting of birthday fields.</li>
<li>Updated Polish translations, thanks to Mateusz Lomber.</li>
<li>Updated German translations, thanks to Sven de Vries.</li>
</ul>
<p><strong>Additions</strong></p>
<ul>
<li>Add <code>update_ecommerce_store_product</code> method to API class.</li>
<li>Throw form specific JavaScript events, like <code>15.subscribed</code> to hook into &#8220;subscribed&#8221; events for form with ID 15.</li>
</ul>
<h4>4.0.11 &#8211; December 9, 2016</h4>
<p><strong>Fixes</strong></p>
<ul>
<li>Unescaped request variable on integration settings page, allowing for authenticated XSS. Thanks to <a href="https://security.dxw.com/" rel="nofollow ugc">dxwsecurity</a> for responsibly disclosing.</li>
</ul>
<p><strong>Improvements</strong></p>
<ul>
<li>Add <code>$args</code> parameter to <code>API::get_lists_activity</code> method. Relates to the <a href="https://wordpress.org/plugins/mc4wp-activity/">Mailchimp Activity</a> plugin.</li>
</ul>
<h4>4.0.10 &#8211; December 6, 2016</h4>
<p><strong>Improvements</strong></p>
<ul>
<li>You can now enable or disable debug logging from the &#8220;Other&#8221; settings page.</li>
<li>No longer using deprecated function in Contact Form 7, thanks to <a href="https://github.com/stodorovic" rel="nofollow ugc">stodorovic</a>.</li>
<li>Improved UI for adding hidden interest groupings fields to a form.</li>
</ul>
<h4>4.0.9 &#8211; November 23, 2016</h4>
<p><strong>Fixes</strong></p>
<ul>
<li>Issue with escaped HTML when using form tags introduced by previous update.</li>
</ul>
<h4>4.0.8 &#8211; November 23, 2016</h4>
<p><strong>Improvements</strong></p>
<ul>
<li>Improved handling of large debug logs.</li>
<li>Improved error messages when writing exceptions to debug log.</li>
<li>Show notice when form is missing required Mailchimp fields.</li>
<li>Custom form integration now handles arrays with 1-level depth. Thanks to <a href="https://github.com/GarryOne" rel="nofollow ugc">Mardari Igor</a>.</li>
<li>You can now use nested tags in your form code, eg <code>{data key="utm_source" default="{current_path}"}</code></li>
</ul>
<p><strong>Additions</strong></p>
<ul>
<li>Add <code>data-hide-if</code> attribute logic to forms. See <a href="https://www.mc4wp.com/kb/conditional-fields-elements/" rel="nofollow ugc">conditionally hide form fields</a>. Thanks to <a href="http://kurtzenisek.com/" rel="nofollow ugc">Kurt Zenisek</a>.</li>
<li>Add hooks for delayed BuddyPress sign-up. Thanks to <a href="https://profiles.wordpress.org/needle" rel="nofollow ugc">Christian Wach</a>.</li>
</ul>
<h4>4.0.7 &#8211; October 25, 2016</h4>
<p><strong>Improvements</strong></p>
<ul>
<li>Obfuscate all email addresses in debug log. Thanks <a href="https://twitter.com/SJLfi" rel="nofollow ugc">Sauli Lepola</a>.</li>
<li>Ask for confirmation before disabling double opt-in, which we do not recommend.</li>
<li>Allow vertical resizing of debug log.</li>
<li>Failsafe against including JavaScript file twice.</li>
<li>No longer wrapping CF7 checkbox in paragraph tags.</li>
</ul>
<p><strong>Additions</strong></p>
<ul>
<li>Added <code>mc4wp_form_api_error</code> action hook for API errors encountered by forms.</li>
<li>Added <code>element_class</code> argument to <code>[mc4wp_form]</code> shortcode for adding CSS classes.</li>
</ul>
<h4>4.0.6 &#8211; October 10, 2016</h4>
<p><strong>Fixes</strong></p>
<ul>
<li>Issue with lists not showing when using W3 Total Cache with APCu object cache enabled.</li>
</ul>
<p><strong>Improvements</strong></p>
<ul>
<li>We&#8217;re no longer stripping newlines from text fields.</li>
</ul>
<p><strong>Additions</strong></p>
<ul>
<li>Added missing e-commerce related API methods to API class.</li>
</ul>
<h4>4.0.5 &#8211; September 29, 2016</h4>
<p><strong>Fixes</strong></p>
<ul>
<li>Allow checkbox option for the List Choice field (again).</li>
</ul>
<p><strong>Improvements</strong></p>
<ul>
<li>Fetch Mailchimp lists over AJAX, to speed up perceived performance (especially when your account has many lists).</li>
<li>Periodically fetch Mailchimp lists, so cache is always fresh.</li>
<li>Improved <code>&lt;label&gt;</code> element accessibility for checkbox integrations.</li>
<li>Stop using double underscore prefix in function names, as these are reserved in PHP 7.</li>
<li><code>{post}</code> and <code>{user}</code> shortcodes now accept a <code>default</code> parameter.</li>
</ul>
<p><strong>Additions</strong></p>
<ul>
<li>Add <a href="https://www.memberpress.com/" rel="nofollow ugc">MemberPress</a> integration.</li>
<li>Add missing e-commerce related API methods for next week&#8217;s <a href="https://www.mc4wp.com/kb/what-is-ecommerce/" rel="nofollow ugc">WooCommerce Mailchimp e-commerce integration</a> release.</li>
</ul>
<h4>4.0.4 &#8211; September 7, 2016</h4>
<p><strong>Improvements</strong></p>
<ul>
<li>Allow re-running previous migrations by visiting a certain admin URL.</li>
<li>Do not show checkboxes option for fields that only accept a single value.</li>
<li>Write field specific errors to debug log when Mailchimp denies a sign-up request.</li>
<li>Write to debug log when custom integrations can not find an EMAIL field.</li>
<li>Differentiate between connection &amp; authorization errors when testing connection to Mailchimp.</li>
<li>Bump limit of number of Mailchimp lists to fetch from 100 to 500.</li>
</ul>
<h4>4.0.3 &#8211; August 24, 2016</h4>
<p><strong>Fixes</strong></p>
<ul>
<li>Ninja Forms integration not working when using PayPal integration.</li>
</ul>
<p><strong>Improvements</strong></p>
<ul>
<li>Show connection errors on Mailchimp settings page.</li>
</ul>
<p><strong>Additions</strong></p>
<ul>
<li>Add pre-checked option to Ninja Forms integration.</li>
<li>You can now <a href="https://www.mc4wp.com/kb/conditional-fields-elements/" rel="nofollow ugc">conditionally hide fields or elements</a> using the <code>data-show-if</code> attribute.</li>
</ul>
<h4>4.0.2 &#8211; August 10, 2016</h4>
<p><strong>Fixes</strong></p>
<ul>
<li>Hidden fields which referenced interest groups by name were not sent to Mailchimp.</li>
<li>Adding hidden field to form would reset value on every change.</li>
</ul>
<p><strong>Improvements</strong></p>
<ul>
<li>Decrease file size of JavaScript for forms by about 30%.</li>
</ul>
<h4>4.0 &amp; 4.0.1 &#8211; August 9, 2016</h4>
<p>This release updates the plugin to version 3 of the Mailchimp API. Please <a href="https://www.mc4wp.com/kb/upgrading-to-4-0/" rel="nofollow ugc">read through the upgrade guide</a> before updating to make sure things keep working as expected for you.</p>
<p><strong>Changes</strong></p>
<ul>
<li>&#8220;Send welcome email&#8221; is now handled from your list settings in Mailchimp.</li>
<li>Filter <code>mc4wp_form_merge_vars</code> is now called <code>mc4wp_form_data</code>.</li>
<li>Filter <code>mc4wp_integration_merge_vars</code> is now called <code>mc4wp_integration_data</code>.</li>
<li>New format for GROUPING fields in forms &amp; filter hooks.</li>
<li>Value delimiter in hidden fields is now a pipe <code>|</code> character.</li>
</ul>
<p><strong>Additions</strong></p>
<ul>
<li>New filter: <code>mc4wp_form_subscriber_data</code>.</li>
<li>New filter: <code>mc4wp_integration_subscriber_data</code>.</li>
<li>New form tag: <code>{cookie name="mycookie"}</code></li>
</ul>
<p><strong>Improvements</strong></p>
<ul>
<li>The plugin now communicates with the latest &amp; greatest Mailchimp API.</li>
<li>Previously unsubscribed subscribers can now be re-added without errors.</li>
<li>Add <code>User-Agent</code> header to all API requests.</li>
<li>Available fields in form editor are now split-up by category.</li>
<li>Birthday fields now accept a broader range of values and delimiters.</li>
</ul>
<p><strong>Fixes</strong></p>
<ul>
<li>Issue with only 10 Mailchimp lists / fields / interests being returned.</li>
<li>Incorrect form message showing when double opt-in is disabled.</li>
<li>Error in upgrade routine when API request fails.</li>
<li>List fields not fetched when list has just 1 non-default merge field.</li>
</ul>
<h4>3.1.12 &#8211; July 28, 2016</h4>
<p><strong>Improvements</strong></p>
<ul>
<li>Smarter scrolling after submitting form &amp; reloading page.</li>
<li>Format output of <code>{subscriber_count}</code> tag.</li>
<li>You can now use <code>&lt;img&gt;</code> in your form messages.</li>
<li>Add Mailchimp API error code to debug log lines.</li>
<li>Add plugin name + version to User-Agent header for all Mailchimp API requests.</li>
<li>Make sure value of MC_LANGUAGE field is limited to 2 characters.</li>
</ul>
<h4>3.1.11 &#8211; July 5, 2016</h4>
<p><strong>Improvements</strong></p>
<ul>
<li>Update JavaScript dependencies for admin screens.</li>
<li>Test debug log &amp; show notice when it&#8217;s not writable.</li>
</ul>
<p><strong>Additions</strong></p>
<ul>
<li>Add &#8220;placeholder&#8221; option for dropdown fields.</li>
</ul>
<h4>3.1.10 &#8211; June 21, 2016</h4>
<p><strong>Fixes</strong></p>
<ul>
<li>Styles Builder in Premium not building because of incorrect flag in core plugin.</li>
</ul>
<p><strong>Improvements</strong></p>
<ul>
<li>Don&#8217;t show position option for WooCommerce integration when sign-up is implicit.</li>
<li>Improvements to form previewer logic.</li>
<li>Make sure admin notifications are always shown exactly one time.</li>
</ul>
<h4>3.1.9 &#8211; June 7, 2016</h4>
<p><strong>Fixes</strong></p>
<ul>
<li>Placeholder polyfill wasn&#8217;t loaded (only in IE8 and below).</li>
</ul>
<p><strong>Improvements</strong></p>
<ul>
<li>Don&#8217;t write to debug log if it is not writable.</li>
<li>Reset some CSS properties for commonly used class names in Form Editor &amp; Debug Log.</li>
<li>Do not unnecessarily register styles which are then immediately enqueued.</li>
</ul>
<p><strong>Additions</strong></p>
<ul>
<li>Add &#8220;is required field&#8221; option for dropdown &amp; radio fields in Field Helper.</li>
<li>Link to <a href="https://boxzillaplugin.com/" rel="nofollow ugc">Boxzilla plugin</a> from admin sidebar.</li>
</ul>
<h4>3.1.8 &#8211; May 23, 2016</h4>
<p><strong>Fixes</strong></p>
<ul>
<li>Form Preview mode replaced all titles on that page with &#8220;Form Preview&#8221;.</li>
<li>API class fix for <a href="https://www.mc4wp.com/kb/what-is-ecommerce/" rel="nofollow ugc">eCommerce360 functionality</a>.</li>
</ul>
<p><strong>Improvements</strong></p>
<ul>
<li>Show dismissible notice when API key is not set.</li>
<li>Show empty API key errors in plugin log.</li>
<li>Friendlier error message for re-subscribe failures.</li>
</ul>
<p><strong>Additions</strong></p>
<ul>
<li>Add <code>form.reset()</code> method to JS API.</li>
</ul>
<h4>3.1.7 &#8211; May 9, 2016</h4>
<p><strong>Fixes</strong></p>
<ul>
<li>Shortcode wasn&#8217;t accepting <code>element_id</code> as a valid attribute.</li>
<li>Take array style fields into account when checking if a form contains a given field.</li>
</ul>
<p><strong>Improvements</strong></p>
<ul>
<li>Nested fields will now be properly validated when they&#8217;re marked as required.</li>
<li>If plugin is installed using Composer, autoloader won&#8217;t be loaded (again).</li>
</ul>
<h4>3.1.6 &#8211; April 12, 2016</h4>
<p><strong>Fixes</strong></p>
<ul>
<li>Form event for starting a form was named <code>start</code> where it should have been <code>started</code>.</li>
</ul>
<p><strong>Improvements</strong></p>
<ul>
<li>Some preparations for the upcoming migration to the new Mailchimp API (version 3).</li>
<li>Consistent hook parameters for <code>mc4wp_form_subscribed</code> action.</li>
<li>Improved logic for rendering form response.</li>
</ul>
<p><strong>Additions</strong></p>
<ul>
<li>New checkbox position for WooCommerce checkout integration.</li>
</ul>
<h4>3.1.5 &#8211; March 22, 2016</h4>
<p><strong>Fixes</strong></p>
<ul>
<li>Response message was shown for unsubmitted forms when using <code>{response}</code> in the form mark-up with multiple forms on the same page.</li>
</ul>
<p><strong>Improvements</strong></p>
<ul>
<li>Scroll to form after form submission now uses native browser method <code>scrollIntoView()</code>.</li>
<li>Various improvements for right-to-left (RTL) sites.</li>
<li>The Mailchimp API key is now obfuscated on the settings page.</li>
<li>Contact Form 7 integration now uses an early hook priority to ensure we run before any page redirects.</li>
</ul>
<p><strong>Additions</strong></p>
<ul>
<li>Add position option for WooCommerce integration.</li>
<li>Add <code>{post}</code> tag whch can be used in form mark-up to fetch properties of the current page or post.</li>
</ul>
<h4>3.1.4 &#8211; February 29, 2016</h4>
<p><strong>Fixes</strong></p>
<ul>
<li>Forms with address fields never passing validation.</li>
</ul>
<p><strong>Improvements</strong></p>
<ul>
<li>Perform type checks on global variables to prevent issues with poorly coded plugins.</li>
<li>Add Interest Category ID to list overview table for easier debugging.</li>
<li>Updated Russian translations.</li>
</ul>
<h4>3.1.3 &#8211; February 17, 2016</h4>
<p><strong>Fixes</strong></p>
<ul>
<li>Issue with API array responses (for the <a href="https://wordpress.org/plugins/mc4wp-activity/">Mailchimp Activity add-on</a>, for example).</li>
</ul>
<p><strong>Improvements</strong></p>
<ul>
<li>Updated Dutch, Portugese, Spanish and Italian translations.</li>
</ul>
<h4>3.1.2 &#8211; February 15, 2016</h4>
<p><strong>Fixes</strong></p>
<ul>
<li>Form JavaScript not working when another plugins loads Dojo framework.</li>
<li>[ENTER] not submitting form settings or creating new-line.</li>
<li>Internal fields marked as required not passing form validation.</li>
<li>Deselecting all Mailchimp lists wouldn&#8217;t persist after saving form settings.</li>
<li>No sign-up request firing for lists with only an <code>EMAIL</code> field.</li>
</ul>
<p><strong>Improvements</strong></p>
<ul>
<li>Show accepted choice values for dropdown and radio fields in lists overview.</li>
<li>Use all Mailchimp lists for Lists Choice field, instead of just the selected ones.</li>
<li>Failsafed JavaScript for when any other script loads RequireJS globally.</li>
</ul>
<p><strong>Additions</strong></p>
<ul>
<li>Added support for <a href="https://wordpress.org/plugins/shortcode-ui/">Shortcake</a> plugin.</li>
<li>Error message for when no list is selected can now be customized from the form message settings.</li>
</ul>
<h4>3.1.1 &#8211; February 1, 2016</h4>
<p><strong>Fixes</strong></p>
<ul>
<li>Field Helper not adding <code>type</code> attribute when building forms.</li>
<li>Field Helper not setting the correct <code>value</code> attribute for Hidden Groups.</li>
</ul>
<p><strong>Improvements</strong></p>
<ul>
<li>Add sourcemaps to minified JavaScript files.</li>
<li>Add link to article on how to enable debug logging.</li>
<li>Field Helper now always shows both placeholder and value fields.</li>
</ul>
<h4>3.1 &#8211; January 26, 2016</h4>
<p><strong>Fixes</strong></p>
<ul>
<li><code>&lt;input&gt;</code> fields being stripped from form when saving as a role other than &#8220;superadmin&#8221; on MultiSite installations.</li>
<li>Certain actions like &#8220;renew lists&#8221; not working for users other than admin (if they have explicit access to settings pages).</li>
</ul>
<p><strong>Improvements</strong></p>
<ul>
<li>Show Akamai firewall reference number when site&#8217;s IP address is blocked</li>
<li>Make sure integrations have a Mailchimp list selected before trying to subscribe.</li>
<li>Move less important settings to &#8220;Other&#8221; page.</li>
<li>When a field is required in Mailchimp, it has to be required in forms as well now.</li>
<li>Allow including a <code>_mc4wp_email_type</code> field in forms to set an explicit email type.</li>
<li>Miscellaneous overall performance improvements.</li>
</ul>
<p><strong>Additions</strong></p>
<ul>
<li>Added <a href="https://www.mc4wp.com/kb/how-to-enable-log-debugging/" rel="nofollow ugc">debug logging</a>, which shows all warnings &amp; errors the plugin encountered in communicating with Mailchimp.</li>
<li>Add <code>get_lists_for_email( $email )</code> method to API class.</li>
<li>Add <code>MC4WP_Queue</code> class for better background processing of expensive operations.</li>
</ul>
<h4>3.0.12 &#8211; January 15, 2016</h4>
<p><strong>Fixes</strong></p>
<ul>
<li>Incorrect hooks being fired for successful and unsuccessful form sign-ups (which also broke the success redirect).</li>
</ul>
<h4>3.0.11 &#8211; January 14, 2016</h4>
<p><strong>Improvements</strong></p>
<ul>
<li>Allow splitting up &#8220;birthday&#8221; and &#8220;date&#8221; fields into separate fields with <code>day</code>, <code>month</code> and <code>year</code> index.</li>
<li>Improved algorithm for finding fields when integrating with Contact Form 7 or other custom forms.</li>
<li>Ninja Forms integration can now automatically find name-fields.</li>
<li>Ninja Forms integration can now use <code>mc4wp-</code> prefixed admin labels.</li>
</ul>
<p><strong>Additions</strong></p>
<ul>
<li><code>add_ecommerce_order()</code> and <code>delete_ecommerce_order()</code> methods to API class.</li>
</ul>
<h4>3.0.10 &#8211; January 6, 2016</h4>
<p><strong>Fixes</strong></p>
<ul>
<li>500 server error for &#8220;already subscribed&#8221; on Windows servers.</li>
<li>Incorrect HTML being generated for hidden fields.</li>
<li>Duplicate sign-up request when using CF7 integration.</li>
</ul>
<p><strong>Improvements</strong></p>
<ul>
<li>Stop logging &#8220;already subscribed&#8221; errors to PHP&#8217;s error log.</li>
<li>Simplify <code>pattern</code> attribute for <code>date</code> fields.</li>
<li>Remove invalid <code>autofill</code> attribute from honeypot field.</li>
</ul>
<h4>3.0.9 &#8211; December 17, 2015</h4>
<p><strong>Fixes</strong></p>
<p>Not being able to select a list when creating a new form.</p>
<h4>3.0.8 &#8211; December 15, 2015</h4>
<p><strong>Fixes</strong></p>
<ul>
<li>Make sure <code>mc4wp_show_form()</code> works without passing a form ID.</li>
</ul>
<p><strong>Improvements</strong></p>
<ul>
<li>Remove UI for bulk-enabling integrations, as every integration needs specific settings anyway.</li>
<li>Do not print inline JavaScript for forms until it&#8217;s surely needed.</li>
<li>Add <code>position</code> key to <code>mc4wp_admin_menu_items</code> filter to set a menu position.</li>
<li>Various minor code improvements.</li>
</ul>
<h4>3.0.7 &#8211; December 10, 2015</h4>
<p><strong>Fixes</strong></p>
<p>Workaround for <a href="https://core.trac.wordpress.org/ticket/34935" rel="nofollow ugc">SSL certification bug in WordPress 4.4</a>, affecting servers with an older versions of OpenSSL installed.</p>
<p><strong>Additions</strong></p>
<p>Added <code>mc4wp_use_sslverify</code> filter to disable or explicitly enable SSL certificate verification.</p>
<h4>3.0.4 &#8211; December 7, 2015</h4>
<p><strong>Fixes</strong></p>
<ul>
<li>Fixes compatibility issues with add-on plugins performing validation, like Goodbye Captcha and BWS Captcha.</li>
</ul>
<p><strong>Improvements</strong></p>
<ul>
<li>Now using group ID&#8217;s for interest grouping fields, so changing the group in Mailchimp does not require updating your form code.</li>
<li>Never load enabled integrations which are not installed.</li>
<li>Reintroduce support for automatically sending <code>OPTIN_IP</code></li>
</ul>
<p><strong>Additions</strong></p>
<ul>
<li>Add filter: <code>mc4wp_form_data</code>, filters form data before it is processed.</li>
</ul>
<h4>3.0.3 &#8211; November 30, 2015</h4>
<p><strong>Fixes</strong></p>
<ul>
<li>Added backwards compatibility for <a href="https://wordpress.org/plugins/goodbye-captcha/">Goodbye Captcha</a> integration.</li>
</ul>
<p><strong>Improvements</strong></p>
<ul>
<li>Prevented notice when saving Form widget settings for the first time.</li>
<li>Add <code>autofill="off"</code> to honeypot field.</li>
<li>Remove nonces from forms as they&#8217;re not really useful for publicly available features.</li>
<li>Errors returned by Mailchimp are now logged for Forms as well.</li>
<li>Pre-select Mailchimp list if there&#8217;s just one list in the connected account.</li>
<li>Added missing translation calls for Form Editor.</li>
</ul>
<h4>3.0.2 &#8211; November 25, 2015</h4>
<p><strong>Fixes</strong></p>
<ul>
<li>Redirect on success not working.</li>
<li>Forms overview page redirected to main WP Admin page (edge case).</li>
<li>Safari was always showing the leave-page confirmation dialog.</li>
</ul>
<p><strong>Improvements</strong></p>
<ul>
<li>Add form-specific classes to preview form element. This allows the <a href="https://www.mc4wp.com/premium-features/" rel="nofollow ugc">Styles Builder</a> to work with the Form Preview.</li>
<li>Form events are now triggered <em>after</em> the page has finished loading, so all scripts are loaded &amp; ready to use.</li>
<li>Reset background-color in Form Themes stylesheets.</li>
</ul>
<h4>3.0.0 &amp; 3.0.1 &#8211; November 23, 2015</h4>
<p>Version 3.0 is a total revamp of the plugin. For a quick overview of the changes, please <a href="https://www.mc4wp.com/blog/whats-new-in-mailchimp-for-wordpress-the-big-three-o/" rel="nofollow ugc">read this post on our blog</a>.</p>
<p>Before upgrading, please go through the <a href="https://www.mc4wp.com/kb/upgrading-to-3-0/" rel="nofollow ugc">upgrade guide</a> as some things have changed.</p>
<p><strong>Breaking Changes</strong></p>
<ul>
<li>Captcha fields: <code>{captcha}</code> field is now handled by the <a href="https://wordpress.org/plugins/mc4wp-captcha/">Captcha add-on plugin</a>.</li>
<li>New dynamic content tags syntax: <code>{data_NAME}</code> is now <code>{data key="NAME"}</code></li>
<li>Event binding: <code>jQuery(document).on('subscribe.mc4wp','.mc4wp-form', function(){ ... })</code> is now <code>mc4wp.forms.on('subscribed', function(form) { ... })</code></li>
<li>Removed integrations: MultiSite &amp; bbPress.</li>
</ul>
<p><strong>Improvements</strong></p>
<ul>
<li>New form editor with syntax highlighting, more advanced field options &amp; better visual feedback.</li>
<li>Better support for Mailchimp <code>address</code> fields.</li>
<li>Better support for choice fields (eg groupings, list choice &amp; country fields).</li>
<li>All fields marked as <code>required</code> are now validated server-side as well (instead of just Mailchimp required fields).</li>
<li>All integrations have their own settings page now.</li>
<li>Events Manager: checkbox is now automatically added to booking forms.</li>
<li>Tons of usability &amp; accessibility improvements.</li>
<li>Tons of code improvements: improved memory usage, 100+ new unit tests &amp; better usage of various best practices.</li>
<li>The <a href="https://www.mc4wp.com/" rel="nofollow ugc">premium plugin</a> is now an add-on of this plugin.</li>
</ul>
<p><strong>Additions</strong></p>
<ul>
<li>New &#8220;Preview Form&#8221; option, showing unsaved form changes.</li>
<li>Integrations can now be &#8220;implicit&#8221;, thus no longer showing a checkbox option to visitors.</li>
<li>New JavaScript API, replacing jQuery event hooks.</li>
<li>Ninja Forms integration</li>
<li>Introduced various new filter &amp; action hooks, please see the new <a href="http://developer.mc4wp.com/" rel="nofollow ugc">code reference for developers</a> for more information.</li>
</ul>
<h4>2.3.18 &#8211; November 2, 2015</h4>
<p><strong>Fixes</strong></p>
<ul>
<li>Incorrect number of parameters for <code>error_log</code> statement in integrations class.</li>
</ul>
<p><strong>Improvements</strong></p>
<ul>
<li>Usage tracking is now scheduled once a week (instead of daily).</li>
<li>Preparations for <a href="https://www.mc4wp.com/blog/breaking-backwards-compatibility-in-version-3-0/" rel="nofollow ugc">the upcoming Mailchimp for WordPress version 3.0 release</a>.</li>
<li>Tested compatibility with WordPress 4.4</li>
</ul>
<h4>2.3.17 &#8211; October 22, 2015</h4>
<p><strong>Fixes</strong></p>
<ul>
<li>Honeypot field being autofilled in Chrome, causing a form error.</li>
</ul>
<p><strong>Improvements</strong></p>
<ul>
<li>Updated Portugese translations.</li>
</ul>
<h4>2.3.16 &#8211; October 14, 2015</h4>
<p><strong>Fixes</strong></p>
<ul>
<li>Error in Russian translation, causing a broken link on the Mailchimp settings page.</li>
</ul>
<p><strong>Improvements</strong></p>
<ul>
<li>Textual improvements to Mailchimp settings page.</li>
<li>Connectivity issues with Mailchimp will now <em>always</em> show an error message.</li>
<li>Renewing Mailchimp lists will now also update the output of the <code>{subscriber_count}</code> tag.</li>
</ul>
<h4>2.3.15 &#8211; October 9, 2015</h4>
<p><strong>Fixes</strong></p>
<ul>
<li>Fixes JS error when form contains no submit button</li>
</ul>
<p><strong>Improvements</strong></p>
<ul>
<li>Only prefix <code>url</code> fields with <code>http://</code> if it is filled.</li>
<li>Updated Spanish &amp; Catalan translations, thanks to <a href="http://www.xaviergimeno.net/" rel="nofollow ugc">Xavier Gimeno Torrent</a>.</li>
<li>Fix <code>mc4wp_form_before_fields</code> being applied twice.</li>
<li>Position honeypot field to the right for Right-To-Left sites.</li>
<li><code>_mc4wp_lists</code> can now be a comma-separated string of Mailchimp list ID&#8217;s to subscribe to (or an array).</li>
<li>Minor other defensive coding improvements to prevent clashes with other plugins.</li>
</ul>
<p><strong>Additions</strong></p>
<ul>
<li>Added opt-in usage tracking to help us make the plugin better. No sensitive data is tracked.</li>
</ul>
<h4>2.3.14 &#8211; September 25</h4>
<p><strong>Fixes</strong></p>
<ul>
<li>Use of undefined constant in previous update.</li>
</ul>
<h4>2.3.13 &#8211; September 25, 2015</h4>
<p><strong>Fixes</strong></p>
<ul>
<li>Honeypot causing horizontal scrollbar on RTL sites.</li>
<li>List choice fields not showing when using one of the default form themes.</li>
</ul>
<p><strong>Improvements</strong></p>
<ul>
<li>Minor styling improvements for RTL sites.</li>
<li>Mailchimp list fields of type &#8220;website&#8221; will now become HTML5 <code>url</code> type fields.</li>
<li>Auto-prefix fields of type <code>url</code> with <code>http://</code></li>
</ul>
<h4>2.3.12 &#8211; September 21, 2015</h4>
<p><strong>Fixes</strong></p>
<ul>
<li>Issue with interest groupings not being fetched after updating to version 2.3.11</li>
</ul>
<h4>2.3.11 &#8211; September 21, 2015</h4>
<p><strong>Fixes</strong></p>
<ul>
<li>Honeypot field being filled by browser&#8217;s autocomplete.</li>
<li>Styling issue for submit buttons in Mobile Safari.</li>
<li>Empty response from Mailchimp API</li>
</ul>
<p><strong>Improvements</strong></p>
<ul>
<li>Do not query Mailchimp API for interest groupings if list has none.</li>
<li>Integration errors are now logged to PHP&#8217;s error log for easier debugging.</li>
</ul>
<p><strong>Additions</strong></p>
<ul>
<li>You can now use shortcodes in the form content.</li>
</ul>
<h4>2.3.10 &#8211; September 7, 2015</h4>
<p><strong>Fixes</strong></p>
<ul>
<li>Showing &#8220;not connected&#8221; when the plugin was actually connected to Mailchimp.</li>
<li>Issue with <code>address</code> fields when <code>addr1</code> was not given.</li>
<li>Comment form checkbox not outputted for some older themes.</li>
</ul>
<p><strong>Improvements</strong></p>
<ul>
<li>Do not flush Mailchimp cache on every settings save.</li>
<li>Add default CSS styles for <code>number</code> fields.</li>
<li>Placeholders will now work in older version of IE as well.</li>
</ul>
<h4>2.3.9 &#8211; September 1, 2015</h4>
<p><strong>Improvements</strong></p>
<ul>
<li>Mailchimp lists cache is now automatically flushed after changing your API key setting.</li>
<li>Better field population after submitting a form with errors.</li>
<li>More helpful error message when no list is selected.</li>
<li>Translate options when installing plugin from a language other than English.</li>
<li>Add form mark-up to WPML configuration file.</li>
<li>Sign-up checkbox in comment form is now shown before the &#8220;submit comment&#8221; button.</li>
<li>URL-encode variables in &#8220;Redirect URL&#8221; setting.</li>
<li>Better error message when connected to Mailchimp but account has no lists.</li>
</ul>
<p><strong>Additions</strong></p>
<ul>
<li>Add <code>mc4wp_form_action</code> filter to set a custom <code>action</code> attribute on the form element.</li>
</ul>
<h4>2.3.8 &#8211; August 18, 2015</h4>
<p><strong>Fixes</strong></p>
<ul>
<li>Prevented JS error when outputting forms with no submit button.</li>
<li>Using <code>0</code> as a Redirect URL resulted in a blank page.</li>
<li>Sign-up checkbox was showing twice in the Easy Digital Downloads checkout when showing registration fields, thanks <a href="https://github.com/growdev" rel="nofollow ugc">Daniel Espinoza</a>.</li>
<li>Default form was not automatically translated for languages other than English.</li>
</ul>
<p><strong>Improvements</strong></p>
<ul>
<li>Better way to hide the honeypot field, which stops bots from subscribing to your lists.</li>
<li>role=&#8221;form&#8221; is no longer needed, thanks <a href="https://github.com/XhmikosR" rel="nofollow ugc">XhmikosR</a>!</li>
<li>Filter <code>mc4wp_form_animate_scroll</code> now disables just the scroll animation, not the scroll itself.</li>
<li>Revamped UI for Mailchimp lists overview</li>
<li>Updated German &amp; Greek translations.</li>
</ul>
<p><strong>Additions</strong></p>
<ul>
<li>Added <code>mc4wp_form_is_submitted()</code> and <code>mc4wp_form_get_response_html()</code> functions.</li>
</ul>
<h4>2.3.7 &#8211; July 13, 2015</h4>
<p><strong>Improvements</strong></p>
<ul>
<li>Use the same order as Mailchimp.com, which is useful when you have over 100 Mailchimp lists.</li>
<li>Use <code>/* ... */</code> for inline JavaScript comments to prevent errors with minified HTML &#8211; props <a href="https://github.com/egifford" rel="nofollow ugc">Ed Gifford</a></li>
</ul>
<p><strong>Additions</strong></p>
<ul>
<li>Filter: <code>mc4wp_form_animate_scroll</code> to disable animated scroll-to after submitting a form.</li>
<li>Add <code>{current_path}</code> variable to use in form templates.</li>
<li>Add <code>default</code> attribute to <code>{data_name}</code> variables, usage: <code>{data_something default="The default value"}</code></li>
</ul>
<h4>2.3.6 &#8211; July 6, 2015</h4>
<p><strong>Fixes</strong></p>
<ul>
<li>Undefined index notice when visitor&#8217;s USER_AGENT is not set.</li>
</ul>
<p><strong>Improvements</strong></p>
<ul>
<li>Relayed the browser&#8217;s Accept-Language header to Mailchimp for auto-detecting a subscriber&#8217;s language.</li>
<li>Better CSS for form reset</li>
<li>Updated HTML5 placeholder polyfill</li>
</ul>
<h4>2.3.5 &#8211; June 24, 2015</h4>
<p><strong>Fixes</strong></p>
<ul>
<li>Faulty update for v3.0 appearing for people running GitHub updater plugin.</li>
</ul>
<p><strong>Improvements</strong></p>
<ul>
<li>Updated language files.</li>
<li>Now passing the form as a parameter to <code>mc4wp_form_css_classes</code> filter.</li>
</ul>
<h4>2.3.4 &#8211; May 29, 2015</h4>
<p><strong>Fixes</strong></p>
<ul>
<li>Issue with GROUPINGS not being sent to Mailchimp</li>
</ul>
<p><strong>Improvements</strong></p>
<ul>
<li>Code preview in Field Builder is now read-only</li>
</ul>
<h4>2.3.3 &#8211; May 27, 2015</h4>
<p><strong>Fixes</strong></p>
<ul>
<li>Get correct IP address when using proxy like Cloudflare or Sucuri WAF.</li>
<li>Use strict type check for printing inline CSS that hides honeypot field</li>
</ul>
<p><strong>Improvements</strong></p>
<ul>
<li>Add <code>contactemail</code> and <code>contactname</code> to field name guesses when integrating with third-party form.</li>
<li>Re-enable <code>sslverify</code></li>
</ul>
<h4>2.3.2 &#8211; May 12, 2015</h4>
<p><strong>Fixes</strong></p>
<ul>
<li>Groupings not being sent to Mailchimp</li>
<li>Issue when using more than one <code>{data_xx}</code> replacement</li>
</ul>
<p><strong>Improvements</strong></p>
<ul>
<li>IE8 compatibility for honeypot fallback script.</li>
</ul>
<h4>2.3.1 &#8211; May 6, 2015</h4>
<p><strong>Fixes</strong></p>
<ul>
<li>PHP notice in <code>includes/class-tools.php</code>, introduced by version 2.3.</li>
</ul>
<h4>2.3 &#8211; May 6, 2015</h4>
<p><strong>Fixes</strong></p>
<ul>
<li>The email address is no longer automatically added to the Redirect URL as this is against Google Analytics policy. To add it again, use <code>?email={email}</code> in your Redirect URL setting.</li>
<li>Registration type integrations were not correctly picking up on first- and last names.</li>
<li>JavaScript error in IE8 because of <code>setAttribute</code> call on honeypot field.</li>
<li>API class <code>subscribe</code> method now always returns a boolean.</li>
</ul>
<p><strong>Improvements</strong></p>
<ul>
<li>Add <code>role</code> attribute to form elements</li>
<li>Major code refactoring for easier unit testing and improved code readability.</li>
<li>Use Composer for autoloading all plugin classes (PHP 5.2 compatible)</li>
<li>You can now use <a href="https://www.mc4wp.com/kb/using-variables-in-your-form-or-messages/" rel="nofollow ugc">form variables in both forms, messages as checkbox label texts</a>.</li>
</ul>
<p><strong>Additions</strong></p>
<ul>
<li>You can now handle unsubscribe calls with our forms too.</li>
<li>Added Portugese, Indonesian, German (CH) and Spanish (PR) translations.</li>
</ul>

<p><em>Allowing your visitors to subscribe to your newsletter should be easy. With this plugin, it finally is.</em></p>
<p>This plugin helps you grow your Mailchimp lists and write better newsletters through various methods. You can create good looking opt-in forms or integrate with any existing form on your site, like your comment, contact or checkout form.</p>
<span class="embed-youtube" style="text-align:center; display: block;"><iframe class='youtube-player' type='text/html' width='640' height='360' src='https://www.youtube.com/embed/fZCYPnFybqU?version=3&#038;rel=1&#038;fs=1&#038;autohide=2&#038;showsearch=0&#038;showinfo=1&#038;iv_load_policy=1&#038;wmode=transparent' allowfullscreen='true' style='border:0;'></iframe></span>
<h4>Some (but not all) features</h4>
<ul>
<li>
<p>Connect with your Mailchimp account in seconds.</p>
</li>
<li>
<p>Sign-up forms which are good looking, user-friendly and mobile optimized. You have complete control over the form fields and can send anything you like to Mailchimp.</p>
</li>
<li>
<p>Seamless integration with the following plugins:</p>
<ul>
<li>Default WordPress Comment Form</li>
<li>Default WordPress Registration Form</li>
<li>Contact Form 7</li>
<li>WooCommerce</li>
<li>Gravity Forms</li>
<li>Ninja Forms 3</li>
<li>WPForms</li>
<li>BuddyPress</li>
<li>MemberPress</li>
<li>Events Manager</li>
<li>Easy Digital Downloads</li>
<li>Give</li>
<li>UltimateMember</li>
</ul>
</li>
<li>
<p>A multitude of available add-on plugins and integrations:</p>
<ul>
<li><a href="https://www.mc4wp.com/#utm_source=wp-plugin-repo&amp;utm_medium=mailchimp-for-wp&amp;utm_campaign=add-on-list" rel="nofollow ugc">Mailchimp for WordPress Premium</a></li>
<li><a href="https://wordpress.org/plugins/mailchimp-top-bar/">Mailchimp Top Bar</a></li>
<li><a href="https://wordpress.org/plugins/mc4wp-activity/">Mailchimp Activity</a></li>
<li><a href="https://wordpress.org/plugins/boxzilla/">Boxzilla Pop-ups</a></li>
<li><a href="https://www.google.com/recaptcha/" rel="nofollow ugc">Google reCAPTCHA</a></li>
<li><a href="https://wordpress.org/plugins/goodbye-captcha/">WPBruiser anti-spam</a></li>
</ul>
</li>
<li>
<p>Well documented. Our <a href="https://www.mc4wp.com/kb/" rel="nofollow ugc">knowledge base</a> is updated daily.</p>
</li>
<li>
<p>Developer friendly. For inspiration, check out our <a href="https://github.com/ibericode/mc4wp-snippets" rel="nofollow ugc">repository of example code snippets</a>.</p>
</li>
</ul>
<blockquote>
<h4>Become a Premium user</h4>
<p>Mailchimp for WordPress has a Premium add-on which comes with several additional benefits.</p>
<ul>
<li>Multiple forms</li>
<li>Advanced e-commerce integration for WooCommerce</li>
<li>Email notifications</li>
<li>An easy way to style your forms</li>
<li>Detailed reports &amp; statistics</li>
</ul>
<p><a href="https://www.mc4wp.com/features/#utm_source=wp-plugin-repo&amp;utm_medium=mailchimp-for-wp&amp;utm_campaign=after-features-link" rel="nofollow ugc">View more Premium features</a></p>
</blockquote>
<h4>What is Mailchimp?</h4>
<p>Mailchimp is a newsletter service that allows you to send out email campaigns to a list of email subscribers. It is free for lists up to 2000 subscribers, which is why it is the newsletter-service of choice for thousands of businesses.</p>
<p>This plugin allows you to tightly integrate your WordPress site with your Mailchimp account.</p>
<p>If you are not yet using Mailchimp, <a href="http://mailchimp.com/monkey-rewards/?utm_source=freemium_newsletter&amp;utm_medium=email&amp;utm_campaign=monkey_rewards&amp;aid=a2d08947dcd3683512ce174c5&amp;afl=1" rel="nofollow ugc">creating an account is 100% free and only takes you about 30 seconds</a>.</p>
<h4>Support</h4>
<p>Use the <a href="https://wordpress.org/support/plugin/mailchimp-for-wp">WordPress.org plugin forums</a> for community support where we try to help all of our users. If you found a bug, please create an issue on Github where we can act upon them more efficiently.</p>
<p>If you&#8217;re a premium user, please use the email address inside the plugin for support as that will guarantee a faster response time.</p>
<p>Please take a look at the <a href="https://www.mc4wp.com/kb/#utm_source=wp-plugin-repo&amp;utm_medium=mailchimp-for-wp&amp;utm_campaign=description" rel="nofollow ugc">Mailchimp for WordPress knowledge base</a> as well.</p>
<h4>Add-on plugins</h4>
<p>There are several <a href="https://www.mc4wp.com/add-ons/#utm_source=wp-plugin-repo&amp;utm_medium=mailchimp-for-wp&amp;utm_campaign=description" rel="nofollow ugc">add-on plugins</a> available, which help you get even more out of your site.</p>
<h4>Translations</h4>
<p>You can <a href="https://translate.wordpress.org/projects/wp-plugins/mailchimp-for-wp/stable/" rel="nofollow ugc">help translate Mailchimp for WordPress into your language</a> using your WordPress.org account.</p>
<h4>Development</h4>
<p>This plugin is being developed on GitHub. If you want to collaborate, please look at <a href="https://github.com/ibericode/mailchimp-for-wordpress" rel="nofollow ugc">ibericode/mailchimp-for-wordpress</a>.</p>
<h4>Customizing the plugin</h4>
<p>The plugin provides various filter &amp; action hooks that allow you to modify or extend default behavior. We&#8217;re also maintaining a <a href="https://github.com/ibericode/mc4wp-snippets" rel="nofollow ugc">collection of sample code snippets</a>.</p>

full control of your WordPress edit screens &amp; custom field data.</p>
<p><strong>Add fields on demand.</strong> Our field builder allows you to quickly and easily add fields to WP edit screens with only the click of a few buttons!</p>
<p><strong>Add them anywhere.</strong> Fields can be added all over WP including posts, users, taxonomy terms, media, comments and even custom options pages!</p>
<p><strong>Show them everywhere.</strong> Load and display your custom field values in any theme template file with our hassle free developer friendly functions!</p>
<h4>Features</h4>
<ul>
<li>Simple &amp; Intuitive</li>
<li>Powerful Functions</li>
<li>Over 30 Field Types</li>
<li>Extensive Documentation</li>
<li>Millions of Users</li>
</ul>

<li><strong>Visit</strong> Plugins &gt; Add New</li>
<li><strong>Search</strong> for &#8220;Advanced Custom Fields&#8221;</li>
<li><strong>Activate</strong> Advanced Custom Fields from your Plugins page</li>
<li><strong>Click</strong> on the new menu item &#8220;Custom Fields&#8221; and create your first Custom Field Group!</li>
<li><strong>Read</strong> the documentation to <a href="https://www.advancedcustomfields.com/resources/getting-started-with-acf/" rel="nofollow ugc">get started</a></li>

";s:3:"faq";s:1053:"
<h4>What kind of support do you provide?</h4>
<p>
<p><strong>Help Desk.</strong> Support is currently provided via our email help desk. Questions are generally answered within 24 hours, with the exception of weekends and holidays. We answer questions related to ACF, its usage and provide minor customization guidance. We cannot guarantee support for questions which include custom theme code, or 3rd party plugin conflicts &amp; compatibility. <a href="https://www.advancedcustomfields.com/support/" rel="nofollow ugc">Open a Support Ticket</a></p>
<p><strong>Support Forums.</strong> Our Community Forums provide a great resource for searching and finding previously answered and asked support questions. You may create a new thread on these forums, however, it is not guaranteed that you will receive an answer from our support team. This is more of an area for developers to talk to one another, post ideas, plugins and provide basic help. <a href="https://support.advancedcustomfields.com/" rel="nofollow ugc">View the Support Forum</a></p>
</p>

";s:9:"changelog";s:15014:"<h4>5.8.9</h4>
<p><em>Release Date &#8211; 26 March 2020</em></p>
<ul>
<li>Fix &#8211; Fixed bug in ACF Blocks causing default &#8220;align&#8221; property to be ignored.</li>
<li>Fix &#8211; Fixed bug allowing Taxonomy field to save terms to a non &#8220;post&#8221; object.</li>
<li>Tweak &#8211; Improved User field AJAX query performance.</li>
<li>Tweak &#8211; Improved logic that determines width of Range field input.</li>
<li>Tweak &#8211; Improved styling of ACF Blocks components.</li>
<li>Dev &#8211; Added new &#8220;acf/register_block_type_args&#8221; filter.</li>
<li>Dev &#8211; Added new generic ACF_Ajax_Query and ACF_Ajax_Query_Users classes.</li>
<li>i18n &#8211; Updated French Canadian translation thanks to Bérenger Zyla.</li>
<li>i18n &#8211; Updated Traditional Chinese translation thanks to Audi Lu.</li>
<li>i18n &#8211; Updated German translation thanks to Ralf Koller.</li>
<li>i18n &#8211; Updated Portuguese language thanks to Pedro Mendonça.</li>
</ul>
<h4>5.8.8</h4>
<p><em>Release Date &#8211; 4 March 2020</em></p>
<ul>
<li>Fix &#8211; Fixed bug in <code>have_rows()</code> function causing a PHP warning when no value is found.</li>
<li>Fix &#8211; Fixed bug in Google Maps field causing marker to snap to nearest address.</li>
<li>Fix &#8211; Avoid Nav Menu items displaying twice in WordPress 5.4.</li>
<li>Tweak &#8211; Added place name data to Google Maps field value.</li>
<li>Tweak &#8211; Improved performance of PHP registered fields.</li>
<li>Dev &#8211; Added new &#8220;acf/prepare_field_group_for_import&#8221; filter.</li>
<li>i18n &#8211; Added Traditional Chinese translation thanks to Audi Lu.</li>
<li>i18n &#8211; Added Catalan translation thanks to Jordi Tarrida.</li>
<li>i18n &#8211; Updated French translation thanks to Maxime Bernard-Jacquet &amp; Bérenger Zyla.</li>
</ul>
<h4>5.8.7</h4>
<p><em>Release Date &#8211; 12 November 2019</em></p>
<ul>
<li>New &#8211; Updated admin CSS for new WordPress 5.3 styling.</li>
<li>Fix &#8211; Fixed various issues affecting dynamic metaboxes in the block editor (requires WordPress 5.3)</li>
<li>Fix &#8211; Fixed performance issue when checking network sites for upgrades.</li>
<li>Fix &#8211; Fixed Select2 clones appearing after duplicating a Relationship field.</li>
<li>Tweak &#8211; Repeater field &#8220;Add row&#8221; icons will now hide when maximum rows are reached.</li>
<li>Tweak &#8211; Removed ACF Blocks keyword limit for later versions of Gutenberg.</li>
</ul>
<h4>5.8.6</h4>
<p><em>Release Date &#8211; 24 October 2019</em></p>
<ul>
<li>New &#8211; Added more data to Google Maps field value including place_id, street_name, country and more.</li>
<li>Fix &#8211; Fixed bug in Gallery field incorrectly displaying .pdf attachments as icons.</li>
<li>Fix &#8211; Fixed bug in Checkbox field missing &#8220;selected&#8221; class after &#8220;Toggle All&#8221;.</li>
<li>Dev &#8211; Added compatibility for Attachments in the Post Taxonomy location rule.</li>
<li>Dev &#8211; Added missing return statement from <code>acf_get_form()</code> function.</li>
<li>Dev &#8211; Added &#8220;google_map_result&#8221; JS filter.</li>
</ul>
<h4>5.8.5</h4>
<p><em>Release Date &#8211; 8 October 2019</em></p>
<ul>
<li>New &#8211; Added new choice &#8220;Add&#8221; to the User Form location rule.</li>
<li>New &#8211; Optimized <code>acf_form()</code> logic when used in combination with <code>acf_register_form()</code>.</li>
<li>Fix &#8211; Fixed bug causing incorrect field order after sync.</li>
<li>Fix &#8211; Fixed bug reverting the first field type to Text in Firefox version 69.0.1.</li>
<li>Fix &#8211; Fixed bug causing tinymce issues when changing between block modes.</li>
<li>Fix &#8211; Fixed bug preventing block registration when category does not exist.</li>
<li>Fix &#8211; Fixed bug preventing block registration when no icon is declared.</li>
<li>Dev &#8211; Added RegExp compatibility for innerBlocks.</li>
</ul>
<h4>5.8.4</h4>
<p><em>Release Date &#8211; 3 September 2019</em></p>
<ul>
<li>New &#8211; Optimized Relationship field by delaying AJAX call until UI is visible.</li>
<li>Fix &#8211; Fixed bug incorrectly escaping HTML in the Link field title.</li>
<li>Fix &#8211; Fixed bug showing Discussion and Comment metaboxes for newly imported field groups.</li>
<li>Fix &#8211; Fixed PHP warning when loading meta from Post 0.</li>
<li>Dev &#8211; Ensure Checkbox field value is an array even when empty.</li>
<li>Dev &#8211; Added new <code>ACF_MAJOR_VERSION</code> constant.</li>
</ul>
<h4>5.8.3</h4>
<p><em>Release Date &#8211; 7 August 2019</em></p>
<ul>
<li>Tweak &#8211; Changed Options Page location rules to show &#8220;page_title&#8221; instead of &#8220;menu_title&#8221;.</li>
<li>Fix &#8211; Fixed bug causing Textarea field to incorrectly validate maxlength.</li>
<li>Fix &#8211; Fixed bug allowing Range field values outside of the min and max settings.</li>
<li>Fix &#8211; Fixed bug in block RegExp causing some blocks to miss the &#8220;acf/pre_save_block&#8221; filter.</li>
<li>Dev &#8211; Added <code>$block_type</code> parameter to block settings &#8220;enqueue_assets&#8221; callback.</li>
<li>i18n &#8211; Added French Canadian language thanks to Bérenger Zyla.</li>
<li>i18n &#8211; Updated French language thanks to Bérenger Zyla.</li>
</ul>
<h4>5.8.2</h4>
<p><em>Release Date &#8211; 15 July 2019</em></p>
<ul>
<li>Fix &#8211; Fixed bug where validation did not prevent new user registration.</li>
<li>Fix &#8211; Fixed bug causing some &#8220;reordered&#8221; metaboxes to not appear in the Gutenberg editor.</li>
<li>Fix &#8211; Fixed bug causing WYSIWYG field with delayed initialization to appear blank.</li>
<li>Fix &#8211; Fixed bug when editing a post and adding a new tag did not refresh metaboxes.</li>
<li>Dev &#8211; Added missing <code>$value</code> parameter in &#8220;acf/pre_format_value&#8221; filter.</li>
</ul>
<h4>5.8.1</h4>
<p><em>Release Date &#8211; 3 June 2019</em></p>
<ul>
<li>New &#8211; Added &#8220;Preview Size&#8221; and &#8220;Return Format&#8221; settings to the Gallery field.</li>
<li>Tweak &#8211; Improved metabox styling for Gutenberg.</li>
<li>Tweak &#8211; Changed default &#8220;Preview Size&#8221; to medium for the Image field.</li>
<li>Fix &#8211; Fixed bug in media modal causing the primary button text to disappear after editing an image.</li>
<li>Fix &#8211; Fixed bug preventing the TinyMCE Advanced plugin from adding <code>&lt; p &gt;</code> tags.</li>
<li>Fix &#8211; Fixed bug where HTML choices were not visible in conditional logic dropdown.</li>
<li>Fix &#8211; Fixed bug causing incorrect order of imported/synced flexible content sub fields.</li>
<li>i18n &#8211; Updated German translation thanks to Ralf Koller.</li>
<li>i18n &#8211; Updated Persian translation thanks to Majix.</li>
</ul>
<h4>5.8.0</h4>
<p><em>Release Date &#8211; 8 May 2019</em></p>
<ul>
<li>New &#8211; Added ACF Blocks feature for ACF PRO.</li>
<li>Fix &#8211; Fixed bug causing duplicate &#8220;save metabox&#8221; AJAX requests in the Gutenberg editor.</li>
<li>Fix &#8211; Fixed bug causing incorrect Repeater field value order in AJAX requests.</li>
<li>Dev &#8211; Added JS filter <code>'relationship_ajax_data'</code> to customize Relationship field AJAX data.</li>
<li>Dev &#8211; Added <code>$field_group</code> parameter to <code>'acf/location/match_rule'</code> filter.</li>
<li>Dev &#8211; Bumped minimum supported PHP version to 5.4.0.</li>
<li>Dev &#8211; Bumped minimum supported WP version to 4.7.0.</li>
<li>i18n &#8211; Updated German translation thanks to Ralf Koller.</li>
<li>i18n &#8211; Updated Portuguese language thanks to Pedro Mendonça.</li>
</ul>
<h4>5.7.13</h4>
<p><em>Release Date &#8211; 6 March 2019</em></p>
<ul>
<li>Fix &#8211; Fixed bug causing issues with registered fields during <code>switch_to_blog()</code>.</li>
<li>Fix &#8211; Fixed bug preventing sub fields from being reused across multiple parents.</li>
<li>Fix &#8211; Fixed bug causing the <code>get_sub_field()</code> function to fail if a tab field exists with the same name as the selected field.</li>
<li>Fix &#8211; Fixed bug corrupting field settings since WP 5.1 when instructions contain <code>&lt; a target="" &gt;</code>.</li>
<li>Fix &#8211; Fixed bug in Gutenberg where custom metabox location (acf_after_title) did not show on initial page load.</li>
<li>Fix &#8211; Fixed bug causing issues when importing/syncing multiple field groups which contain a clone field.</li>
<li>Fix &#8211; Fixed bug preventing the AMP plugin preview from working.</li>
<li>Dev &#8211; Added new &#8216;pre&#8217; filters to get, update and delete meta functions.</li>
<li>i18n &#8211; Update Turkish translation thanks to Emre Erkan.</li>
</ul>
<h4>5.7.12</h4>

<li>Fix &#8211; Fixed bug where &#8220;sync&#8221; feature imported field groups without fields.</li>
<li>Fix &#8211; Fixed bug preventing <code>get_field_object()</code> working with a field key.</li>
<li>Fix &#8211; Fixed bug causing incorrect results in <code>get_sub_field()</code>.</li>
<li>Fix &#8211; Fixed bug causing draft and preview issues with serialized values.</li>
<li>Fix &#8211; Fixed bug causing reversed field group metabox order.</li>
<li>Fix &#8211; Fixed bug causing incorrect character count when validating values.</li>
<li>Fix &#8211; Fixed bug showing incorrect choices for post_template location rule.</li>
<li>Fix &#8211; Fixed bug causing incorrect value retrieval after <code>switch_to_blog()</code>.</li>
<li>i18n &#8211; Updated Persian translation thanks to Majix.</li>
</ul>

<li>Fix &#8211; Fixed bug affecting dynamic metabox check when selecting &#8220;default&#8221; page template.</li>
<li>Fix &#8211; Fixed bug where tab fields did not render correctly within a dynamic metabox.</li>

<li>Dev &#8211; Refactored various core functions.</li>

<ul>

<li>Tweak &#8211; Improved punctuation throughout admin notices.</li>
<li>Tweak &#8211; Improved performance and accuracy when loading a user field value.</li>

<li>Dev &#8211; Added filter &#8216;acf/allow_unfiltered_html&#8217; to customize if current user can save unfiltered HTML.</li>
<li>Dev &#8211; Added new data storage functions <code>acf_register_store()</code> and <code>acf_get_store()</code>.</li>
<li>Dev &#8211; Moved from .less to .scss and minified all css.</li>
<li>i18n &#8211; Updated French translation thanks to Maxime Bernard-Jacquet.</li>
<li>i18n &#8211; Updated Czech translation thanks to David Rychly.</li>

<li>Fix &#8211; Fixed bug where breaking out of a sub <code>have_rows()</code> loop could produce undesired results.</li>
<li>Dev &#8211; Added filter &#8216;acf/connect_attachment_to_post&#8217; to prevent connecting attachments to posts.</li>

<p><strong>Add fields on demand.</strong> Our field builder allows you to quickly and easily add fields to WP edit screens with only the click of a few buttons!</p>
<p><strong>Add them anywhere.</strong> Fields can be added all over WP including posts, users, taxonomy terms, media, comments and even custom options pages!</p>
<p><strong>Show them everywhere.</strong> Load and display your custom field values in any theme template file with our hassle free developer friendly functions!</p>
<h4>Features</h4>
<ul>
<li>Simple &amp; Intuitive</li>
<li>Powerful Functions</li>
<li>Over 30 Field Types</li>
<li>Extensive Documentation</li>
<li>Millions of Users</li>
